интересует, так это то уважение, которое они уделяют этим традициям. В Бурятии
большое количество интересных природных образований, являющихся священными
местами шаманов, которые я планирую посетить. Одно из них, гора Шаманка,
находится на острове Ольхон:
"Одно из
самых загадочных мест на Байкале. Оно находится на мысе Бурхан, ранее
называемый "Каменный храм." Состоит из белого мрамора, гранита и
кварца. Первые исследователи, добравшиеся до озера Байкал - в том числе
российский ученый Владимир Обручев - отметили, что буряты согласно традиции
боялись этого места. Только шаманы имели право подойти к этому запрещенному
месту. Если этой дороги не удавалось избежать, копыта лошадей заворачивали в
войлок и кожу, дабы не потревожить владыку Байкала.
Буряты считали,
что дух, владыка озера Байкал, жил в пещере горы Шаманка. По свидетельству
жителей села, которые жили в поселке Хунжир, расположенного недалеко от мыса
Бурхан, эту пещеру посещали шаманы, которые обосновались в древней Сибири.
Языческие жрецы по-прежнему выполняют в пещере ритуалы, связанные с очищением
родовой кармы и удаления проклятий.
Что нам нужно и что получаете вы

Я уже получил
грант от Фонда культуры ЕС для покрытия моих транспортных расходов и перелета
до Иркутска, но для того, чтобы полностью реализовать этот проект, я нуждаюсь в
вашей поддержке.
• Дополнительно в проект я пригласил визуального художника Константина Гузь для документации нашей поездки по Бурятии и в последствии создания видео инсталяции. Денежные
средства пойдут на:- артистический гонорар Константину Гузь;- оплату путешествия, авиа перелета художника до Бурятии;- оплатау проживание и питания художника.Информация о творчестве - http://konstantinguz.com
• Для
нашего перемещения по Бурятии и побережью озера Байкал нам необходим опытный
гид-проводник для безопасного путешествия в отдаленные горные участки и на
острова Байкала.
• Мне
также необходимо оплатить мои внутренние транспортные расходы (проживание и
наземный транспорт) в Бурятии. 
• Для
определенных целей нам будет необходима аренда фото/видео оборудования
Поощрительные
подарки (в зависимости от суммы пожертвования)

- 
Донаторы
будут упомянуты в качестве спонсоров выставки в Центре Творческих
Индустрий ФАБРИКА, Москва, а также в последующих выставках с участием данного проекта.
- 
Мы
подарим вам хорошего разрешения и высокого качества фотографии артиста во время
его путешествия по невероятно красивым горам и лесам Бурятии, озеру Байкал с
его островами, а также по священным местам шаманов.
- 
Для
тех, кто пожертвует большую сумму, получит в подарок хорошего разрешения и
высокого качества фотографии плюс отдельные видео зарисовки и готовую арт работу для домашней видео
коллекции. 
Влияние проекта
Я твердо убежден,
что в 21 веке мы теряем наши корни, мы теряем обряды наших предков, которые
приземляют нас и дают возможность соединиться с ритмом жизни. Мы начинаем
забывать, что мы сами, как чистые человеческие существа, имеем ту глубокую силу
и мощь, что ни одна технология никогда не сможет дать. Через возвращение к
старым культурам и традициям, я создаю современные произведения искусства,
которые стремятся привести публику в равновесие и к гармонии с самими собой,
созерцая свое происхождение и ощущая полноту чувств в настоящий момент.
Во время моего
путешествия я буду держать вас в курсе происходящего, делясь новостями,
впечатлениями и фотографиями через FB страницу проекта, Instagram и свой сайт.Где будет показан проект

Премьера проекта, перформанс и видео инсталяция, состоится в рамках 2х-недельной соло выставки в Центре
Творческих Индустрий ФАБРИКА,
Москва, осенью 2016 года. У нас также есть планы показа этой выставки в
Великобритании, США, Голландии и других европейских странах.
Как еще можно помочьПожалуйста, поделитесь ссылкой на проект в ваших социальных сетях: Фэйсбук, Вконтакте, Инстаграм, личных блогах и расскажите друзьям!Также можете воспользоваться инструментами Indiegogo 

Большое вам спасибо за ваш интерес, и я очень благодарен за любую поддержку, которую вы можете оказать!

story:
Who I am and what it's all about

Hi everyone, my name's Sasha Chaitow, and I'm an artist, writer, and scholar of the crossover of esoteric thought and cultural history. I've been painting since 1996, and I hold two MAs in Literature and in Western Esotericism. I have just completed my PhD in Myth and Literature, examining the life and work of the mysterious Joséphin Péladan, a French visionary author who wrote over a hundred books devoted to his cause of inspiring a cultural renaissance through esoterically inspired art. You can read more about Péladan at my dedicated website, www.peladan.org, and more about me and my various creative and scholarly projects at www.sashachaitow.co.uk.


This project

I've been invited to the OCCULT Art Salon in Salem, MA this September to participate in the art exhibition and present a workshop on Péladan's work. I am preparing a painting for the exhibition, but I need your help to get there, as the travel expenses are well beyond what I can afford as a (barely graduated) ex-grad student. I have been undertaking freelance work to supplement my income throughout my studies, but this eats into the time I can spend painting and writing. So apart from my expenses, this campaign is to help me buy the time I need to work on this project, by limiting the number of freelance projects I take on in the next few months.


Why it matters

Péladan is a neglected figure in the history of esoteric thought. An occult author and visionary, he produced hundreds of books dedicated to promoting his vision of regeneration through art, based on Platonic thought, Rosicrucian principles, and an eclectic mix of world mythology and esoteric philosophy. Ridiculed for years, then consigned to oblivion, his work had not been studied in any depth until I undertook this as my PhD project (read more here). Having now completed that research, I have uncovered numerous aspects of his work of great interest to artists, esotericists, and scholars alike. 

The key to his work was his belief that esoteric, symbolic art could effect change in the viewer, and change in society, and he wrote lengthy guidelines for artists proposing how they could use their talent to inspire, and ultimately regenerate society. My workshop distills these aspects of his work, and my presentation will combine a more scholarly introduction to Péladan's work with ideas and practical suggestions for artists working in this area on how to implement some of his ideas in their own work. 

As an artist, my artwork for the exhibition reflects Péladan's aesthetic-esoteric manifesto, and illustrates a key aspect of his cosmology. This will be the first time in a hundred years that Péladan is introduced in detail to the people he most wanted to reach out to: artists, poets, and visionaries.

My track record

I have written extensively about Péladan in various academic and cultural journals published in England, the US, Sweden, and Greece, and have also written a book (published in Greece, 2013), introducing him to a general audience and recontextualising him for a modern readership (click here for my publication and lecture record). I've also presented on a variety of esoteric and cultural topics at academic conferences and in various public venues in the US, the UK, Greece, France, Hungary, and Sweden. I've mounted 6 solo art exhibitions and participated in several group shows in Greece and Spain since 2000. Last year I organised a three-day "festival of arts and letters" reflecting the spirit of Péladan's Salons, and I have a proven track record of successful event and project management (see my CV for details).

On a more personal note, this is the first time that I've been offered a chance to fulfil my lifelong dream of combining my  art and my scholarship in the same place and based on the same topic, 


The art

"Bené-Satan" or, Fate of the Oelohites, by Sasha Chaitow, 2013. This is the template for the painting I will create for this exhibition. It depicts a central part of Péladan's cosmology, according to which, art was the gift of the angels to mankind, as the key to the reintegration with the divine. According to Péladan, mankind is the creation of the angels. He rewrote Genesis and the story of the Fall (based on his understanding of Plato and Enoch), claiming that the angels were cast to earth as eternal guides of mankind - but only if mankind evolved through becoming creators themselves, could they redeem the Fallen. Hence art and the creative impulse lies at the heart of his teachings. This illustration is featured in the current issue of Abraxas Journal, and was exhibited in Madrid at the 1st Neo-Symbolist Salon in October 2013. 


What I Need & What You Get

The funds I'm requesting through this campaign break down as follows:

1. $2000 is to cover my travel expenses to Salem. It may seem a lot, but this covers 3 flights (Corfu-Athens-London-Boston), and a boat ride from Boston to Salem and back. This amount does not cover my accommodation and living expenses, which are kindly being provided by the event organisers.

2. $500 is to buy art materials and packaging for the painting I want to create. This includes a large (2m x 70cm) canvas with a custom made wooden support, oil paints, paintbrushes, varnishes, and packing materials. 

3. The remaining $1000 is to help pay my bills over the next three months, so that I can lighten my freelance load and focus on painting and preparing the workshop. 

In return for your help, I am offering posters, signed copies, and original illustrations from my "Péladan project" art series, some of which have been exhibited in Spain and Greece. See the column on the right hand side for details of "perks" for all contributors.


The Challenge

The main challenge is for me to be able to work on this project undistracted, and to raise the funds to get me to Salem.

Even if this campaign does not reach the amount requested, every penny will go towards completing this project. Whatever happens, I will prioritise the painting and if I cannot afford to travel, then I will still create and send it to the exhibition. 

If less than the total amount is raised, then I will carry on doing freelance work and juggle my time as best I can, so as to bring this project to completion. In the event that the travel fund falls short, then the funds will go towards completing my Péladan project: a series of art that illustrates Péladan's work according to the principles he laid out in his manifesto, that I plan to exhibit when it is complete. So even if this campaign falls short of the goal, every penny will go towards helping me to reintroduce Péladan - through art and scholarship - to the 21st century.

In every case, I will post frequent updates on my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/SashaChaitow to let you know how the painting and travel plans are going!


    The Impact

    Péladan and his work are important for two main reasons: as a neglected aspect of esoteric and cultural history, and as a source of inspiration and philosophical exploration for artists. Though I have begun to make my findings public through academic venues, the artist in me strongly believes that these ideas need to be shared with the people they were written for: artists and the general public. and this is why I am so keen to participate in this project, so that can bring Péladan to an international audience. Péladan's writings are unique as a work of esoteric literature that views books and paintings as talismans that can unlock worlds of esoteric knowledge, and his teachings for artists are summarised in the following illustration and quote:

    "Exhortation,"  by Sasha Chaitow, 2013. Inspired by the quote by Péladan: "Artist, you are a priest: Art is the great mystery and, if your effort results in a masterpiece, a ray of divinity will descend as on an altar. Artist, you are a king: Art is the true empire, if your hand draws a perfect line, the cherubim themselves will descend to revel in their reflection. Spiritual design, a line of the soul, form of understanding, you make our dreams flesh. Artist, you are a mage: Art is the great mystery, it only proves our immortality." 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      I know that not everyone can contribute to the funding, but if you believe in this project, you can still help! Please help to get the word out by sharing this campaign with like-minded friends so it can get maximum exposure. 

      I want you to know that moral support is the greatest help of all.... the work I've done so far couldn't have been completed without the encouragement and kindness of my close family and friends, but also that of total strangers who found an affinity with what I'm trying to do. If Péladan and this project inspires you, then I want to hear from you!

      Updates

      I will post regular updates on my public Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/SashaChaitow , so please follow my progress there. I will also post periodical updates on my websites, www.sashachaitow.co.uk and www.peladan.org. If I can figure out how to, I will also try to update this entry! 

      Thank you very much for reading.
      Sasha

story:
Help The Hinge restore Virginia Terpening's artwork from years of neglect!

Virginia Terpening (b. Missouri, 1917-2007) is one of the Midwest's few mid-century female painters to be nationally recognized and exhibited. Last spring, her entire collection of paintings, sketches, and illustrations were suddenly unearthed from the Lewistown, Missouri, trailer in which she spent her final days. The Riverfront Times made a big splash featuring this discovery as its October 11 cover story (http://www.riverfronttimes.com/2013-10-10/culture/virginia-terpening-art-trailer-discovered-lewistown-st-louis/), but ensuing attempts to auction her oeuvre were unsuccessful. Who will save this important regional artist from senseless obscurity? Who will rescue her reputation--her paintings, sketches, and legacy?

Enter: The Hinge. Heralded by St. Louis Magazine as the city's Best New Art Gallery in 2013, The Hinge (www.thehingestl.com) has long championed the under-dog genius, whether it be Poland's Ryszard Kaja or overlooked talent from the St. Louis area. On November 18th, Virginia Terpening's work went up for auction, and the bidding was something fierce! The Hinge successfully obtained a number of her works, as chronicled by the RFT the following week (http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/dailyrft/2013/...). Teaming up with other area auction winners, The Hinge is now confronted with the challenge of restoring and presenting work that has suffered years of neglect. And we can't do it alone.

A labor of love in every sense, The Hinge has heretofore been funded solely through the grit and gusto of its cofounders. Funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign will go directly to paying for the professional restoration of Virginia Terpening's artwork and its framing and installation for our January 25th exhibition.

Yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus...

story:
Dear Crowd,

We appreciate and are committed to preserving the Street/Urban Art present on the walls of the world's public spaces, and we also acknowledge that it could be gone tomorrow. We believe that Street/Urban Art deserves to be officially taken into the canon of art history as a qualified art form, and that is our underlying and long-term goal. The main objective of our Indiegogo campaign, right here and now, is to finance the location and equipment, shipping and travel expenses, and post production costs of our first of hopefully many more COLOURS StART FESTIVAL shows, while offering you really fantastic Limited Edition artworks at substantially reduced prices as Perks.

OUR GOAL

Ideally, during the next renowned Berlin Gallery Weekend on May 1-3, 2015, to bring together international artists, art lovers, agents, collectors, galleries and museums, in order to enhance, support and drive a valuable exchange and discussion, leading to further acknowledgement and validation of Street/Urban artworks as a legitimate art form.

We, the COLOURS StART FESTIVAL Team, need your support to bring the works of some major Street and Urban artists from the online sphere closer to you – offline, in the real world – in the form of local Street Art festivals, each lasting several days. We envision COLOURS StART FESTIVALS regularly showcasing both online and offline in over 40 participating cities around the globe. See future cities here.

WHAT DO WE NEED, AND WHAT FOR?

We need to dedicate this initial funding to secure each of the first show locations (approx. 5k), equipment (5k), as well as third party travel expenses (5k), artwork shipping (approx. 5k), and printing and publishing (5k) costs. There's still a lot more to do, so let's get things moving (if you are interested, please take a look at our stretch goals)! The more resources we have, the bigger and the better we can be!!! With more funds, we can secure a larger and more central location where we can hang more (and larger, more spectacular!) artworks appropriately, and accommodate more visitors, as well as host a more memorable opening event, including being able to invite the artists. Should we fail to reach our initial goals, we will still try to work on a respectively smaller scale to put on at least one single physical exhibition event as a solid base for future Street/Urban Art promotional activities.

WHAT YOU GET

In addition to the warm fuzzy feeling that it can give to contribute to a project that you believe in and support, all of your pledges will be highly rewarded with quality treats and perks. We work together with various galleries and publishing houses, and are able to offer a wide range of highly discounted artworks. This includes striking fine-art prints and unmistakably stylish streetshots on Alu-Dibond, professional hardcover exhibition books, as well as a rare selection of limited editions and originals from upcoming young artists, along with other incredible rewards. See images of the artworks offered as perks below, or check the official COLOURS StART FESTIVAL website for larger images. 

Bear in mind that if we are successful with this campaign and get the first COLOURS StART FESTIVAL up and running in Berlin, there are over 40 cities we aim to visit with their very own locally unique COLOURS StART FESTIVAL...and the next one might just be yours. So by contributing now, you are bringing us one step closer to you!

WHO WE ARE
Our experienced COLOURS StART FESTIVAL team consists of three Galleries at the helm, supported by a vast international network of art historians, art advisors, collectors, Street/Urban artists and many more open-minded partners. We all share a deep love for our streets, and we believe in the future of the Street/Urban Art that beautifies them. Check out our partners: Colours Gallery, Street Arts Angels and Urban Art Angels.

                                       


SUPPORT US!

So, if you'd like to help bring a cool Street/Urban Art project to life and at the same time receive a potential next Banksy as a perk in return, please join us on this exciting journey. We really look forward to inviting you as a special VIP to our Street/Urban Arts showcase, and the opening party, of course! Don't worry, if you can't make it this time around, we'll keep you updated about the next COLOURS StART FESTIVAL coming soon to a metropolis near you. In the meantime, you can enjoy real-time access to the event organization while we provide you with behind-the-curtain insights into the exciting international Street/Urban Art scene.

Every little contribution of crowd-funded support will greatly assist us in realizing our goals to further promote the beauty and significance of Street Art, allowing us to continue supporting upcoming street artists and help continue driving the projects at a faster pace to soon make the world a bit more colourful ;)

Thanks a lot in advance for all your participation and looking forward to seeing you @ the festival!

If you can’t support financially, then we would really appreciate if you could please share this campaign.

Your COLOURS FESTIVAL Team
story_txt:
Dear Crowd,
We appreciate and are committed to
preserving the Street/Urban Art present on the walls of the world's public
spaces, and we also acknowledge that it could be gone tomorrow. We believe that
Street/Urban Art deserves to be officially taken into the canon of art history
as a qualified art form, and that is our underlying and long-term goal. The
main objective of our Indiegogo campaign, right here and now, is to finance the
location and equipment, shipping and travel expenses, and post production costs
of our first of hopefully many more COLOURS StART FESTIVAL shows, while
offering you really fantastic Limited Edition artworks at substantially reduced
prices as Perks.
OUR GOAL
Ideally, during the next
renowned Berlin Gallery Weekend on May 1-3, 2015, to bring together
international artists, art lovers, agents, collectors, galleries and museums,
in order to enhance, support and drive a valuable exchange and discussion,
leading to further acknowledgement and validation of Street/Urban artworks as a
legitimate art form.
We, the COLOURS StART FESTIVAL Team,
need your support to bring the works of some major Street and Urban artists
from the online sphere closer to you – offline, in the real world – in the form
of local Street Art festivals, each lasting several days. We envision COLOURS
StART FESTIVALS regularly showcasing both online and offline in over 40
participating cities around the globe. See future cities here.
WHAT DO WE NEED, AND WHAT FOR?


We need to dedicate this initial
funding to secure each of the first show locations (approx. 5k), equipment
(5k), as well as third party travel expenses (5k), artwork shipping (approx.
5k), and printing and publishing (5k) costs. There's still a lot more to do, so
let's get things moving (if you are interested, please take a look at our stretch goals)! The more
resources we have, the bigger and the better we can be!!! With more funds, we
can secure a larger and more central location where we can hang more (and
larger, more spectacular!) artworks appropriately, and accommodate more
visitors, as well as host a more memorable opening event, including being able
to invite the artists. Should we fail to reach our initial goals, we will still
try to work on a respectively smaller scale to put on at least one single
physical exhibition event as a solid base for future Street/Urban Art
promotional activities. 
WHAT YOU GET
In addition to the warm fuzzy feeling that it can give to contribute to a project that you believe in and support, all of
your pledges will be highly rewarded with quality treats and perks. We work
together with various galleries and publishing houses, and are able to offer a
wide range of highly discounted artworks. This includes striking fine-art
prints and unmistakably stylish streetshots on Alu-Dibond, professional
hardcover exhibition books, as well as a rare selection of limited editions and
originals from upcoming young artists, along with other incredible rewards. See
images of the artworks offered as perks below, or check the official COLOURS StART FESTIVAL
website for larger images.  
Bear in mind that if we are successful with this campaign and get the first COLOURS StART FESTIVAL up and running in Berlin, there are over 40 cities we aim to visit with their very own locally unique COLOURS StART FESTIVAL...and the next one might just be yours. So by contributing now, you are bringing us one step closer to you!

story:
Joy Young is a performance and teaching spoken word artist who has gained national attention through slam poetry. Most notably, Joy’s work has been seen on the 2013 NPS Semi-Finals stage, Everyday Feminism, and Button Poetry. Much of Joy's work centers on transgressing borders, real and imagined, and entering topics pertaining to social justice through personal narratives. Joy believes these personal narratives should be a driving force for healing ourselves and the world around us; they are a doorway through which we should consciously enter the world of social justice in hopes of creating understanding and making substantive change.

Learn more about Joy's work through their press kit, here.

This campaign is to assist Joy in covering the cost of getting to and competing in the 2015 Women of the World Poetry Slam, which will be held in Albuquerque March 18-22. Things like transportation, hotel costs, food, registration fees, and more will be covered. 

Joy's voice adds a level of queer visibility and social justice focus to an already incredible event. 

If funds in addition to $1000 are raised, these funds will go towards the production of other poetry-related things in Joy's life.

For videos of Joy's performances, check out the Gallery.

story:
Short Summary

  • We are Paul, Emilio, and Mauro. Three emerging artists who met less than a year ago.
  • We believe that honesty and integrity are more important than fame and fortune. These like minded beliefs in an industry full of smoke and mirrors are what have drawn us to work so closely together.
  • The "next level" for us seems to require giving in to a part of the industry that we don't agree with. Contributors will be helping us shine, as we are. Empowering the art work and sparking a revolution. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Last year it cost us $6,000 to fund this show. Hiring production company, DJ, top notch security for the airplane hanger, makeshift walls to hang art, and all of the unforeseen. We made the money back selling art, but we need your help to make it bigger, and better! 
  • By backing us, you get a ground floor investments in three emerging artists in bloom!
  • This year we will be utilizing a larger airplane hanger. This means:  More people. More security. More Art. More walls. More lights! ( bright lights for the art not strobe lights )
  • The benefits for YOU are huge. We are willing to undercut our list values for original paintings by a landslide! Collectors who fund us with original paintings will be getting almost double the dollar value in art.
  • Indie GoGo allows us to utilize any funds we get for this show, even if we don't reach our goal. We are projecting this years project will run us around $9000. If we don't meet our goal we will be swiping our own credit cards to cover any extra costs. We will do that because we believe in what we are doing 110%. See you there!

The Impact

  • You are helping independent artists with good motives get ahead! Inspire others!
  • You are helping kids! We are donating proceeds from ALL show profits to Experience Aviation.
  • Last years show was a huge success. This year with your help, we can scale it through the roof! 
  • Still on the fence? Email me (Paul) your questions I would love to chat with you! pauly@mannersmovement.com

We are Paul, Emilio, and Mauro. Three emerging artists who met less than a year ago.
We believe that honesty and integrity are more important than fame and fortune. These like minded beliefs in an industry full of smoke and mirrors are what have drawn us to work so closely together.

What We Need & What You Get

Last year it cost us $6,000 to fund this show. Hiring production company, DJ, top notch security for the airplane hanger, makeshift walls to hang art, and all of the unforeseen. We made the money back selling art, but we need your help to make it bigger, and better! 
By backing us, you get a ground floor investments in three emerging artists in bloom!
This year we will be utilizing a larger airplane hanger. This means:  More people. More security. More Art. More walls. More lights! ( bright lights for the art not strobe lights )
The benefits for YOU are huge. We are willing to undercut our list values for original paintings by a landslide! Collectors who fund us with original paintings will be getting almost double the dollar value in art.
Indie GoGo allows us to utilize any funds we get for this show, even if we don't reach our goal. We are projecting this years project will run us around $9000. If we don't meet our goal we will be swiping our own credit cards to cover any extra costs. We will do that because we believe in what we are doing 110%. See you there!


The Impact

You are helping independent artists with good motives get ahead! Inspire others!
You are helping kids! We are donating proceeds from ALL show profits to Experience Aviation.
Last years show was a huge success. This year with your help, we can scale it through the roof! 
Still on the fence? Email me (Paul) your questions I would love to chat with you! pauly@mannersmovement.com

story:
Who We are and What We Do - Founded in early 2012, Zombease.com has become one of the best free online resources for information on all things outdoors, survival, preparedness, and undead. With an ever-growing community of individuals from countries all over the world, I hope to continue celebrating the Zombease policy of "All Survivors Are Equal" and spreading knowledge into homes and communities across the globe.

Our Survival/Anti-Zombie Merit Badges represent more than just the ability to outlive the undead or make it through a disaster scenario. They are a symbol of teamwork, internal growth, and exemplary outward abilities.

Wear your skills with pride, don a set of Survival/Anti-Zombie Merit badges and show the world what you're really made of.

A Look at the Rewards

BONUS REWARD ADDED (June 2nd): Get a PERSONALIZED Zombease trading card for contributing at the $100 Recruiter level! (sample seen below). Guy Cain of Zombie Apocalypse Survival Camp has generously donate handmade fire kits (ferro rod with handle, knife, and leather pouch) to the next 3 people that contributes at least $100, AND Knot Your Cord has donated 4 Paracord bracelets (per person) to anyone that contributes at least $100.

  • Series 3 Iron on 2x2 Survivor and Anti-Zombie Merit Badges (listed as series "4" in reward levels)
  • Limited edition "gold" Zombease patch (early-bird special)
  • Survival made Simple Car Decal.
  • Signed letter from Zombease founder Jake Sepulveda.

Funding - It's friends and fellow survivors like you that make a real difference in the world. Pre-ordering/pledging today, will help Zombease continue to grow as I research and develop new and exciting ways to outlive the undead, survive the seemingly unsurvivable, and spread our message of equality.

All funds raised on Indiegogo will go directly towards fulfilling the reward levels and taking care of the operational expenses needed to help keep the Zombease community growing.

Other Ways You Can Help - I know that not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help! Share my campaign and website with your friends, family, and fellow survivors...  and don't forget to visit us at http://zombease.com.

Find Zombease online at:

Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/zombease

Homepage - http://www.zombease.com

Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/user/Zombease

Twitter - https://twitter.com/Zombease

story:
-A Little Bit About Sedona's

Women of the World Poetry Slam Rep:

Roanna “Rowie” Shebala, a Native American spoken word artist, of the Dine' (Navajo) Tribe was born and raised on the Navajo Nation of Fort Defiance, AZ. Given the gift of storytelling from her father she combines story, poetry, and performance. Shebala constantly brings the voice of her heritage into her performance, and written work often treading into spaces where hearing native voices is unlikely. Shebala has competed on four National Poetry Slam Teams, Two time Women of the World Poetry Slam’s, she was also a competitor at the 2013 Individual of the World Poetry Slam. Shebala is this year's 2015’s Sedona Women of the World Poetry Slam Qualifier.

Women Of the World Poetry Slam (WOWPS) is a four day poetry festival, in which 72 of the best female poets in the world compete against each other over two nights of preliminary competitions (referred to as “bouts”) . The poets with the top twelve scores from those days move on to Finals, where one poet is crowned the champion!

The 2015 WOWPS will take place in downtown Albuquerque, NM, March 18-21.

-Asking for Your Help

Please help me by donating to my fundraising campaign. I need to get to the Women of the World Poetry slam in Albuquerque, NM from March 18-21, 2015. This will be covering my; plane tickets, hotel room, transportation (cab fare, bus tickets etc), and food.

-How Your Money Will Help

Money is some serious business, and to ease your mind on what your donation will be helping, below is what you will be contributing towards.

Break down in more detail:

Room and Board: 357.00

Flight $389.00-$500.00

Food

Breakfast: $50;

Lunch: $60

Dinner: $185

Transportation (Cabs, Taxi, Uber): $120.00

Reward Material: $78.00

Miscellaneous: $150

Whatever help I receive will be going towards me getting to WOWPS, in Albuquerque, NM

-Info on the Poet

The first time I could remember writing poetry and enjoying the art was my sophomore year in high school. Since then I have been writing trying to grow and strengthen with my poetry, as well as my performance. In 2004 is when I first attended my first poetry slam in Flagstaff, AZ. I had no idea that poetry was turned into a sport where scores were given, performance and writing was judged, and most importantly the audience was involved. Later that year is when I first stepped on a stage and performed my first poem at a Poetry Slam. I remember being so scared that you could hear the paper as I shook on stage. After overcoming the fear of public speaking I have enjoyed my time performing my poetry on stage. Since then I have been on the 2011, and 2012 National Team, and this is my second year representing a venue at Women of the World Poetry Slam.

From the time in Flagstaff, AZ, I have moved to Phoenix Arizona, and have been a host, organizer, advocate, and poet to the Poetry scene here in my city. Poetry is part of my identity. After my years in Phoenix, I have moved back to Flagstaff, AZ. Trying to find my footing back into a new/old city and getting back on my feet. Competing with the Sedona Poetry Slam has been a blessing and a great experience and am Very honored to represent them with my words.

How Else Can You Help

If you are unable to donate, I understand. I would also very much appreciate if you could share this campaign to your friends, family and social media. Thank you.

I need to get to the Women of the World Poetry slam in Albuquerque, NM from March 18-21, 2015. This will be covering my; plane tickets, hotel room, transportation (cab fare, bus tickets etc), and food.-How Your Money Will HelpMoney is some serious business, and to ease your mind on what your donation will be helping, below is what you will be contributing towards. Break down in more detail:Room and Board: 357.00Flight $389.00-$500.00Food Breakfast: $50; Lunch: $60 Dinner: $185Transportation (Cabs, Taxi, Uber): $120.00Reward Material: $78.00Miscellaneous: $150Whatever help I receive will be going towards me getting to WOWPS, in Albuquerque, NM-Info on the PoetThe first time I could remember writing poetry and enjoying the art was my sophomore year in high school. Since then I have been writing trying to grow and strengthen with my poetry, as well as my performance. In 2004 is when I first attended my first poetry slam in Flagstaff, AZ. I had no idea that poetry was turned into a sport where scores were given, performance and writing was judged, and most importantly the audience was involved. Later that year is when I first stepped on a stage and performed my first poem at a Poetry Slam. I remember being so scared that you could hear the paper as I shook on stage. After overcoming the fear of public speaking I have enjoyed my time performing my poetry on stage. Since then I have been on the 2011, and 2012 National Team, and this is my second year representing a venue at Women of the World Poetry Slam.From the time in Flagstaff, AZ, I have moved to Phoenix Arizona, and have been a host, organizer, advocate, and poet to the Poetry scene here in my city. Poetry is part of my identity. After my years in Phoenix, I have moved back to Flagstaff, AZ. Trying to find my footing back into a new/old city and getting back on my feet. Competing with the Sedona Poetry Slam has been a blessing and a great experience and am Very honored to represent them with my words.How Else Can You HelpIf you are unable to donate, I understand. I would also very much appreciate if you could share this campaign to your friends, family and social media. Thank you.

story:
The LA Art Book Fair is a one of a kind event for artist to gather and sell their books, catalogs, monographs, periodicals, and zines. Running from February 11-14, 2016 with over 250 presses, publishers, and artist from over 20 countries we believe it is important for us to experience this opportunity.

We are the members of Minneapolis College of Art and Design’s, Design club. We are a group of 7 working art students from different majors interested in art and design, and this campaign supports our trip. As students at MCAD we believe it is important to connect to the art community beyond our school, before we leave. With a quarter of our members graduating in the spring we see the LA Art Book Fair as a great, and fun, opportunity for both the graduates and underclassmen to network and develop connections with other artist. That will help us to continue to develop our practice and launch our careers.

Our time in LA is important to us and we want to benefit from it as much as we can. While there we plan on visiting other artist’s studios, museums, galleries, and meeting up with other art students, in conjunction with the LA Art Book Fair.

Your support will give us the opportunity to develop our practices and experience the art community beyond MCAD. Your money will be going in full to the cost of transportation and boarding while in LA. With your support you will receive perks designed for you by us. We hope you want some cool things and will support us in our endeavor to go to the LA Art Book Fair. We appreciate all donations and ask you share this campaign with the people in your life that you think need more design in theirs.

MCAD’s Design Club Crew

Kelsey Vetter, Colleen Mclaren, Nouhtrang Thao,  Stephen Lurvey, Frank Mondragon,  Xochitl Perez,

story:
About Me.

 

My name is Omar Rondón and I am a 22 years old artist from Mérida, Venezuela. You can see some of my artworks at my virtual gallery on instagram: @SOEM2014  www.instagram.com/SOEM2014

Since I was child I always felt passion for drawing and handcrafts, passing from drawing my favorite TV cartoons to become a graffiti artist during my adolescence.

In 2012 I started my University education degree in Visual Arts at the Universidad de Los Andes (ULA), and in summer I had the amazing opportunity to travel to Miami, where i discovered the Wynwood Art District, which became the most inspiring place I have ever been, The Amazing art revolution that I presenced inspired me dramatically to aboard the fine arts, hence I started to study passionately great art masters like Schiele, Picasso, Basquiat and Andrew Salgado, learning to paint and draw almost any art style with any art supply. 

Since 2014 I have had over 20 Group Shows in Venezuela, and received different invitations to show in Europe and U.S.A. but my economic situation impeded it.

Currently, I am about to finish my university degree, but first I have the ambitious project to travel to Miami, Fl. To reach knowledge in the field of arts, discovering how works the emerging art capital of the world, meeting some artist, galleries and art collectives. Learning from professionals how to improve my skills. This experience could be vital for my future as an artist, and also a big part of my personal thesis process and investigation in order to successfully graduate as visual artist in the Universidad de Los Andes (ULA) this year. 

 

Venezuela, a complicated country.

 

I have been working hard since I was 16 years old in many kind of jobs in order to earn my own things and make some savings for my future. During 2014 and 2015 I had a great sales records with my artworks, but in 2016 the prices of high quality prime materials increased insanely, becoming not affordable, reason why my sales and income fell down. Also as the crisis has worsened I have been forced to spend most of my earnings to help at home where I live alone with my mother.

 

The Venezuelan Economy is among the worst in the world, our currency has been devaluating every single day. Right now, the Monthly salary in Venezuela equivalent to USD is just 30$ (yes thirty bucks) so it is almost impossible for me to finance my stay in Miami for more than a couple of weeks Although I am investing the savings of my entire life just to make real this amazing experience.

However, a couple of weeks won't be long enough to learn and discover all about the process as I wish, therefore I really want to extend my stay for 2 or 3 months. In addition to this, the situation of my country is making almost impossible to have good opportunities to improve myself as an artist as the culture has been forgotten, placing museums and art spaces in a really precarious condition and private galleries rarely open the door to young emerging artist. So there is not much more knowledge to reach for me until I finish my education, and as a proactive and hard worker youngster I would like to spent this summer break to lead myself to my own exploration to be a better artist.  however if i want to stay for more time there is at least another 2000$ left to cover expenses such as accommodation, food and transport.

 

Support emerging artists could be the best investing of your entire life!

 

Always I have been an optimistic and hardworking person, so trust me, I am not afraid to work very hard to compensate your donation with amazing artwork rewards chosen from my available pieces on www.instagram.com/SOEM2014 or commissioned for yourself, so please select the reward that fits you and become an important part of my dream.

 

 

 

Even if we reach the goal of 2000$, any extra income will be invested on first class art supplies (that cannot be found in my country) to produce artworks along my stay, and increase the quality of them for the future, and also remember that indiegogo keeps a part of the goal so every single donation (no matter how small or big) will be very appreciated and valuated for me.

 

 

Money isn't all.

 

Don’t forget to share my story with your family and friends, also remember to use the Indiegogo tools for sharing on Social Networks.

 

THANKS FOR READING!!!

 

________________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

Acerca de mí.

 

Mi nombre es Omar Rondón, soy un artista de 22 años de Mérida, Venezuela. Puedes ver algunos de mis trabajos en mi galería virtual de instagram:  @SOEM2014  www.instagram.com/SOEM2014

Toda mi vida he sido un entusiasta del dibujo y las manualidades, pasando de dibujar mis caricaturas favoritas a convertirme en artista del graffiti durante mi adolescencia.

En el año 2012 inicie mis estudios universitarios en la carrera de Artes Visuales en la Universidad de Los Andes (ULA). Y en ese verano tuve la maravillosa oportunidad de viajar a Miami, donde descubrí el Distrito Artístico de Wynwood, este lugar se convirtió en el sitio más inspirador en el que estuve jamás. La revolución artística que presencie me inspiro dramáticamente a abrir mi mente al arte de galería y desde entonces comencé a estudiar a grandes maestros como Schiele, Picasso, Basquiat y Andrew Salgado, aprendiendo a pintar casi cualquier estilo con cualquier material.

Desde 2014 he participado en más de 20 muestras colectivas en Venezuela, y he recibido diferentes invitaciones para exhibir en Europa y los Estados Unidos, pero mi situación económica lo impidió.

Actualmente he finalizado mi escolaridad, antes de abordar mis proyectos de tesis y pasantias para graduarme en la universidad, deseo abordar investigaciones personales en una capital del arte como Miami, conociendo artistas, galeristas y colectivos de arte para descubrir como funcionan los procesos a nivel profesional, la situacion actual de mi pais, ha dejado la cultura de lado, llevando los espacios nacionales de arte a situaciones muy precarias, por lo que es muy dificil poder experimentar de primera mano como ocurren los procesos a nivel profesional de manera internacional.

 

Venezuela, un país complicado.

 

He trabajado desde que tengo 16 años en múltiples campos para poder ganar mis cosas, además durante 2014 y 2015 tuve un asombroso récord de ventas lo cual me permitió ahorrar para el futuro. Sin embargo en 2016 los precios de la materia prima para hacer obras incrementaron de manera ridícula, elevando así el precio de producción de piezas por lo que las ventas cayeron dramáticamente al no poder ser costeadas por la mayoría. Además conforme la crisis ha empeorado he tenido que poner todas mis ganancias para ayudar a mantener mi hogar donde vivo solo con mi madre.

La economía Venezolana es una de las peores en el mundo, nuestra moneda se devalúa día tras día de hecho hoy el salario mensual de un venezolano es de tan solo 30 dólares americanos. Así que es casi imposible para mí poder financiar mi estadía en Miami por mas de un par de semanas, a pesar de que invertiré los ahorros de toda mi vida para hacer real esta oportunidad.

Sin embargo un par de semanas no serán suficientes para culminar mi proyecto investigativo, el cual esta planeado para un tiempo mayor, sin embargo para lograr esto me hacen falta al menos 2000 dólares más para ayudarme a cubrir gastos de hospedaje, comida y transporte.

 

Apoyar artistas emergentes puede ser la mejor inversión de toda tu vida!

 

Siempre he sido una persona optimista, pero también se me enseñó a trabajar duro para lograr lo que quieres, así que no tengo temor de trabajar duro para compensar cada una de sus donaciones con asombrosas obras realizadas por mí. Podrás escoger entre piezas disponibles en www.instagram.com/soem2014  trabajos inéditos elaborados durante mi estadía en Miami o comisiones hechas a tu medida, así que solo selecciona la recompensa que mejor se adapte a lo que deseas y conviértete en parte de este sueño.

Incluso si la meta de 2000$ fuera alcanzada, cualquier ingreso extra será invertido en la compra de material artístico de primera calidad que no puede comprarse en mi país, para producir obras durante mis pasantías y para mejorar la calidad de las mismas de cara al futuro.

Y recuerda que cada donación sin importar cuán grande o pequeña, será altamente valorada por mí.

 

El dinero no lo es todo.

 

También puedes ayudarme si vives en Miami y conoces de algún lugar económico donde pueda pernotar.

De la misma manera si puedes colaborar conmigo en cualquier otra forma posible.

Pero sobre todo si me ayudas a difundir mi historia con tu familia y amigos, recuerda que puedes utilizar las herramientas de Indiegogo para compartir en tus redes sociales.

 

GRACIAS POR LEER!

story:
My name is Philip Diamont and I have been making music for the last 20 years. http://spiryll.bandcamp.com/track/exquisite 

https://soundcloud.com/spiryll/tablaree I do not charge for my music and i am not interested in that. my interest is extremely personal and "spiritual".

I am seeking money for 200 watts of solar and a used laptop. My computer and tablet died last year and I have not made much music since because of it. I am also limited to a 50 watt solar set up which only allows an hour or two per day of computer usage. By supporting this campaign you are allowing me to continue to create and share my music for free, significantly contributing to my psychological and "spiritual" well being.

story:
As seen in CNBC, Reuters, TXCN Late News, FOX 55 This Morning, Sunrise News, Tu día alegre, News4Jax, FOX 17, KENS-SAT, KPTM Fox 42 News, FOX 66, FOX19 Now, NBC4 News, Action News at 6, KFSN-FRES, KSBW (NBC), KATU-POR, KABC-LA (ABC), and many many more! 

Our Campaign

Rain on Request is raising 1 million dollars to implement the tested and proven rain inducing technology Rain on Request (ROR) to solve droughts causing water shortages, forest fires, and great harm to people and animals worldwide.  Each contribution gets us one step closer to saving lives and making the world a better place.  

What is Rain on Request?

Rain on Request (ROR) is an eco-friendly rain inducing technology that helps create the atmospheric conditions for rain to fall 100% naturally.  Rain on Request has been tested and proven to increase rainfall substantially in addition to providing targeted rainfall with amazing precision.

 

Why Crowd Funding?

Our team has spent the better part of the last year going from one government agency to the next in California in order to implement Rain on Request, only to find the same bureaucratic runaround.  The response was virtually the same every time, “This is great and can solve a very serious problem, but go talk to someone else about actually doing it…” 

We then thought, maybe insurance companies would want to be a part of this?  Well, we were sadly mistaken on that as well.Water shortages and high utility prices are apparently good for business.

After almost a year and hundreds of meetings, we came to the stark realization that we would have to do something different to implement Rain on Request, which led us to you crowd funding.


Global Drought Facts

“We have only enough water in storage to get through the next 12 to 18 months, and that's it.” – Jay Famiglietti, professor of Earth System Science and Civil and Environmental Engineering at the University of California, Irvine. 

"A top UN official warns that Syria's drought is affecting food security and has pushed 2-3 million people into “extreme poverty”." - Irin News 

“We are in the midst of the worst drought since record-keeping began in the late 1800s.” – Los Angeles Times


"In the Horn of Africa, the 1984-1985 drought led to a famine which killed 750,000 people." - Dosomething.org


"The worst drought in 60 years has put more than 13 million people in Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Djibouti and Somalia at risk." - United Nations


“Nearly 25 percent of California's $5 billion rice crop will be lost this year due to lack of water, say experts.” - NBC News


Stretch Goals 

$50k - Production of the remote control system working in real time with weather radar

$200k - Selection of optimal locations for installation and acquisition of permits from state and federal authorities

$500k - Production of the first system, transportation, and installation in California

$1.0 mln - Launch of the first system with oversight by top university researchers

$1.3 mln - Production of the second system, transportation, and installation in California

$1.8 mln - Launch of a 2-unit system with targeted rainfall 

$2.1 mln - Production of the third system, transportation, and installation in California

$2.6 mln - Launch of a 3-unit system with targeted rainfall and enhanced accuracy 


FAQ

How big of an area can one system cover?

One system can cover a 15 mile radius. 

Where do you plan on doing it?

Bay Area 

How much rain will one system bring?

Rain on Request can increase rainfall by 50%-400% depending on the area.


How long will it take to install the system and have it running?

Within six months of the completion of the campaign.

How long will you run the system for after the campaign?

After installation, six months of operation.

Will anyone be supervising?

Yes, we are in negotiations now with a number of top-tier engineering schools to supervise our operations and ensure the highest level of safety standards are met.

Rewards

·  $5 - Thank you! Thank you so much for helping to move us one step closer to production.

·  10$ - Thank you email: For your donation of $10, we will send you a personal email thanking you for helping make our dream a reality.

·  $25 - Rain on Request stickers:  For your donation, we'll send you bumper stickers with the Rain on Request logo!

·  $50 - ROR T-Shirt or towel: For your donation, we'll send you a T-shirt with our logo.

·  $75 - ROR sunglasses: For your donation of $75, we will send you these customized ROR shades. 

·  $100 - ROR umbrella: For your $100, we will send you an ROR umbrella with our logo because you will need it!

·  $500 – ROR super soaker water gun:  We will have so much water after this campaign is through, you won’t need to worry about using this bad boy!

·  $1,000 – Personal tour of installation site with inventors of the technology: For a $1,000 donation, you will have a personal tour of one of our installation sites with the developers of the technology.  This will allow you to have an up close and personal experience with a technology of the future!

·  $5,000 – ROR custom aqua party lounge: Not only will you be the life of the party, but you will also be a part of changing the world. You’re awesome. 

·  $10,000 – ROR custom water scooter: This reward speaks for itself.  If you rock on land, you must rock on water as well.  This is where being the cool dude/dudette goes to a whole new level unforeseen by most. 

The Team

Jacob Gitman, Ph.D. - Author of over 50 scientific publications and the holder of numerous patents, Jacob Gitman founded a highly successful telecom company as well as one of the first Russian privately owned research and development institutes earlier in his career. Currently, Mr. Gitman is the CEO of the power line technology company SLE International and runs a global aviation business. Given his extensive experience starting and running successful businesses, he offers a truly unique perspective on the different challenges and opportunities facing Rain on Request.

Sergey Pulinets, Ph.D. - Prof. Sergey Pulinets is a Principal Research Scientist in the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Moscow, Russia. He has more than 35 years of experience in Space Plasma Physics, Physics of the Ionosphere, and Geophysics. Dr. Pulinets is leader of an international team of scientists proposing the Lithosphere-Atmosphere-Ionosphere coupling concept related to seismo-tectonics, active faulting and earthquake processes. Dr. Pulinets is a co-convener of the American Geophysical Union, fellow of IUGG Inter Association Working Group on Electromagnetic Studies of Earthquakes and Volcanoes (EMSEV), correspondent member of International Radio Science Union (URSI), International Committeeof SpaceResearch (COSPAR), fellow ofURSI/COSPAR International Reference Ionosphere (IRI) Working Group, fellow of United Physical Society of Russia and member of the editorial board of Geomagnetism and Aeronomy journal.

Larry Gitman - Only 21, Larry is fascinated with all things tech related.  He is Business Development Manager at RPS International which has developed technologies ranging from over-the-horizon radar systems to solar cell thin films for solar power.  Additionally, he is Project Manager at Rain on Request which has created a highly efficient rain inducing technology capable of reversing the affects of drought. 

Nathan Blaunstein MSc, DSc, Ph.D. - Over 190 articles in referred and special journals and conference proceedings, eight books, seven patents and two PCTs in the fields of wireless communications and smart antennas, optical IR sensors applications, and prediction of earthquakes by use of special radar systems – ionosondes.  Honorary member of the New York Academy of Science and a visiting professor at the Albuquerque University of New Mexico, Aalborg University, Denmark, and Tokyo University of Electro-Communication. Blaunstein holds a diploma of Doctor of Science and Professor in Radio and Optical Physics and Electronics, diploma of professor in Electronics and Information Science, diploma of Ph.D. in mathematics and physics.  He is also a professor at Ben Gurion University in Israel and founder of DP Electronics.

Svetlana Bronshtein, Ph.D. - Dr. Svetlana Bronshtein is a Ph.D in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Along with being an invaluable researcher, she is also a senior lecturer in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics SCE at the Sami Shamoon Academic College of Engineering in Israel. She has authored numerous critically acclaimed publications in the Power Electronics Industry.
story_txt:
As seen in CNBC, Reuters, TXCN Late News, FOX 55 This Morning, Sunrise News, Tu día alegre, News4Jax, FOX 17, KENS-SAT, KPTM Fox 42 News, FOX 66, FOX19 Now, NBC4 News, Action News at 6, KFSN-FRES, KSBW (NBC), KATU-POR, KABC-LA (ABC), and many many more! Our CampaignRain on Request is raising 1 million dollars to implement the tested and proven rain inducing technology Rain on Request (ROR) to solve droughts causing water shortages, forest fires, and great harm to people and animals worldwide.  Each contribution gets us one step closer to saving lives and making the world a better place.  What is Rain on Request?Rain on Request (ROR) is an eco-friendly rain inducing technology
that helps create the atmospheric conditions for rain to fall 100% naturally.  Rain on Request has been tested and proven to
increase rainfall substantially in addition to providing targeted rainfall
with amazing precision. Why Crowd Funding?Our
team has spent the better part of the last year going from one government
agency to the next in California in order to implement Rain on Request, only to
find the same bureaucratic runaround.  The response was virtually the same
every time, “This is great and can solve a very serious problem, but go talk to
someone else about actually doing it…” We then thought, maybe insurance
companies would want to be a part of this?  Well, we were sadly mistaken
on that as well.Water shortages and high utility prices are apparently good for
business.After almost a year and hundreds of meetings, we came to the stark
realization that we would have to do something different to implement Rain on
Request, which led us to you crowd funding.Global Drought Facts“We have only enough water in storage to get through the next 12 to 18 months, and that's it.” – Jay Famiglietti, professor of Earth System Science and Civil and Environmental Engineering at the University of California, Irvine. "A top UN official warns that Syria's drought is affecting food security and has pushed 2-3 million people into “extreme poverty”." - Irin News “We are in the midst of the worst drought since record-keeping began in the late 1800s.” – Los Angeles Times"In the Horn of Africa, the 1984-1985 drought led to a famine which killed 750,000 people." - Dosomething.org"The worst drought in 60 years has put more than 13 million people in Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Djibouti and Somalia at risk." - United Nations“Nearly 25 percent of California's $5 billion rice crop will be lost this year due to lack of water, say experts.” - NBC News






Stretch Goals 

$50k - Production of the remote control system working in real time with weather radar
$200k - Selection of optimal locations for installation and acquisition of permits from state and federal authorities
$500k - Production of the first system, transportation, and installation in California
$1.0 mln - Launch of the first system with oversight by top university researchers
$1.3 mln - Production of the second system, transportation, and installation in California
$1.8 mln - Launch of a 2-unit system with targeted rainfall 
$2.1 mln - Production of the third system, transportation, and installation in California
$2.6 mln - Launch of a 3-unit system with targeted rainfall and enhanced accuracy 

FAQ 

How big of an area can one system cover?
One system can cover a 15 mile radius. 

Where do you plan on doing it?
Bay Area 
How much rain will one system bring?
Rain on Request can increase rainfall by 50%-400% depending on
the area.



How long will it take to install the system and have it running?
Within six months of the completion of the campaign.
How long will you run the system for after the campaign?
After installation, six months of operation.
Will anyone
be supervising?
Yes, we are in negotiations now with a number of
top-tier engineering schools to supervise our operations and ensure the highest
level of safety standards are met.




Rewards
·  $5 - Thank you! Thank you
so much for helping to move us one step closer to production.


· 
10$ - Thank you email: For your donation of $10, we will send
you a personal email thanking you for helping make our dream a reality.


· 
$25 - Rain on Request stickers: 
For your donation, we'll send you bumper stickers with the Rain on
Request logo!

· 
$50 - ROR T-Shirt or towel: For your donation, we'll send you a
T-shirt with our logo.


· 
$75 - ROR sunglasses: For your donation of $75, we will send
you these customized ROR shades.  


· 
$100 - ROR umbrella: For your $100, we will send you
an ROR umbrella with our logo because you will need it!


· 
$500 – ROR super soaker water gun:  We will have so much water after this
campaign is through, you won’t need to worry about using this bad boy!


· 
$1,000 – Personal tour of installation site with inventors
of the technology: For a $1,000 donation, you will have a personal tour of one
of our installation sites with the developers of the technology.  This will allow you to have an up close and
personal experience with a technology of the future! 


· 
$5,000 – ROR custom aqua party lounge: Not only will
you be the life of the party, but you will also be a part of changing the
world. You’re awesome. 


· 
$10,000 – ROR custom water scooter: This reward speaks
for itself.  If you rock on land, you
must rock on water as well.  This is
where being the cool dude/dudette goes to a whole new level unforeseen by most. 



The Team
Jacob Gitman, Ph.D. - Author of over 50 scientific publications and the holder of numerous patents, Jacob Gitman founded a highly successful telecom company as well as one of the first Russian privately owned research and development institutes earlier in his career. Currently, Mr. Gitman is the CEO of the power line technology company SLE International and runs a global aviation business. Given his extensive experience starting and running successful businesses, he offers a truly unique perspective on the different challenges and opportunities facing Rain on Request.
Sergey Pulinets, Ph.D. - Prof. Sergey Pulinets is a Principal Research Scientist in the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Moscow, Russia. He has more than 35 years of experience in Space Plasma Physics, Physics of the Ionosphere, and Geophysics. Dr. Pulinets is leader of an international team of scientists proposing the Lithosphere-Atmosphere-Ionosphere coupling concept related to seismo-tectonics, active faulting and earthquake processes. Dr. Pulinets is a co-convener of the American Geophysical Union, fellow of IUGG Inter Association Working Group on Electromagnetic Studies of Earthquakes and Volcanoes (EMSEV), correspondent member of International Radio Science Union (URSI), International Committeeof SpaceResearch (COSPAR), fellow ofURSI/COSPAR International Reference Ionosphere (IRI) Working Group, fellow of United Physical Society of Russia and member of the editorial board of Geomagnetism and Aeronomy journal.
Larry Gitman - Only 21, Larry is fascinated with all things tech related.  He is Business Development Manager at RPS International which has developed technologies ranging from over-the-horizon radar systems to solar cell thin films for solar power.  Additionally, he is Project Manager at Rain on Request which has created a highly efficient rain inducing technology capable of reversing the affects of drought. 
Nathan Blaunstein MSc, DSc, Ph.D. - Over 190 articles in referred and special journals and conference proceedings, eight books, seven patents and two PCTs in the fields of wireless communications and smart antennas, optical IR sensors applications, and prediction of earthquakes by use of special radar systems – ionosondes.  Honorary member of the New York Academy of Science and a visiting professor at the Albuquerque University of New Mexico, Aalborg University, Denmark, and Tokyo University of Electro-Communication. Blaunstein holds a diploma of Doctor of Science and Professor in Radio and Optical Physics and Electronics, diploma of professor in Electronics and Information Science, diploma of Ph.D. in mathematics and physics.  He is also a professor at Ben Gurion University in Israel and founder of DP Electronics.
Svetlana Bronshtein, Ph.D. - Dr. Svetlana Bronshtein is a Ph.D in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Along with being an invaluable researcher, she is also a senior lecturer in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics SCE at the Sami Shamoon Academic College of Engineering in Israel. She has authored numerous critically acclaimed publications in the Power Electronics Industry.

story:
The Atlanta-Based Adult Coloring Book

The ColorATL Coloring Book, Volume 1 consists of 45 works of art from some of Atlanta's best local artists (full list of artists below). Each have created a unique page for you to intimately experience and meditatively color. While ColorATL Vol. 1 allows our patrons to relax, create, and connect more deeply to the diverse art culture of Atlanta, the backbone of this project is the 1-to-1 model.

1 : 1

We believe all should have access to the stress-relieving, therapeutic benefits of creativity. For every coloring book purchased, ColorATL will personally deliver a coloring book to someone facing hardship at one of our local, partnering health facilities and social impact organizations - Cancer centers, health and hospice homes, transitional facilities, homeless shelters, recuperative-care centers, and more. 

Our Mission

ColorATL combines the power of creative activity with the vast art culture of Atlanta to benefit those in difficult circumstances. For years, members of the ColorATL team have utilized creative activity in order to decrease stress, anxiety, and despair - and cultivate peace, joy, and hope. Something indescribably positive happens when someone grabs a pencil or paintbrush and gets out what has been pent-up inside of them.

Why adult coloring books?

With all the breakthrough we constantly see with therapeutic arts, the biggest hurdle remains: many self-proclaimed "non-artists" stare at a blank canvas and feel intimidated to begin.

This is why adult coloring books are so awesome: they provide an overall structure, yet allow for personal freedom within. Which is proven to be healthy for the mind and spirit.

2016 Artists

Adam Podber - Amber Guinn - Angela Davis Johnson - Avery Robinson - Barry Lee - Brandon Sadler - Chris Veal - Connor Dwyer - Danielle Ramos - David 'Doodleslice' Cohen - Edward Rowan - Estela Semeco - Federico Tobon - Geinene Carson - Jeremy Ray - John Tindel - Julio Ceballos - Kyle 'BlackCatTips' Brooks - Lacey Longino - Lauren Pallotta - Lela Brunet - Llucy Llong - Lucas Rocheleau - Mac Stewart - Matt Evans - Maxim Beeching - Michael Jones - Molly Rose Feeman - Nate Frost - Olive47 - Dozfy - Peter Ferrari - Phil Harris - R. Jean - Ross Boone - Sam Parker - Sanithna Phansava - Shannon Willow - Stephanie Lloyd - Stephanie Mma - Steven Anderson - William Massey - William Mize - Yoyo Ferro


Progress

* In June, ColorATL sent out invitations to a carefully curated group of artists.

* At this moment we have all artwork from artists submitted and organized in the publication proof. 

*Alongside each artwork are words from the artist about their story, concept, and inspiration. Each coloring page also has a custom hashtag so that 'colorers' can upload their unique renditions to online galleries! 

The design team at Color ATL Vol. 1 is preparing to deliver the highest-caliber publication possible, with top-of-the line printing on thick paper with a 'lay-flat' binding so it’s not a pain to color near that pesky center crease. The final physical copy will be 9 x 12 inches to offer a larger area to color and healthy-sized works of art to frame as you complete them!

Our designers are currently finalizing adjustments to the layout. We will be sending the finished formatting to the printer in the last week of August!

Partners

Partnering organizations currently include The Gateway Center, Mercy Care, Winship Cancer Institute, ReMergeATL, and The Women's Transitional Center. Within the next 2 months before release we intend to formalize 5-7 new partnerships with various organizations in Atlanta whose communities may benefit from this initiative.

Specifics

The first printing cost is approximately $8,000, which will deliver just over 3,000 books (1,500 for sale, and 1,500 to those in need of creative relief).  Furthermore, 100% of the profits from ColorATL will go to support therapeutic art programs in local health facilities and social impact organizations in and around our city.

Please reach out and contact us with any questions: ATLcoloringbook@gmail.com

Thank You!

story:
In 2017 the City of Hull became the Uk city of culture.

As local creative I felt I needed to get involved in some way. The Hull 52 has since gone a long way since its inception. A fully designed pack of 52 cards all laid out to view. It got lots of the artists networking and now all excited to share their work. Check out the gallery Here

As it stands in its digital form it's already a testament to the diversity of styles, mediums and creativity of the city's artists, now the goal is to take it forward, to become not only a nice gift for the locals to remember the year and the tourists to remember their visit, it also becomes a way to put the creativity of Hull back into a local charity. 

With this artistic project we have decided to donate 100% of profits to the Hull Children's University - A fantastic charity that  helps children believe that they can achieve their dreams and gives them the opportunity and confidence to try. Read more about this amazing charity here

It's been amazing to of been part of a project that has been taken on board by so many. We're grateful to our printing and paper partners for getting the costs so low, and the only thing that stands in the way between now and us all holding a finished deck in our hands is the peoples willingness to back the project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Just deciding to purchase your deck via this campaign will help beyond belief. As soon as we reach our goal your deck will be produced and sent to your door, but we have bigger rewards. Ad cards to be filled and a card back that needs designing.

Have a look at our rewards below.

£5 or lower - Special thank you on our website

£10 - special thanks and 1 pack of cards
+Special thank you on our website

£18 - 2 packs of cards
+Special thank you on our website

£27 - 3 packs of cards
+Special thank you on our website

£50 - "Thank you list" contained in every deck
+Special thank you on our website
+3 packs of cards

£100 - Your name / brand on our "supporters card"
+Special thank you on our website
+3 packs of cards

£300 - Your  own sponsorship card where you can put any design you want(2 maximum)
+Special thank you on our website
+5 packs of cards
 

£500 - Your company / design /anything on the back of every card 
+Special thank you on our website
+15 packs of cards
 

Thanks for reading about the project, we really hope we have you on board. Even a simple share can make all the difference to a campaign like this. 

Thank you
Adam, Lewis, and the Hull 52

story:
About The Prince Lenormand Oracle

The Lenormand Oracle is named for the legendary Parisian Cartomancer, Mademoiselle Marie Anne Adelaide Lenormand (1772-1843), who divined for some of the most influential people of her time. The Deck has its own system which is to-the-point, clear to read, and can be used on its own or alongside other divination systems, like the Tarot.

I have been teaching and reading with Tarot and Oracle cards for over 15 years and it has been a dream of mine to create beautiful decks my own special brand of magic to them. While teaching the Lenormand Oracle last year I had a sudden inspiration to create my own deck. Within 24 hours I had completed all of the rough sketches for the cards – it was just flowing! Then, over a 6 month period, I painted each of the cards for the deck – sometimes more than once – and began to share them with the world.

Now, I want to get the deck printed beautifully and professionally. The last piece of the puzzle is your support, hence this campaign.

The Deck Cards and the Back (Not in Order)

The Deck Specifics

The completed Prince Lenormand Oracle will be smaller than regular Tarot Cards, with golden edges, an instruction booklet, and a tuck box. The Deck consists of 39 Cards. There are the traditional 36 Cards of the Lenormand system, with a second Man and Woman Card option (which is a “stretch goal” – please see below) and a Wild Card.

The booklet will be similar to the little white books that come with most Oracle and Tarot decks, with simple key-words that familiarise you with the cards and their meanings. There will also be a section on how to read the cards. The information within this booklet will be limited by space, so for further instruction there is the Tarot Readers Academy, “Learn the Lenormand” Course, and a “Stretch Goal” for a full book for those who really want to connect with and understand this method of cartomancy.

The cards will have no borders. I feel that the Lenormand Oracle system works better this way, as most of the readings with these decks align the cards to be read in a group or in a row, and borders will get in the way of the reading’s flow.

I am new to the Lenormand Oracle System....

Awesome! This is why I have added a booklet to get you started with the deck and also have an online Course for people who want to learn to work with the Lenormand Oracle. Additionally, there is a “stretch goal” for a full companion book!

What We Need & What You Get

What will I get?

Hopefully you have stopped by because you are interested in owning your very own copy of the Prince Lenormand Oracle! There are a heap of different perks which you will find on the right side of this page. Please select one that fits you.

Please note that the postage is INCLUDED in the perk. There are options for Canadian peeps and one for International peeps!

Where is the money going?

Here is a breakdown of how the money that we raise through this campaign will be spent. This is the closest approximation we have for the campaign. Once we reach the stretch goals everything gets done faster and more goodies can come your way!

  • 82% of the Funds will go to the Printing, Delivery and Import of the Decks
  • 10% of the Funds will go to the Designer for the Box and the Booklet
  • 12.5% of the Funds will go to Indiegogo to process the campaign.

Stretch Goals

  • $3, 500 - A second Man and Woman Card option – this also helps me to pay a Broker for the project.
  • $4, 000 – Pouches for each backer of the Early Bird Deck, and up – you pre-order a Prince Lenormand Oracle Deck and you will get a beautiful pouch for your deck to travel with.
  • $6, 000 – Full Companion Book: This will be a robust and lovely illustrated book with so many goodies in it! Along with the Card meanings and how to read them, it will also have original spreads. This is something that excites and frightens me, so I am putting it out there… let’s see if we can make it! All backers who have pledged $65 and above will receive the book once we hit this target. The funding will be used to get the book edited professionally, contribute to the cover design, printing, shipping, taxes, etc. The book will be completed by September 2015. 

Some of the content of the Book:

  • How to read the Lenormand Oracle
  • Original verse for each card to help you remember the meaning and inspire your intuition
  • All of the card connections
  • The playing card meanings
  • The meanings of the Cards
  • Different Lenormand Spreads
  • Symbols and meanings of the art work
The Cards

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk with flexible funding is that we will fall short of our goal. That does not mean that you will not get your deck and all of the perks that you have pledged to get:

IF YOU BACK THIS PROJECT YOU WILL GET YOUR DECK. STRETCH GOALS HAVE TO BE MET TO BE FULFILLED. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, but would like to help spread the word about the deck you can:

  • Share this campaign with your friends
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for spreading the love on your social media

Thank you so much for stopping by and checking out this little campaign. 

If you have any questions please send them my way. 

You can check out a lot more about me and my passion projects over at www.ethony.com and www.tarotreadersacademy.com
