82% of the Funds will go to the Printing, Delivery and Import of the Decks


10% of the Funds will go to the Designer for the Box and the Booklet


12.5% of the Funds will go to Indiegogo to process the campaign.



Stretch Goals



$3,
	500 - A second Man and Woman Card option – this also helps me to
	pay a Broker for the project.
$4,
	000 – Pouches for each backer of the Early Bird Deck, and up –
	you pre-order a Prince Lenormand Oracle Deck and you will get a
	beautiful pouch for your deck to travel with.

$6,
	000 – Full Companion Book: This will be a robust and lovely
	illustrated book with so many goodies in it! Along with the Card
	meanings and how to read them, it will also have original spreads.
	This is something that excites and frightens me, so I am putting it
	out there… let’s see if we can make it! All backers who have
	pledged $65 and above will receive the book once we hit this target.
	The funding will be used to get the book edited professionally,
	contribute to the cover design, printing, shipping, taxes, etc. The
	book will be completed by September 2015. 



Some of the content of the Book:



How
to read the Lenormand Oracle


Original
verse for each card to help you remember the meaning and inspire your
intuition


All
of the card connections


The
playing card meanings


The
meanings of the Cards


Different
Lenormand Spreads

Symbols
and meanings of the art work


The Cards









Risks & Challenges

 

The
biggest risk with flexible funding is that we will fall short of our
goal. That does not mean that you will not get your deck and all of
the perks that you have pledged to get: 

IF
YOU BACK THIS PROJECT YOU WILL GET YOUR DECK. STRETCH GOALS HAVE TO
BE MET TO BE FULFILLED. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute, but would like to help spread the word about the deck you can:  Share this campaign with your friends Use the Indiegogo share tools for spreading the love on your social media   Thank you so much for stopping by and checking out this little campaign. If you have any questions please send them my way. You can check out a lot more about me and my passion projects over at www.ethony.com and www.tarotreadersacademy.com

story:
handmade, simple, elegant ceramics

In college I started developing a passion for gatherings where friends could discuss ideas, art, and expand on the beautiful things we saw in our lives.  My studies in ceramics supported this passion.  Whether it be a pot of tea or a home cooked meal the act of sharing a space and sharing food with another as we discussed the different facets of life felt special, it felt sacred.  The cups we cradled in our hands, and the plates that harbored our bread were intentional pieces that connection us to each other and the moment that we shared.


There is no greater purpose for me than to gather, host, and welcome people into a shared space.  This is the reason I create ceramics, this is who I am to the bones.  My work is inspired by people gathering in intimate settings to discuss ideas, to share food, and to be present with one another.  A gathering as small as two or as large as 100 deserves to be thoughtful, beautiful and magical.  Each ceramic cup I create to every handmade dish is designed with the intention to bring people together.  Join my table and enjoy life’s simple pleasures.  Let my work give you the joy of drinking wine, breaking bread, or sharing tea with someone.


By contributing to this campaign you will help support me in my journey to Aspen, CO where I will be participating in a 2 week hand building ceramic workshop with artist Judith Solomon titled 'The Tabletop'.  This class is aimed to focus on designing a custom set of functional hand built pottery.  We will discuss the importance of disconnecting with our digital lives while reconnecting with the palpable and concrete.


How you can help

I was granted a partial scholarship to Anderson Ranch Art Center but will still need to raise $1700 for room & board, food, and travel expenses.

  • $1300 for room & board for 2 weeks
  • $200 for food for 2 weeks
  • $150 for travel expenses
  • $50 for supplies

This is a unique opportunity.  For those of you who know my work and have seen me grow over the years this is your chance to support me and in return receive a handmade piece that i've created OR receive a piece that I will create during my workshop.

What it means to me

This project is very important to me.  As many of you know I believe strongly in disconnecting from technology, focusing on the present, and connecting with people in a genuine way.  Creating handmade pottery is a small, yet significant contribution to this movement.


As some of you know I have maintained a successful online shop where I sell my pottery: https://www.etsy.com/shop/handmadeBC?ref=hdr_shop_menu.  I have seen some wonderful successes in the past year, but I have felt stagnet and a bit out of touch with my artistic abilities.  Participating in this workshop will propel me as a ceramic artist and will give me new insights into my craft that I will use to expand my business. 


While I am beyond honored that I was granted this opportunity this will be one of the greatest challenges I'm up against at an artist and business owner.  This class will be hard work and push me to learn techniques that are both physically and mentally challenging.


This class will teach me new technique in hand built ceramics that will make me more efficient.  This will be a very intensive 2 weeks for me.  I'll be away from my husband, family, and friends.  I plan to mostly disconnect and treat this workshop seriously.


If you can't contribute at this time I would love for you to share this campaign with a friend, wish me luck, or think of me over the next two weeks.  I am so thankful for the support and community I have had behind me these past few years and I can't begin to explain what that support has moved me to do. 


Thank you all so much!


Love,

Bridget

story:
6021 is building a better community through art. Help us continue to create  a better neighbourhood through Art, inspiration, engagement & creative place making.  We have been in the 6021 "Shopfront" for 2 years & 6021 needs your support to take it to the next level!

6021 is an inner city  "Shopfront" studio, bordering between Compton & North Long Beach, California, serving a vibrant, poor, diverse & undeserved community.

6021 is an Art Space where  Art, Community & Culture, mix & inspire. It is simply a  space for anyone to experience Art and free cultural programs.  For the past 2 years 6021 has become a part of the community,  making & giving art to local barbers, nail shops, piñata party shops, restaurants, homes, and care facilities. We have had 1,000’s of visitors from around the globe, worked with gang members, bored and struggling teens & kids, migrant families with children or simply drop in visitors and homeless. We have given away free art supplies, 100's of personal photographs and drawn portraits, Art lessons and diverse cultural programs and in Summer 2015 we hosted 2 artists in residence.  6021 "Shopfront" studio is an open space where the community.  Art, Culture, inspiration & a lot of hard work merge to help improve the neighborhood & the people that work & live in the heighbourhood. Your donation will help us continue to build a better more sustainable place where art and place matter.

What We Need & What You Get

I want to continue working in the space (6021 Atlantic Blvd, nth Long Beach) for 24 months = 2 years.
We need to pay the rent and utilities   $500 per month = $12,000

Repair and maintain the walls and better plumbing.  $600  ( a functioning toilet)

We will pay a teacher so we can offer consistent regular art classes and cultural programming - $10 per hour, 4 hours a week - $40 x 20 week = $800

Help us buy more art supplies for the locals  - pencils, drawing boards, chairs, a camera and computer. - $50 per month  = $1,200

Your donation will help pay for 2 more artist in residence over the summer of 2016 and 2017 = $800

All the money will go towards the studio, engaging & introducing Art & humanity to this neglected community. Link to the Article recently written in the Long Beach Gazette. Support my project and make a difference!

I want your support so I can continue to work in this neighborhood as an Artist, Social Practitioner! I need the money for rent & supplies, teachers & volunteers. It costs me over  $650 a month, please DONATE!

The Impact

This project has had a big impact on peoples lives. every time we give a lesson we see a smile and hope. Art is considered a luxury,  but I believe it should be an everyday experience for everybody. Art is more than just a painting or drawing it is about diversity and understanding culture, vision, process & helps to build a positive impact on community. We make connections and simply give purpose to an otherwise hard life. Link to the 6021 blog.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help, then come & volunteer your time, teach a lesson, show us your skills, share this fundraiser with your friends - make noise!

story:
About Me

Hi! My name is Ninah Mars. I’m a painter and musician born in Caracas, Venezuela and currently living in Rome. I’ve participated in different art exhibitions with other artists in Venezuela, Italy, Switzerland, Spain and France. I’ve decided that I am now ready to take my career to the next level. I am organizing my very first solo exhibition. I have worked long hours painting and preparing for this moment. With your help I will be able to cover the expenses for the location fee, promotion, framing of the paintings, among other costs regarding the organization of the event. For the opening of the exhibition I would like to incorporate my music by doing a live acoustic show where I will be playing a series of my song from both of my albums “This is How we Pray” and “ALBOOM!” both available on iTunes for download. I need your help to bring this dream to life. You can help by backing this campaign or simply by sharing it with your friends and family. I hope you can be a part of this journey with me!

                     



SPANISH: Hola! Me llamo Ninah Mars. Soy una pintora y músico nacida en Caracas, Venezuela y actualmente estoy viviendo en Roma. He participado en diferentes exhibiciones colectivas en Venezuela, Italia, Suiza, España y Francia. He decidido que estoy lista para llevar mi carrera al siguiente nivel. Estoy organizando mi primera exhibición individual. He trabajado por largas horas pintando y preparándome para este momento. Con tu ayuda podré cubrir los gastos de la locación, promoción, enmarcado de las obras, entre otros gastos relacionados a la organización del evento. Para la apertura de la exhibición me gustaría incorporar mi música realizando un show acústico en vivo donde cantaré una seria de canciones sacadas de mis discos This is how we pray y ALBOOM! ambos disponibles para descarga en iTunes. Necesito de tu ayuda para hacer este sueño realidad. Me puedes ayudar patrocinando esta campaña o simplemente compartiéndola con tus amigos y familiares. Espero puedas ser parte de este viaje conmigo!

ITALIAN: Ciao! Mi chiamo Ninah Mars. Sono una pittrice e musicista nata a Caracas, Venezuela, attualmente risiedo a Roma. Negli ultimi anni ho partecipato a diverse mostre collettive in Venezuela, Italia, Svizzera, Spagna e Francia. Adesso è giunto il momento di portare la mia carriera al livello successivo. Sto organizzando la mia prima mostra personale. Ho lavorato duramente preparandomi per questo momento, dedicando lunghe ore ai miei quadri. Con il vostro aiuto potrò far fronte ai costi e alle spese legate all’organizzazione dell’evento tra cui: l’affitto dello spazio espositivo, la promozione e il marketing, la preparazione e l’allestimento delle opere. Durante l’inaugurazione della mostra porterò in scena anche la mia musica, realizzando una performance live acustica in cui canterò alcuni dei miei pezzi più famosi tratti dagli album This is how we pray e ALBOOM!, entrambi disponibili su iTunes. Aiutatemi affinché il mio sogno si trasformi in realtà! Ecco cosa potete fare: supportare economicamente con un contributo a vostra scelta questa campagna o, semplicemente, condividendola con i vostri amici e familiari. Fate la scelta giusta, intraprendete quest’avventura con me!


My Art:

If I had to give my art a definition I would say that it is mainly abstract, it leaves the viewer freedom of interpretation. They are made to intrigue, attract and immerse the viewer in my distinct view of reality. The subjects depicted are often abstract faces, sometimes cubic and distorted. However, there are also pure abstract shapes, lines, colors, and brush strokes for pure aesthetic purposes

  

  


COLLECTIVE EXHIBITIONS COMING UP:

MAY 2016 - ArtExpo May Barcelona - BARCELONA, SPAIN

JUNE 2016 - ArtExpo June Rome - ROME, ITALY

NOVEMBER 2016 - 46e Salon International ARTS19 - PARIS, FRANCE


RECENT COLLECTIVE EXHIBITIONS:

2015

- 45e Salon International ARTS19 - PARIS, FRANCE

- ArtExpo June Barcelona - BARCELONA, SPAIN

- XI Biennale di Scultura di Orsogna - ORSOGNA, ITALY
2014
-  Artisti del Vecchio e del Nuovo Mondo - SAVONA, ITALY
- TRÁNSITO Museo deArte Moderno Mateo Manaure - MATURIN, VENEZUELA.

My Music:

To listen to my full discography please visit the music section on my website www.ninahmars.com 

                      

                       ALBOOM (2012)                                    This Is How We Pray (2008)

       



Where are the funds going?

·  Location fees

·  F&B for vernissage

·  Framing of the paintings

· Photoshoot of the artworks for catalog

·  Graphic design expenses

·  Printing of catalogues, posters, invitations, etc. 

·  Advertising/Promotion

·  Rental of audio equipment for live performance

·  Transportation

·  Photo and Video coverage during the event

·  Staff 

·  Production  of rewards



The Perks:

€5 EUR -THANK YOU NOTE --->I will thank you for your support on my official facebook page Ninah Mars ART (www.facebook.com/NinahMarsART).

€10 EUR - DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF "ALBOOM!" ---> Receive a digital download of my album “ALBOOM!”.

€10 EUR - DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF "TIHWP" ---> Receive a digital download of my album “This Is How We Pray”.

€20 EUR- DOWNLOAD BOTH MY ALBUMS! ---> Digital download of both my albums “This is how we pray” and “ALBOOM!”.

€40 EUR + Shipping - THE ALBUMS BUNDLE! ---> 1 signed copy of my album "This Is How We pray", 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", and a thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).

€60 EUR + Shipping - THE MUSIC BUNDLE! ---> 1 signed copy of my album "This Is How We pray", 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars T-shirt, and a thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).

€100 EUR + Shipping - ART & MUSIC BUNDLE! ---> Receive 1 drawing/sketch made by me on an A4 format paper, 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars T-shirt, and a thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).

€200 EUR - ACOUSTIC VIDEO JUST FOR YOU! ---> Receive an exclusive video recorded just for you! I will be saying a few words to thank you, and will be singing one of my songs in acoustic version.

€300 EUR + Shipping - GET ONE OF MY PAINTINGS! ---> Receive a 30x30 acrylic on canvas painting from my “Creatures” series (to view series please visit the photos section of my Facebook page. Also I will thank you on this same page! (This perk ships from Venezuela, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping internationally).

€500 EUR + Shipping - GET TWO OF MY PAINTINGS! ---> Receive two 30x30 acrylic on canvas paintings from my “Creatures” series (to view series please visit the photos section of my Facebook page. Also I will thank you on this same page! (This perk ships from Venezuela, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping internationally).

€1,000 EUR + Shipping - *DELUXE PACKAGE* ---> Receive 1 of my paintings from the exhibition, 1 signed copy of my album "This Is How We pray", 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars T-shirt, and a thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).


Challenges

The plan is the following: the exhibition should take place in September 2016 in Rome and last at least 7 days. Achieving my first solo exhibition is a real challenge! I know that unexpected events happen all the time but thanks to your support and trust, together, we will be able to accomplish this goal. I want to thank everyone in advanced for believing in me, and for being a part of this journey with me.  I am sure this is only the beginning of so many great things to come! 


Other ways you can help

It would be much appreciated if you can spread the word!  just share this campaign on your social networks so your friends and family can find out about it.

pray", 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", and a thank you note
on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).
€60 EUR + Shipping - THE MUSIC BUNDLE! ---> 1 signed copy of my album "This Is How We
pray", 1 signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars
Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars T-shirt, and a thank you note on my official Facebook
page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).
€100 EUR + Shipping - ART & MUSIC BUNDLE! ---> Receive 1 drawing/sketch made by me on an A4
format paper, 1
signed copy of my album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars
T-shirt, and a thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).
€200 EUR - ACOUSTIC VIDEO JUST FOR YOU! ---> Receive an exclusive video recorded just for you!
I will be saying a few words to thank you, and will be singing one of my songs
in acoustic version.
€300 EUR + Shipping - GET ONE OF MY PAINTINGS! ---> Receive a 30x30 acrylic on canvas painting
from my “Creatures” series (to view series please visit the photos section of
my Facebook page. Also I will thank you on this
same page! (This perk ships from Venezuela, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping internationally).
€500 EUR + Shipping - GET TWO OF MY PAINTINGS! ---> Receive two 30x30 acrylic on canvas paintings
from my “Creatures” series (to view series please visit the photos section of
my Facebook page. Also I will thank you on this
same page! (This perk ships from Venezuela, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping internationally).
€1,000 EUR + Shipping - *DELUXE PACKAGE* ---> Receive 1 of my paintings from the exhibition,
1 signed copy of my album "This Is How We pray", 1 signed copy of my
album "ALBOOM!", 1 Ninah Mars Sticker, 1 Ninah Mars T-shirt, and a
thank you note on my official Facebook page Ninah Mars ART. (This perk ships from Italy, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU).




Challenges



The plan is the following: the exhibition should take place in September 2016 in Rome and last at least 7 days. Achieving my first solo exhibition is a real challenge! I know that unexpected events happen all the time but thanks to your support and trust, together, we will be able to accomplish this goal. I want to thank everyone in advanced for believing in me, and for being a part of this journey with me.  I am sure this is only the beginning of so many great things to come! 


Other ways you can help
It would be much appreciated if you can spread the word!  just share this campaign on your social networks so your friends and family can find out about it.

story:
About this project

In San Diego, poetry slam was resurrected in 2008  when a group of local poets decided to send a team to the National Poetry Slam. Of the 72 teams that competed, San Diego made it into the semi finals and finished in the top 20. 7 years later, San Diego has blossomed into a perennial contender; cultivating 2 Women of the World Poetry Slam Finalists, 2 Individual World Poetry Slam Finalists, 1Individual World Poetry Slam Champion, a National Underground Poetry Individual Championship Winner and has made an appearance in the National Poetry Slam Finals. 

This year, our team consists of 5 dynamic poets (Imani Cezanne, Rudy Francisco, The Saint, Jerrica Escoto & Joe Limer) who are working diligently and preparing to represent San Diego in this year's National Poetry Slam. 

Many have asked how they can assist in this journey and there are a few ways in which this can happen. 

1. You can attend exhibition matches and cheer for us. 

2. You can offer words of encouragement 

3. You can donate. 

We are raising funds to cover a portion of our travel and lodging costs. Every dollar brings us closer to our goal and every contribution matters. We appreciate your support 

Risks and challenges

After raising the designated amount, we will be meeting 4 to 5 days a week to memorize and polish our poems, making sure we are ready to compete against the most prolific poets in the country. We all have busy schedules and various other obligations so this will be a challenge for us. We are prepared to face this challenge by shifting around our other obligations and making preparation a priority.

story:
My name is André LeRoy Davis and I am the writer, illustrator and co-creator of "The Last Word."  For all of you who bought and read the bible of Hip-Hop religiously, "The Last Word" was the illustration located on the last page of The Source magazine every month.  From September 1990 until January 2007, twelve months a year in every issue I refined and honed my skills while poking fun at the likes of LL Cool J, Naughty By Nature, Ol’ Dirty Bastard, the Notorious B.I.G., Wu-Tang, Jay-Z, Nas and many others. For close to 17 years, you either loved me or hated me. A few people, including DJ Quik, Rakim and Professor X from X-Clan, at first took offence to my drawings, but most Hip-Hop artists understood that it was just a joke and they took it as a badge of honor. The late rapper Heavy D., once admitted that "The Last Word" was the first thing he looked at when he picked up the magazine.”

         The Source Issue #14 September 1990   (The Very First The Last Word)

The man who co-created The Last Word along with me, Jonathan Shecter | "Shecky Green", the original Source editor-in-chief said, “One of the best parts of the month was when Dré would show up, unzip his leather attaché, and reveal the flavorful new installment. We were always thrilled with the results.”

                                          The Source Issue #70 July 1995

For all of those visual artist that my work influenced throughout the years as well as all of those performing artist that I’ve immortalized in The Last Word… I need your donations.

50 Shades of Dré: A One Man Show is set to debut in Harlem, N.Y.C. The show celebrates 25 years of The Last Word as well as my 50th birthday by hanging 50 pieces of art. This Retrospective of my work will offer the art connoisseur a few illustrations from my college days, my first published works in Players magazine, political satire, various Hip-Hop related art work and of course original The Last Word illustrations both classic and a new. My work is like an Illustrative-documentary as I provide you with a visual record of the world of Hip-Hop entertainment and it’s entertainers for over the last twenty-five years.

                     Spike Lee Players Magazine 1988 (My First Published Work)

I look forward to celebrating and sharing some of my original art with you, as I bring back fond memories of classic times in Hip-Hop.  

Through the years I have been approached by curators and art galleries who requested that I exhibit my work in solo shows, but they wanted things to be done their way. The closest that I’ve come to exhibiting my work recently is to occasionally lend an original illustration or two for group shows. I have personally curated successful group shows like, “17: The Revolution Will Be Visualized” and now with your continued support and funding I can curate my own one man show consisting totally of art that I personally pick and choose from the archives without having to worry about appeasing any sponsors opinions and desires. With your help, support and donations I can matte and frame original illustrations, I can have enlarged prints on quality paper fashioned to display my digital creations and then have them matted and framed. The show can be promoted properly from its preview opening in Harlem to wherever it takes place after that and with your support I can put together an incredible show that will evolve and change as well as move and travel from city to city, state to state and country to country.

If you can’t personally donate any money at this time, then please help to spread the word. Use the Indiegogo share tools. Share this campaign… Tell two friends and have them tell two friends… and so on, and so on!

-- I'm just supplying you with some Visuals for some of the Perks that I'm offering! The offered perks all utilize my original artistic creations --


Your Contributions will pay for:

1. Matting

2. Framing

3. Printing

4. Marketing & Promotion

5. The continued work in progress, writing and interviewing for the forthcoming coffee table book: The Last Words & Beyond: A Retrospective Works By Hip-Hop's Official Cartoonist... André LeRoy Davis.

story: My name is Philip Diamont and i am seeking 8,000$ to purchase the necessary equipment to create a solar and wind powered audio and video studio. It will be located on a mountain in Barton Vermont and will be open to the public in a moderated way in the form of small free gatherings and free access through request. I have been making music for over 19 years and have always made my music available for free online. https://spiryll.bandcamp.com/        I am also the primary organizer and host for the free gathering known as catalyst for the last 6 years.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EzpW055UQig I am seeking equipment in the hopes that i can be of better service to others and find creative satisfaction.                                                       what i intend to use the funds for:                                        1) 2000$a computer that can handle live audio/video integration and other heavy processing jobs like complex animation etc                                                                     2)1000$studio monitors                                                               3)1000$hd led projector                                                           4)3000$wind generator,solar panels, charge controller and batteries                              5)1000$intelligent lighting and dmx/midi controller 6) if i am able to somehow miraculously raise more it will be going straight into construction costs of the studio space itself as well as the gathering catalyst                                                                                                I hope that you will support this project and see it as a contribution not only to my personal growth but to that of others

story:
This year, help us replant trees on the Palestinian farm Tent of Nations, to replace those uprooted by the Israeli government.

Strategic nonviolence can lift oppression from an oppressive situation rather than lay blame or dictate the choosing of sides. 

We are mobilizing the international Jewish community to partner with Palestinians and Israelis who have rejected violence and instead are relying on peaceful measures to secure dignity and human rights.

Our first delegation will replant trees on the Palestinian farm Tent of Nations to replant the 1,500 trees uprooted by the Israeli government.

** All contributions to the Center for Jewish Nonviolence/T'ruah (our fiscal sponsor and partner) are tax-deductible. **

We need your support to:

Purchase new trees for the farm and invest in new farm equipment

 *** Goal: 250 trees and 25 new shovels, spades and hoes

Provide scholarships to volunteer tree planters

 *** Goal: 10 scholarships

Secure the long-term sustainability of this peace work

 *** Goal: part-time organizer; website

Implement workshops & trainings in nonviolence

 *** Goal: 5 workshops

“As a young Jewish girl growing up in America, I saved my quarters to plant trees in Israel.  This year, I’m planting trees for the Palestinians.”

Ilana Sumka, founder, Center for Jewish Nonviolence

Oped: The Fate of Fruit Trees, Moment Magazine

Haaretz: The Tree Uprooting Heard Around the World


Tree Replanting Delegation, February 15-20, 2015

This delegation is convened under the auspices of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence, a new project under the fiscal sponsorship of and in partnership with T’ruah.

In addition to supporting the Nassar family, the owners of the Tent of Nations, we will work to advance the efforts of Palestinians and Israelis who are utilizing nonviolent activism as a means to end the Israeli occupation and to advance a just and lasting peace.  We will partner with those who reject the use of violence, Palestinians and Israelis alike, and instead turn to creative, proactive strategies that advance equal rights and foster dignity. 

The Center is developing a new culture and practice of Jewish Nonviolence in North American and the EU, Israel and Palestine.  The Center will train and mobilize members of the international Jewish community to join Israeli and Palestinian nonviolent activists seeking to secure human and civil rights. 

There are Palestinians and Israelis engaged in nonviolent activism, working courageously for equality, dignity.  Jews throughout the world find themselves in alignment with the values and vision of the growing Palestinian – Israeli nonviolent movement. 

However, there is no organizational vehicle in the international Jewish community to directly support Palestinians and Israelis engaged in grassroots nonviolent activism.  We aim to fill that gap. 

The horrific tragedy of the violence – again – in the summer of 2014 in Gaza and Israel highlights the urgency of cultivating a culture and practice of nonviolent activism. 

How you can help:

1. Contribute financially today, to support new trees and this delegation.

2. Come on the tree replanting delegation in February 2015. Apply here.

3. Join our public awareness campaign in your home community. Send an email to CenterForJewishNonviolence@gmail.com to get involved. 

Delegation Partners (full bios below)

This delegation is convened under the auspices of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence, a new project under the fiscal sponsorship of and in partnership with T’ruah.  The primary Israeli and Palestinian partners for this delegation are:

Daoud Nassar,  Tent of Nations

Aviv Tatarsky, Engaged Dharma Israel

Sami Awad, Holy Land Trust


Background: The Tent of Nations

"Planting a tree is a sign of hope." - Daoud Nassar, Tent of Nations

The Tent Of Nations Project  (from Tent of Nation's website)

This project seeks to bring people of various cultures together to build bridges of understanding, reconciliation and peace. We invite young people from around the world, especially from areas of conflict, together for face-to-face interaction.

Daher’s Vineyard

This is the name of the farm owned by the Nassar family, where the Tent of Nations is based. The farm grows olives, grape vines, almonds, vegetables & fruit on about 100 acres of land. The family has fought a legal battle to keep the land since it was threatened with confiscation in 1991. The issue is ongoing but so much has been achieved, and we continue to work to protect and develop the farm as a place where people can meet, work together and learn.

Many areas of Palestinian land are threatened with confiscation if they are not maintained and cultivated. We hope to inspire others to work to bring life to these areas and protect their endurance.

Leadership Team Bios


Ilana Sumka, Center for Jewish Nonviolence

Ilana is the founder of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence and the senior trip leader for the February 2015 tree replanting delegation.  Inspired by an approach to community organizing that unites tangible outcomes with spiritual practice, she integrates strategic activism with principles of compassionate nonviolence.  From 2006 to 2011, Ilana served as Encounter's Jerusalem director, working in close partnership with dozens of Palestinian leaders, academics, university students and community members.  Under her leadership, more than a thousand American and Israeli Jews had the opportunity to gain first-hand exposure to the realities of Palestinian life in the West Bank and East Jerusalem.  Prior to her time in the Middle East, she served as Technical Assistance Officer at American Jewish World Service (AJWS), overseeing projects in Africa and Asia.  She also served as an elec­tions monitor to observe and evaluate the electoral process of newly emerging democracies in Bosnia and Albania, under the auspices of the OSCE.

A recip­ient of the Dorot Fellowship in Israel in 2004 and a Pardes Fellow in 2005, Ilana graduated with honors in 1997 from Wesleyan University and is a certified Focusing professional.  In addition to her work with the Center, she teaches Jewish conversion courses and is writing a book about her work in the Middle East.

Daoud Nassar, Tent of Nations

Since 2002, Daoud Nassar has been the founder and director of the Tent of Nations, an educational and environmental farm and the location of the February 2015 tree replanting delegation. Daoud  was born in Beth Jala, nearby Bethlehem in 1970.  Born into a Christian family, from the beginning Daoud was involved in church activities, leading children and youth groups. After he finished high school in 1989, he went to Austria and got a degree in Biblical Studies from the Bible College.  He came back to Bethlehem in 1991 and joined Bethlehem University where he got a BA in Business with a major in Accounting.  In 1998 he got an MA degree in Tourism Management from Bielefeld University in Germany and works in the field of alternative tourism. 

The mission of Tent of Nations is building bridges between people, and between people to the land.  They bring people of various cultures together to build bridges of understanding, reconciliation, and peace.  As part of this mission, Tent of Nations sponsors educational projects at Daher’s Vineyard, the organic farm, located in the hills southwest of Bethlehem, Palestine.  The farm is a center where people from many different countries come together to build bridges of trust and hope.  Daoud is married to Jihan and they have three children, Shadin, Nardine and Bishara.

Aviv Tatarsky, Engaged Dharma Israel

Aviv Tatarsky is a longtime Israeli peace and human rights activist and is the primary Israeli partner of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence. His activism is inspired by 20 years of spiritual practice: Buddhist meditation, Shiatsu therapy and Martial Arts. In 2009, Aviv initiated Engaged Dharma Israel, a group of meditation practitioners who engage in Israeli-Palestinian solidarity action while aiming to raise political awareness and involvement in the dynamic meditation community in Israel.  Since 2012 Aviv has been working as a researcher for Ir-Amim, an Israeli NGO which focuses on Jerusalem within the context of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Through his work and activism Aviv has first-hand knowledge of Israeli policy in the Occupied Palestinian Territories, its destructive effects on Palestinians and the possibility for joint action promoting justice and reconciliation.  He is a board member of Tovana, one of the largest Insight Meditation organizations in Israel. For 17 years he was a leading teacher of Kitaido (martial art) in Israel and a senior Shiatsu teacher and practitioner.  He holds an Msc. in Mathematics from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem.  Aviv lives in Jerusalem.

Sami Awad, Holy Land Trust, Bethlehem

Sami Awad is the Executive Director of the Holy Land Trust, a leading Palestinian organization committed to the pursuit of equality and justice through nonviolence, and one of the primary Palestinian partners of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence.  Sami holds a Master's degree in International Relations, specializing in Peace and Conflict Resolution from the American University in Washington D.C. and an undergraduate degree in Political Science from the University of Kansas.  Prior to joining Holy Land Trust, Sami worked with the Palestinian Bible Society in establishing a Biblical Museum in Bethlehem and was responsible for the activities of the Palestinian Center for the Study of Nonviolence in Jerusalem. The Center offered seminars and workshops in Conflict Resolution and Democracy and Nonviolence. Sami is also one of the founders and partners of Radio Bethlehem 2000, one of the first radio stations to be launched in Palestine.  Today, Sami’s work continues to be focused on nonviolence as the catalyst to end all forms of conflict and establish an enduring and comprehensive peace in the Holy Land.

Daher’s Vineyard
This is the name of the farm owned by the Nassar
family, where the Tent of Nations is based. The farm grows olives, grape vines,
almonds, vegetables & fruit on about 100 acres of land. The family has fought a legal battle to keep the land since it was threatened with
confiscation in 1991. The issue is ongoing but so much has been achieved, and
we continue to work to protect and develop the farm as a place where people can
meet, work together and learn.
Many areas of Palestinian land are threatened with
confiscation if they are not maintained and cultivated. We hope to inspire
others to work to bring life to these areas and protect their endurance.
Leadership Team Bios

Ilana Sumka, Center for Jewish Nonviolence
Ilana
is the founder of the Center for Jewish Nonviolence and the senior trip leader
for the February 2015 tree replanting delegation.  Inspired by an approach to community organizing that unites tangible
outcomes with spiritual practice, she integrates strategic activism with principles
of compassionate nonviolence.  From 2006 to 2011, Ilana served as Encounter's Jerusalem director,
working in close partnership with dozens of Palestinian leaders, academics,
university students and community members. 
Under her leadership, more than a thousand American and Israeli Jews had
the opportunity to gain first-hand exposure to the realities of Palestinian
life in the West Bank and East Jerusalem. 
Prior to her time in the Middle East, she served as Technical
Assistance Officer at American Jewish World Service (AJWS), overseeing
projects in Africa and Asia.  She also
served as an elec­tions monitor to observe and evaluate the electoral process
of newly emerging democracies in Bosnia and Albania, under the auspices
of the OSCE.
A recip­ient of the
Dorot Fellowship in Israel in 2004 and a Pardes Fellow in 2005, Ilana graduated with honors in 1997 from Wesleyan University and is a certified Focusing
professional.  In addition to her work
with the Center, she teaches Jewish conversion courses and is writing a book
about her work in the Middle East.
Daoud Nassar, Tent of Nations
Since 2002, Daoud Nassar has been the founder and
director of the Tent of Nations, an educational and environmental farm and the
location of the February 2015 tree replanting delegation. Daoud  was born
in Beth Jala, nearby Bethlehem in 1970. 
Born into a Christian family, from the beginning Daoud was involved in
church activities, leading children and youth groups. After he finished high
school in 1989, he went to Austria and got a degree in Biblical Studies from
the Bible College.  He came back to
Bethlehem in 1991 and joined Bethlehem University where he got a BA in Business
with a major in Accounting.  In 1998 he
got an MA degree in Tourism Management from Bielefeld University in Germany and
works in the field of alternative tourism. 

The mission of Tent of
Nations is building bridges between people, and between people to the
land.  They bring people of various
cultures together to build bridges of understanding, reconciliation, and peace.  As part of this
mission, Tent of Nations sponsors educational projects at Daher’s Vineyard, the
organic farm, located in the hills southwest of Bethlehem, Palestine.  The farm is a center where people from many
different countries come together to build bridges of trust and hope.  Daoud is married to Jihan and they have three
children, Shadin, Nardine and Bishara.
Aviv
Tatarsky, Engaged Dharma Israel
Aviv Tatarsky is a longtime Israeli peace and human
rights activist and is the primary Israeli partner of the Center for Jewish
Nonviolence. His activism is inspired by 20 years of spiritual practice: Buddhist
meditation, Shiatsu therapy and Martial Arts. In 2009, Aviv initiated Engaged
Dharma Israel, a group of meditation practitioners who engage in
Israeli-Palestinian solidarity action while aiming to raise political awareness
and involvement in the dynamic meditation community in Israel.  Since 2012 Aviv has been working as a
researcher for Ir-Amim, an Israeli NGO which focuses on Jerusalem within
the context of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Through his work and activism
Aviv has first-hand knowledge of Israeli policy in the Occupied Palestinian
Territories, its destructive effects on Palestinians and the possibility for
joint action promoting justice and reconciliation.  He is a board member of Tovana, one of the
largest Insight Meditation organizations in Israel. For 17 years he was a
leading teacher of Kitaido (martial art) in Israel and a senior Shiatsu teacher
and practitioner.  He holds an Msc. in
Mathematics from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem.  Aviv lives in Jerusalem.
Sami
Awad, Holy Land Trust, Bethlehem
Sami Awad is the Executive Director of the Holy Land
Trust, a leading Palestinian organization committed to the pursuit of equality
and justice through nonviolence, and one of the primary Palestinian partners of
the Center for Jewish Nonviolence.  Sami
holds a Master's degree in International
Relations, specializing in Peace and Conflict Resolution from the American
University in Washington D.C. and an undergraduate degree in Political Science
from the University of Kansas.  Prior to
joining Holy Land Trust, Sami worked with the Palestinian Bible Society in
establishing a Biblical Museum in Bethlehem and was responsible for the
activities of the Palestinian Center for the Study of Nonviolence in Jerusalem.
The Center offered seminars and workshops in Conflict Resolution and Democracy
and Nonviolence. Sami is also one of the founders and partners of Radio
Bethlehem 2000, one of the first radio stations to be launched in
Palestine.  Today, Sami’s work continues
to be focused on nonviolence as the catalyst to end all forms of conflict and
establish an enduring and comprehensive peace in the Holy Land.

story:
We are raising funds to create a beautiful full color pin-up calendar of these hard working, lovely, classy ladies. We want to introduce you to The Bad Kitties. All of these ladies work very hard and each has her own persona. They come with an amazing assortment of talents and skills, along with real-life experience. The majority of costuming used in their photo shoots is either created or up-cycled by The Bad Kitties. Currently there are 7 Bad Kitties models and a huge crew of supporting staff involved in make-up, hair, costuming and more.

The cost of this project is to cover 100 calendars. We are looking forward to going over that, but we picked a good reachable goal! The money raised from selling these calendars will be split 50%.. 1/2 will go to a charity that allocates the majority of its funds to it's specific cause. The other 1/2 will be used to help provide more costuming, props, travel funds. This calendar is just the beginning for us. We are considering expanding into posters, cards and other art and are brainstorming ideas for our 2016 calendar. We want to thank everyone in advance for your support. We would not be here if it weren't for the people who believe in us. Your support instills a sense of pride and confidence in these ladies that helps them become amazing women.

Thank you so much for helping this dream come true for these ladies. Many of them have never hoped in their lifetime that they would be featured in a calendar, let alone garner the type of support that we have found from around the world. To all the countries, and people who have helped this along, thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Please note that the calendar will start out mid-2015 and end mid 2016 in order to meet delivery times.

story:
Im Sommer waren wir auf dem Protestmarsch der Flüchtlinge von Straßburg nach Brüssel dabei. In dieser Zeit haben wir einige der Geflüchteten kennenlernen dürfen und ihre Situation besser verstehen gelernt. Nach dem Marsch kehrten wir alle zurück. Wir nach Hause in unsere Wohnungen. Die Flüchtlinge zurück in Heime oder auf die Straße; in menschenunwürdige Zustände. 

Jetzt ist es Winter und es ist kalt geworden. An der Situation der Flüchtlinge hat sich nichts geändert. Wir sind immer noch in engem Kontakt miteinander und können nicht mehr zusehen. Deshalb haben wir uns überlegt, dass wir ihnen die Möglichkeit geben wollen mit uns in unseren WGs zu leben. Seit Oktober leben in einigen WGs bereits Flüchtlinge in freien Zimmern. Leider können wir die Miete nicht dauerhaft übernehmen. 


Mit deiner Spende kannst Du uns folgendermaßen helfen:

  • Ein WG-Zimmer kostet in Berlin durchschnittlich 300Euro.
  • Bei Bedarf können in einem Zimmer bis zu drei Menschen wohnen.
  • Wir wollen mit dem  Spendengeld 30 Flüchtlingen ermöglichen für einen Monat oder 10 Flüchtlingen ermöglichen für 3 Monate in WG-Zimmern zu leben.
Hierbei ist uns wichtig, dass es nicht nur um Schlafmöglichkeiten geht. Die  Flüchtlinge sollen aus der Isolation der Heime herauskommen  und endlich eine Art zu Hause finden!

Ein Beispiel; damit ihr Euch besser vorstellen könnt wie es praktisch aussieht:

H., 29 Jahre alt aus Libyen, wohnt seit einigen Wochen bei einem von uns in der WG. Für ihn, wie für viele andere ist der Aufenthaltsstatus dauerhaft unsicher und für alle schwierig nachzuvollziehen. Er schleppt sich von einem Behördentermin zum nächsten und weiß nicht wie seine Zukunft aussehen wird. Das einzige Positive momentan ist, dass er Menschen in seiner WG hat die im zuhören und ihn ernst nehmen. Wir sitzen gerne abends zusammen, kochen gemeinsam und versuchen zu vergessen, dass der nächste Amtstermin schon eine Abschiebung bedeuten kann.
Wir selbst merken wie wichtig es für H. ist nicht alleine zu sein. Für uns ist er ein Freund geworden den wir gerne länger bei uns hätten.
Dafür brauchen wir Unterstützung!


Freie Zimmer und Soli-Räume finden:

In 6 WGs leben bereits Flüchtlinge, die weiterhin dort wohnen können wenn das Spendenziel erreicht wird.
Außerdem wird grade ein großes Wohnprojekt gegründet in dem 2 Soliräume entstehen könnten, in einer weiteren WG werden 2 Zimmer frei die genutzt werden könnten.
Falls ihr selbst von freien Räumen wisst und das Spendenziel übertroffen wird würden wir gern noch mehr Menschen einen Raum ermöglichen. Deswegen meldet euch gerne bei uns.

story:
Hi Everybody!

Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign page for our short film "Walls."

"Walls" is a story that we can only tell with the help of you (Who? Me?  Yes! You.). Thematically, it is about a universal part of the human condition: feeling lost and emotionally stuck after the loss of a relationship. We hope that its sentiments will resonate with anyone who has experienced this.

Every time a movie is shot and produced to fruition, it is a miracle. There are countless moving parts, complications, details to be ironed out and fires to be put out, in the process of creating films.

In order to be successful in shooting our 14 page script over the course of 2 days, as producers we need to be as prepared as possible. While we feel very much up for the test, our biggest barrier to success is that filmmaking is also, unfortunately, a very expensive art form.

We have devised as bare boned and concise of a budget as possible to pull off our film.  If you choose to donate, your money will be going towards:

  • Talent

  • Crew

  • Equipment Rental (Camera, Audio, Lighting)

  • Insurance

  • Post-Production (Scoring, Editing, Distribution)

As a contributor, you will become a part of the "Walls" production family, receiving special perks and insights to the project's progress throughout the production and after.

Director/Executive Producer James Abrams graduated from the Rochester Institute of Technology with a Film Degree and has written, produced, and directed many short films. You can check out his work here:

https://jamesabramsfilms.wixsite.com/mysite?fbc...

Writer/Executive Producer Noah Broch graduated from SUNY Binghamton as an English Major and is excited to share this story with you.

Our Director of Photography Caleb Weiss graduated from Skidmore College and you can check out his film work here:

https://vimeo.com/calebweiss

We met while working as crew members on an independent feature film and are super excited about our first collaboration.

If you are not in a position to donate right now, we totally understand that and would be so grateful if you decided to share our campaign on social media or with friends and family.

And that's all she wrote. Thank you for hearing us out.

story:
Koop nu u tickets via IN&UIT: http://www.ticketsbrugge.be/nl/monu-4

Vijf jonge kunstenaars creëren naar aanleiding van ‘100 jaar WO I’ het multimediale oorlogsrequiem MONU. Hedendaagse klassieke muziek (voor koor, orkest, orgel en solisten) en een origineel libretto vormen de basis van een 80 minuten durend oorlogsrequiem. Abstract-poëtische filmfragmenten, een enscenering en een eigentijdse choreografie zijn de multimedia-elementen die dit oorlogsrequiem ook visueel interessant maken. De creatie van MONU vindt plaats op 22 april 2015 in het Concertgebouw te Brugge. Een uiterst symbolische datum, want op die dag zal het exact 100 jaar geleden zijn dat in Ieper de eerste gasaanval plaatsvond. Dit trieste gebeuren staat geboekstaafd als het beginpunt van de chemische oorlogsvoering. Het is onze expliciet bedoeling dit momentum een eeuw later met een positieve en humane boodschap van antwoord te dienen. Maar creëren kost geld en daarom willen we deze voorstelling mee helpen financieren aan de hand van een crowdfund.

Website MONU

In ruil voor uw bijdrage schenken wij u graag iets wat blijvend aan MONU herinnert: een postkaart, een muziekopname of een gesigneerde partituur. Ook kan u partner worden van dit project; door het gehele requiem, of een klein deel ervan, op te dragen aan een persoon, een groep of een zaak naar keuze. Bijvoorbeeld aan een familielid die als soldaat is omgekomen in WO I of WO II, aan een vriend die in ander oorlogsgeweld gestorven is, of aan een geliefde die haar of zijn eigen strijd verloren heeft. De mogelijkheden zijn eindeloos. Deze dedicatie staat in de partituur gedrukt en in het programmaboekje krijgt u, zo u wil, de ruimte om het verhaal achter de dedicatie te vertellen. Zo worden ook uw intenties meegenomen in het geheel van deze herdenking. Door ons te steunen maak je ook kans op een duoticket voor de voorstelling waarvan we er, tijdens de crowdfund, elke week één weggeven.

Vijf jonge mensen met een hart voor hedendaagse klassieke muziek, elk vanuit verschillende perspectieven en achtergronden. Recent richtten wij samen synART op, een vereniging die zich tot doel stelt hedendaagse kunstcreaties te maken (podiumvoorstellingen en concerten) via een synergie tussen verscheidene kunstvormen.

Benjamien Lycke (°1989), studeerde in 2013 af als componist aan het Conservatorium te Gent met de opera Acubens en volgt momenteel een extra master compositie in het Royal College of Music te Londen. Jason Slabbynck (°1989) is sinds een aantal jaren werkzaam als architect bij het bekende rotterdamse architectenbureau MVRDV en ontwierp reeds het decor voor de opera Acubens. Mien Bogaert (°1992) studeerde muziek- en theaterwetenschappen aan de universiteit van Gent en volgt momenteel een opleiding tot operaregisseur aan de Hochschule für Musik und Theater in Hamburg. Simon Decraene (°1989) is een gediplomeerd slagwerker en Mithra Van Eenooghe (°1983) concerteert als organist op verscheidene plekken in Europa.

Website synART

Een aantal van de leden van synART realiseerden in 2013 de opera ACUBENS. Dit werk werd in 2013 gecomponeerd door Benjamien Lycke, die hiermee zijn master Compositie aan het Conservatorium Gent succesvol afsloot. Het is hoogst ongebruikelijk dat een masterstudent het voor elkaar krijgt een volledige opera te schrijven en deze daarna ook nog eens professioneel op te voeren (niet concertant, maar met een regie, kostuums en een interessant toneelbeeld). Jason Slabbynck ontwierp het decor van ACUBENS en was verantwoordelijk voor de algemene grafische vormgeving. Simon Decraene hielp mee op organisatorisch vlak en Mithra Van Eenooghe was één van de uitvoerende muzikanten.

Gerichte promotie zorgde ervoor dat de Miryzaal van het Conservatorium Gent - voor het eerst sinds jaren - nokvol zat. ACUBENS werd tijdens de creatie opgenomen en later integraal uitgezonden op OP12 (het derde kanaal van de VRT). 

Website ACUBENS


Het libretto is inmiddels geschreven, een groot deel van de muziek gecomponeerd. De zaal, het Concertgebouw Brugge, is vastgelegd en afgehuurd. De voorbereidingen voor het opnemen van de filmbeelden zijn bijna afgerond en er wordt hard gewerkt aan de regie. Binnenkort beginnen zowel de muzikale als de scènische repetities.

Een klein deel van het requiem – het Kyrie – werd reeds uitgevoerd in de Sint-Salvatorskathedraal te Brugge. De opname daarvan kan u hieronder beluisteren.


Het beoogde eindproduct is een multimediale voorstelling van 80 minuten, die vertrekt vanuit een doorgecomponeerd requiem voor koor, orkest en solisten. Daarnaast omvat MONU ook nog een bijhorende regie, die zowel een enscenering, filmprojecties als een choreografie omvat.

Een kwalitatieve uitwerking van dit project is enkel mogelijk met voldoende financiële middelen. Subsidies voor de culturele sector zijn de laatste jaren echter sterk teruggeschroefd in Vlaanderen en dit treft vooral jonge, beginnende kunstenaars. Overheidsgeld en sponsoring uit de private sector kunnen ons deels, maar niet volledig uit de nood helpen. Het is uw steun die het verschil maakt. Het geld dat we inzamelen via deze crowdfund is de broodnodige financiële duw in de rug om deze voorstelling mogelijk te maken.

De financiële middelen zullen worden aangewend voor de huur van de zaal, het betalen van de muzikanten, de huur van het technisch materieel, de opbouw van het podium, realiseren van goede filmopnames, het maken van de choreografie en het opzetten van een gerichte promocampagne.

We hebben al afspraken met verschillende artistieke partners voor de uitvoering van dit project.

The Chamber Players

Een twintigtal jonge, professionele muzikanten onder leiding van David Anne en Diederik Glorieux die in steeds wisselende bezetting ingezet worden bij de meest verscheidene projecten. Diverse muzikanten uit dit Kortrijkse kamerorkest treden ook regelmatig als solist op.

http://davidannecomponist.wordpress.com/the-chamber-players/

Compagnie Dansarte

Een danscompagnie onder leiding van Sara Delen, verbonden aan de in Kuurne gevestigde dansschool Dance-Control. Sara Delen creëerde als choreografe met Compagnie Dansarte recent de producties Olla!Vogola! en Plat’eau.

http://www.dance-control.be/

Ignace Michiels

Orgeldocent aan het Conservatorium Gent, oprichter van het Vocaal Ensemble de Wijngaard en titularis-organist van de Sint-Salvatorskathedraal te Brugge.

http://www.muziekcentrum.be/identity.php?ID=135868

Vocaal Ensemble de Wijngaard

Brugs koor onder leiding van Ignace Michiels, met als repertoire de requiems van Fauré en Duruflé, werken van Lauridsen, Poulenc, Messiaen, Bach, Bruckner, Mendelssohn en vele anderen. Het Vocaal Ensemble de Wijngaard heeft daarnaast ook heel wat ervaring in het creëeren van hedendaagse werken.

Ars Vocalis

Kortrijks koor onder leiding van Diederik Glorieux, met als repertoire werken van Mozart, Haydn, Vivaldi, Arvo Pärt, Roland Coryn en vele anderen. Ars Vocalis creëerde onlangs het Requiem van David Anne.

http://arsvocaliskortrijk.be/

U kan deelnemen aan deze crowdfund door geld te storten via deze site. Het massaal delen van deze crowdfund op sociale media zoals Facebook, Twitter en Google+ is ook een enorme hulp. En natuurlijk steunt u ons ook door in het Concertgebouw Brugge op 22 april 2015 naar de creatie van MONU te komen luisteren en kijken.

U kan ook rechtstreeks een overschrijving maken naar de rekening van synART:

vzw synART / IBAN: BE89 9730 9948 8385 / BIC: ARSPBE22

Vergeet na de overschrijving niet een mail te sturen met de vermelding welke artistieke ‘perk’ u hiervoor terug wil.

crowdfund@synart.eu

Indien u problemen hebt met het uitvoeren van de betaling via PayPal of overschrijving, aarzel niet om contact met ons op te nemen.

Aarzel niet om contact met ons op te nemen indien je meer vragen hebt over één van de perks: crowdfund@synart.eu

Hier alvast een impressie van de cd-box en de T-shirt

28/11/2014 - Brugsch Handelsblad

21/11/2014 - Exit

Met vijf jonge kunstenaars een project van een dergelijke omvang in eigen beheer organiseren, is geen evidentie en kent vele risico’s. De datum staat vast en de uitvoering van MONU vindt sowieso plaats. Een tekort aan financiële middelen (uitblijven van overheidssubsidies, te weinig sponsoring vanuit de private sector) zou echter betekenen dat we het volledige artistieke concept niet kunnen realiseren en dat MONU noodgedwongen in een gereduceerde vorm zal uitgevoerd worden. Dat zou erg spijtig zijn, omdat de positieve en humane boodschap die wij willen brengen, evenals het innovatieve concept dat wij aanbieden, het verdient om in zijn volledigheid opgevoerd te worden. Uw steun kan hier iets aan veranderen. U kan uw stem laten klinken en ervoor zorgen dat wij niet geheel en al afhankelijk zijn van de overheid en van de private sponsors. Uw steun is onze zuurstof.

Bedankt, Merci beaucoup, Dank, Thank you!
story_txt:
Koop nu u tickets via IN&UIT: http://www.ticketsbrugge.be/nl/monu-4Vijf jonge kunstenaars creëren naar aanleiding van ‘100 jaar WO I’ het multimediale oorlogsrequiem MONU. Hedendaagse klassieke muziek (voor koor, orkest, orgel en solisten) en een origineel libretto vormen de basis van een 80 minuten durend oorlogsrequiem. Abstract-poëtische filmfragmenten, een enscenering en een eigentijdse choreografie zijn de multimedia-elementen die dit oorlogsrequiem ook visueel interessant maken. De creatie van MONU vindt plaats op 22 april 2015 in het Concertgebouw te Brugge. Een uiterst symbolische datum, want op die dag zal het exact 100 jaar geleden zijn dat in Ieper de eerste gasaanval plaatsvond. Dit trieste gebeuren staat geboekstaafd als het beginpunt van de chemische oorlogsvoering. Het is onze expliciet bedoeling dit momentum een eeuw later met een positieve en humane boodschap van antwoord te dienen. Maar creëren kost geld en daarom willen we deze voorstelling mee helpen financieren aan de hand van een crowdfund.Website MONUIn ruil voor uw bijdrage schenken wij u graag iets wat blijvend aan MONU herinnert: een postkaart, een muziekopname of een gesigneerde partituur. Ook kan u partner worden van dit project; door het gehele requiem, of een klein deel ervan, op te dragen aan een persoon, een groep of een zaak naar keuze. Bijvoorbeeld aan een familielid die als soldaat is omgekomen in WO I of WO II, aan een vriend die in ander oorlogsgeweld gestorven is, of aan een geliefde die haar of zijn eigen strijd verloren heeft. De mogelijkheden zijn eindeloos. Deze dedicatie staat in de partituur gedrukt en in het programmaboekje krijgt u, zo u wil, de ruimte om het verhaal achter de dedicatie te vertellen. Zo worden ook uw intenties meegenomen in het geheel van deze herdenking. Door ons te steunen maak je ook kans op een duoticket voor de voorstelling waarvan we er, tijdens de crowdfund, elke week één weggeven.Vijf jonge mensen met een hart voor hedendaagse klassieke muziek, elk vanuit verschillende perspectieven en achtergronden. Recent richtten wij samen synART op, een vereniging die zich tot doel stelt hedendaagse kunstcreaties te maken (podiumvoorstellingen en concerten) via een synergie tussen verscheidene kunstvormen.Benjamien Lycke (°1989), studeerde in 2013 af als componist aan het Conservatorium te Gent met de opera Acubens en volgt momenteel een extra master compositie in het Royal College of Music te Londen. Jason Slabbynck (°1989) is sinds een aantal jaren werkzaam als architect bij het bekende rotterdamse architectenbureau MVRDV en ontwierp reeds het decor voor de opera Acubens. Mien Bogaert (°1992) studeerde muziek- en theaterwetenschappen aan de universiteit van Gent en volgt momenteel een opleiding tot operaregisseur aan de Hochschule für Musik und Theater in Hamburg. Simon Decraene (°1989) is een gediplomeerd slagwerker en Mithra Van Eenooghe (°1983) concerteert als organist op verscheidene plekken in Europa.Website synART



Een aantal van de leden van synART realiseerden in 2013 de opera ACUBENS. Dit werk werd in 2013 gecomponeerd door Benjamien Lycke, die hiermee zijn master Compositie aan het Conservatorium Gent succesvol afsloot. Het is hoogst ongebruikelijk dat een masterstudent het voor elkaar krijgt een volledige opera te schrijven en deze daarna ook nog eens professioneel op te voeren (niet concertant, maar met een regie, kostuums en een interessant toneelbeeld). Jason Slabbynck ontwierp het decor van ACUBENS en was verantwoordelijk voor de algemene grafische vormgeving. Simon Decraene hielp mee op organisatorisch vlak en Mithra Van Eenooghe was één van de uitvoerende muzikanten.Gerichte promotie zorgde ervoor dat de Miryzaal van het Conservatorium Gent - voor het eerst sinds jaren - nokvol zat. ACUBENS werd tijdens de creatie opgenomen en later integraal uitgezonden op OP12 (het derde kanaal van de VRT). 
Website ACUBENS
Het libretto is inmiddels geschreven, een groot deel van de muziek gecomponeerd. De zaal, het Concertgebouw Brugge, is vastgelegd en afgehuurd. De voorbereidingen voor het opnemen van de filmbeelden zijn bijna afgerond en er wordt hard gewerkt aan de regie. Binnenkort beginnen zowel de muzikale als de scènische repetities.Een klein deel van het requiem – het Kyrie – werd reeds uitgevoerd in de Sint-Salvatorskathedraal te Brugge. De opname daarvan kan u hieronder beluisteren.Het beoogde eindproduct is een multimediale voorstelling van 80 minuten, die vertrekt vanuit een doorgecomponeerd requiem voor koor, orkest en solisten. Daarnaast omvat MONU ook nog een bijhorende regie, die zowel een enscenering, filmprojecties als een choreografie omvat.Een kwalitatieve uitwerking van dit project is enkel mogelijk met voldoende financiële middelen. Subsidies voor de culturele sector zijn de laatste jaren echter sterk teruggeschroefd in Vlaanderen en dit treft vooral jonge, beginnende kunstenaars. Overheidsgeld en sponsoring uit de private sector kunnen ons deels, maar niet volledig uit de nood helpen. Het is uw steun die het verschil maakt. Het geld dat we inzamelen via deze crowdfund is de broodnodige financiële duw in de rug om deze voorstelling mogelijk te maken.De financiële middelen zullen worden aangewend voor de huur van de zaal, het betalen van de muzikanten, de huur van het technisch materieel, de opbouw van het podium, realiseren van goede filmopnames, het maken van de choreografie en het opzetten van een gerichte promocampagne.We hebben al afspraken met verschillende artistieke partners voor de uitvoering van dit project.The Chamber PlayersEen twintigtal jonge, professionele muzikanten onder leiding van David Anne en Diederik Glorieux die in steeds wisselende bezetting ingezet worden bij de meest verscheidene projecten. Diverse muzikanten uit dit Kortrijkse kamerorkest treden ook regelmatig als solist op.http://davidannecomponist.wordpress.com/the-chamber-players/Compagnie DansarteEen danscompagnie onder leiding van Sara Delen, verbonden aan de in Kuurne gevestigde dansschool Dance-Control. Sara Delen creëerde als choreografe met Compagnie Dansarte recent de producties Olla!Vogola! en Plat’eau.http://www.dance-control.be/Ignace MichielsOrgeldocent aan het Conservatorium Gent, oprichter van het Vocaal Ensemble de Wijngaard en titularis-organist van de Sint-Salvatorskathedraal te Brugge.http://www.muziekcentrum.be/identity.php?ID=135868Vocaal Ensemble de WijngaardBrugs koor onder leiding van Ignace Michiels, met als repertoire de requiems van Fauré en Duruflé, werken van Lauridsen, Poulenc, Messiaen, Bach, Bruckner, Mendelssohn en vele anderen. Het Vocaal Ensemble de Wijngaard heeft daarnaast ook heel wat ervaring in het creëeren van hedendaagse werken.Ars VocalisKortrijks koor onder leiding van Diederik Glorieux, met als repertoire werken van Mozart, Haydn, Vivaldi, Arvo Pärt, Roland Coryn en vele anderen. Ars Vocalis creëerde onlangs het Requiem van David Anne.http://arsvocaliskortrijk.be/U kan deelnemen aan deze crowdfund door geld te storten via deze site. Het massaal delen van deze crowdfund op sociale media zoals Facebook, Twitter en Google+ is ook een enorme hulp. En natuurlijk steunt u ons ook door in het Concertgebouw Brugge op 22 april 2015 naar de creatie van MONU te komen luisteren en kijken.U kan ook rechtstreeks een overschrijving maken naar de rekening van synART:vzw synART / IBAN: BE89 9730 9948 8385 / BIC: ARSPBE22Vergeet na de overschrijving niet een mail te sturen met de vermelding welke artistieke ‘perk’ u hiervoor terug wil.crowdfund@synart.euIndien u problemen hebt met het uitvoeren van de betaling via PayPal of overschrijving, aarzel niet om contact met ons op te nemen.Aarzel niet om contact met ons op te nemen indien je meer vragen hebt over één van de perks: crowdfund@synart.eu
Hier alvast een impressie van de cd-box en de T-shirt





28/11/2014 - Brugsch Handelsblad

21/11/2014 - Exit


Met vijf jonge kunstenaars een project van een dergelijke omvang in eigen beheer organiseren, is geen evidentie en kent vele risico’s. De datum staat vast en de uitvoering van MONU vindt sowieso plaats. Een tekort aan financiële middelen (uitblijven van overheidssubsidies, te weinig sponsoring vanuit de private sector) zou echter betekenen dat we het volledige artistieke concept niet kunnen realiseren en dat MONU noodgedwongen in een gereduceerde vorm zal uitgevoerd worden. Dat zou erg spijtig zijn, omdat de positieve en humane boodschap die wij willen brengen, evenals het innovatieve concept dat wij aanbieden, het verdient om in zijn volledigheid opgevoerd te worden. Uw steun kan hier iets aan veranderen. U kan uw stem laten klinken en ervoor zorgen dat wij niet geheel en al afhankelijk zijn van de overheid en van de private sponsors. Uw steun is onze zuurstof.
Bedankt, Merci beaucoup, Dank, Thank you!

story:
What is BUNKER Projects?

We are building an artist-run residency and experimental gallery program in the Garfield neighborhood of Pittsburgh, PA. BUNKER Projects will host artists of various disciplines for three-month periods in a custom live/work space. Through this opportunity we will support the professional growth of emerging artists while cultivating Pittsburgh’s burgeoning arts scene.


What is an artist residency?

A residency program invites artists to live in a specific locale and spend a period of time intensively working on self-directed projects.


Why is BUNKER Projects’ Residency unique?

BUNKER Projects is a unique program because of its location, its capacity, and the close relationships we hope to foster. Artists will live, create, and exhibit their work in one location, merging the artistic process with the act of intentional living and community involvement. We invite our residents to view the BUNKER Projects space as a place to experiment and expand their practice while connecting with new communities in Pittsburgh through our Public Diffusion Program; a program that brings resident artists and community members together for collaborative projects.


Why does Pittsburgh need BUNKER Projects?

Pittsburgh is a prime spot for emerging artists! The low cost of living and available resources have inspired many makers and creative professionals to move here, but there are very few live-in residencies for artists.

BUNKER Projects provides a residency opportunity that serves local artists while also bringing national and international artists to exchange with this city’s awesome arts community. We believe that the success of our program will inspire more like it!


Why do we need your support?

Since November 2012 we have been working to renovate our residency site. A large portion of the building had been destroyed by a fire and years of neglect. The space required new plumbing, electric, and heating systems, in addition to a number of structural and cosmetic repairs.

As young working artists we were not able to pay for the total cost of renovations ourselves. With volunteer labor and the financial support of grants and fundraisers we have brought the space to a point where we are almost ready to host our 2014 residents, but we still need your help!


Where will the money go?

Plumbing Installation: $4,500

Floor and Ceiling Repair: $2,400

Electrical Repair: $4,800

Insulation: $1,700

Drywall: $4,000

Tools: $400

Total: $17,800


Why $10,000?

Yes, we would love to fund-raise the total amount of our renovations but luckily we have gotten this far with help from various sources including Soup N’at, an outreach grant from Penn State University, support from our fiscal sponsor the Bloomfield Garfield Corporation, and a recent loan from friends & family.

$10,000 will help us get the finishing renovation touches we desperately need in order to start our new year of residents. Every dollar funded above the $10,000 will fund our monthly operating costs and programmed events.

We have put in plenty of our own money and time to make this project happen, but if we raise $10,000 we will be able to finish installing our resident kitchen & bathroom, which is currently a set of hand-me-down fixtures sitting in the frame of the bathroom.


How can you help?

Help us meet our goal by donating to the campaign! Share the link with friends and family! Apply to be a resident or share this opportunity with an artist you know!


Want to know more about what we do? Visit bunkerprojects.org to find out!

story:
Please stay in touch with all things Pubbets by visiting our website www.pubbets.net 

| Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Youtube |

The Camillian Home - http://www.camillianhomelatkrabang.org/

Iceman Charity - https://www.icemancharity.com/

Hand to Hand Foundation - http://www.handtohandpattaya.com/

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that the factory experiences delays in production, however, they have a long history of successful projects, working on products much more complex than my Pubbets.

There is a risk that shipping may take longer than the promised 10-12 days. However, the freight forwarding company will be using the e-packet postage system which successfully transports thousands of packages worldwide each day.

Future Goals

  • Setting up a workshop here in Thailand and employing disadvantaged people
  • Pubbet #2 is designed and samples will be made in November/December with a planned release in Q1 2019.
  • Pubbet clothing and accessories, including full outfits, props and hair pieces etc
  • A Pubbet Kit which will include a blank body and a variety of different noses, eyes and hair pieces that will attach using high strength magnets.
  • Releasing at least 2 new Pubbet characters each year.
  • Ongoing Puppetry training for online teachers and weekly online hangouts etc.
  • An online teaching/puppetry guidebook with videos.
  • Sponsoring disadvantage children through the Hand to Hand Foundation.
  • Establishing an Arts Scholarship Program for disadvantaged children.

story:
The Show

Diende Visus, or "Next Vision", is a collection of New Media art pieces representing the new generation of exhibition artwork. Working together to build a community of media arts, we are a team of emerging artists, from Toronto, Ontario, who want to take you through our perspective of the art world. Take this chance to experience how we transform our visions into all forms of media, from robotics pieces to VR programs to live performances.

Featured Work

Silva (performance) Created by Jessie Lee and Choreographed by Zsakira Del Col - Showtimes 7pm. 8pm. 9pm. 10pm.

Reactiles (interactive) Created by Alec Mulder

A(NOT)Man (video/sound) Created by Joanne Fan

Bloom (interactive/sound) Created by Gabbie Pangan

Walking the Line (interactive/sound) Created by Dana Kornelia

Tree Tank (innovation) Created by Ashley Jane Lewis

妈, what time was it over there? (installation) Created by Jay Zhuang

AND MORE TO BE ANNOUNCED!

Funding

We need your help to get this show ready for opening night! From transportation to space rental to insurance, our costs are adding up and your support can help make our dream into a reality. So show how much you care by simply buying a ticket in our perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Instagram, click Attending on our Facebook event, and SHARE SHARE SHARE!

Invite your friends and family!

story:
Last year, you enabled us to bring Dr. Placebo's Fantastical Farmacological Fountain to the good people of Black Rock City. WE THANK YOU! With your contributions, we were able to roam the playa, providing warm elixirs to soothe your ailments. 

This year, we want to cure in a new way; through our latest project, Dr. Placebo's Magically Mystical Cabinet of Cures!

Imagine a mysterious cabinet freshly stocked with cure-alls. But these are no ordinary cures. No, these cures, will provoke meaningful interaction. Pick a cure, any cure, and you will be launched on a journey to betterment.  

We have 35 new cure-alls, each with tasks to employ fellow participants to rejuvenate yourself, bringing you ever closer to a life bereft of ailments. 

 

Build and Design

Each of Dr. Placebo's cure-alls will be encased in a beautifully hand-crafted, reclaimed wooden medicine cabinet, complete with ornate embellishments, including a velvety, luxurious curtain. What lies behind the curtain? That's for you to find out!

Design Inspiration for Dr. Placebo's Magically Mystical Medicine Cabinet

 

The cabinet will stand 4' high and 2' wide, large enough to fill it with 35 new cure-alls. It will be mobile, so we can also take it on adventures out in the deep playa.

Sketch of Cabinet Concept

 

It's All In The Details

Each sacred bottle containing Dr. Placebo's magic cure-alls will be affixed with detailed and colorful labels that will transport you to a time of traveling carnivals, Freak Shows, and Snake Oil Salesmen, if you can bare it.

 

 

Some of Our Perks!

Dr. Placebo's Snake Oil Emporium Pendant (Silver Finish and Brass Finish)

 

Original Playa Pendant ​in Antique Silver Finish

 

Original Playa Pendant ​in Antique Brass Finish

 

We Cannot Wait to CURE you!​

Thank YOU!!!
