story:
Hey, I’m back!

This time I am raising funds to restore an old garage which will house the printing equipment that my 2012 Indiegogo campaign helped me move to Detroit, Michigan.

This old garage is called THE PILE OF BRICKS. It will be a space -- a Printery -- where people who have an interest in Letterpress Printing can print, learn to print, and teach each other how to print. 

Last month the landlord raised the rent where I currently print and house my presses by 60%. This raise hurts. And there are rumors they want to move all the tenants out of the space. AND SOON.

Your generous support will help me complete the restoration of the Pile of Bricks ahead of schedule so I can move out of my present space before I’m kicked out.



We need to raise $71,000 USD to complete the restoration of the PILE OF BRICKS. 

Each year I have spent $20,000 USD on restoring The Pile of Bricks while also paying rent on a separate place to print. I have funded this restoration with the money left from my previous Indiegogo campaign and my shallow pockets. It is amazing what saving can do!

Rather than saving funds for three more years, I am asking you to pledge to this campaign. This time the funds will go to complete the restoration of the building. This includes:

WAIT! That adds up to $85,000 USD. Where is the rest of the money coming from?
MY SAVINGS. In for a dime, in for a dollar. TOGETHER, we can do this.

Your annual subscription of at least $120 USD to my Tiny Posters will help me FUND THE RESTORATION OF THE PILE OF BRICKS.  You won’t get 12 tiny posters but 13, a Baker’s Dozen. Yes, 13 posters for at least $120 USD. I wanted to bring this project to completion without your help but the rent increase will cost too much. And I don’t want to give any more money to the landlord.

I need your support. This time the perks are a Baker’s Dozen of Tiny Posters. The different subscriptions are:

  • Random Quotes
  • Social Justice Quotes
  • Nature/Environment Quotes
  • Voting Quotes
  • Women’s Quotes
  • Give-a-Friend-a-Card 
     

PLEASE NOTE:
Photos show samples of previous work. ALL 2020 SUBSCRIPTIONS will be ALL NEW WORK.

Photos show color & design variation. No two posters will be exactly alike.



Women's Quotes published in 2019.



PLEASE NOTE: 2020 subscriptions will be ALL NEW QUOTES.


 

WHY IS THIS PROJECT IMPORTANT?

In 2012, my Indiegogo patrons pledged funds for me to move more than 5 tons of printing equipment to establish The Detroit Printing Plant. 

Eight years and an additional $121,000 later, we have a 3200 sq ft building and funding for the Plant has been used for architect fees, city permits, a land survey, a new insulated roof for the building and major brick work. 

  

Also in the past eight years, the Detroit Printing Plant has evolved into the PRINTING PLANT, the Printery of the Americas, a 501c3 letterpress educational institution. 

  

When restoration on the building is completed, it will house my imprint, KennedyPrints!, and the Printing Plant.  The Printing Plant will be an international community printshop that will allow people to explore poster printing via letterpress printing & wood type.

At the Printing Plant, WE PLAY HARD. WE PRINT HARDER. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

1) FOLLOW YOUR DREAMS whether or not you decide to support the Pile of Bricks

2) FOLLOW the @pile_of_bricks on Instagram. Click the Notification button to know when we post or share stories.

3) FOLLOW KennedyPrints! on Facebook and Instagram

4) SHARE the campaign to your friends & family by using the power of the social network to make good things happen! 

5) SEND the campaign out to your letterpress, craft, and art news groups

6) READ more about my restoration project HERE & SPREAD THE WORD!

Together, we are building this!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Restoration of The Pile of Bricks will happen with or without your subscription. But your subscription will make it happen faster, and cost less.

I have successfully fulfilled all the perks from my previous campaign, and I do not foresee any unmanageable challenges nor delays.
story_txt:
Hey, I’m back!This time I am raising funds to restore an old garage which will house the printing equipment that my 2012 Indiegogo campaign helped me move to Detroit, Michigan.This old garage is called THE PILE OF BRICKS. It will be a space -- a Printery -- where people who have an interest in Letterpress Printing can print, learn to print, and teach each other how to print. Last month the landlord raised the rent where I currently print and house my presses by 60%. This raise hurts. And there are rumors they want to move all the tenants out of the space. AND SOON.Your generous support will help me complete the restoration of the Pile of Bricks ahead of schedule so I can move out of my present space before I’m kicked out.We need to raise $71,000 USD to complete the restoration of the PILE OF BRICKS. Each year I have spent $20,000 USD on restoring The Pile of Bricks while also paying rent on a separate place to print. I have funded this restoration with the money left from my previous Indiegogo campaign and my shallow pockets. It is amazing what saving can do!Rather than saving funds for three more years, I am asking you to pledge to this campaign. This time the funds will go to complete the restoration of the building. This includes:WAIT! That adds up to $85,000 USD. Where is the rest of the money coming from?MY SAVINGS. In for a dime, in for a dollar. TOGETHER, we can do this.Your annual subscription of at least $120 USD to my Tiny Posters will help me FUND THE RESTORATION OF THE PILE OF BRICKS.  You won’t get 12 tiny posters but 13, a Baker’s Dozen. Yes, 13 posters for at least $120 USD. I wanted to bring this project to completion without your help but the rent increase will cost too much. And I don’t want to give any more money to the landlord.I need your support. This time the perks are a Baker’s Dozen of Tiny Posters. The different subscriptions are:
Random Quotes
Social Justice Quotes
Nature/Environment Quotes
Voting Quotes
Women’s Quotes
Give-a-Friend-a-Card  
PLEASE NOTE:Photos show samples of previous work. ALL 2020 SUBSCRIPTIONS will be ALL NEW WORK.Photos show color & design variation. No two posters will be exactly alike.Women's Quotes published in 2019. PLEASE NOTE: 2020 subscriptions will be ALL NEW QUOTES. WHY IS THIS PROJECT IMPORTANT?In 2012, my Indiegogo patrons pledged funds for me to move more than 5 tons of printing equipment to establish The Detroit Printing Plant. Eight years and an additional $121,000 later, we have a 3200 sq ft building and funding for the Plant has been used for architect fees, city permits, a land survey, a new insulated roof for the building and major brick work.   Also in the past eight years, the Detroit Printing Plant has evolved into the PRINTING PLANT, the Printery of the Americas, a 501c3 letterpress educational institution.   When restoration on the building is completed, it will house my imprint, KennedyPrints!, and the Printing Plant.  The Printing Plant will be an international community printshop that will allow people to explore poster printing via letterpress printing & wood type.At the Printing Plant, WE PLAY HARD. WE PRINT HARDER.  OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:1) FOLLOW YOUR DREAMS whether or not you decide to support the Pile of Bricks2) FOLLOW the @pile_of_bricks on Instagram. Click the Notification button to know when we post or share stories.3) FOLLOW KennedyPrints! on Facebook and Instagram4) SHARE the campaign to your friends & family by using the power of the social network to make good things happen! 5) SEND the campaign out to your letterpress, craft, and art news groups6) READ more about my restoration project HERE & SPREAD THE WORD!Together, we are building this! RISKS & CHALLENGESRestoration of The Pile of Bricks will happen with or without your subscription. But your subscription will make it happen faster, and cost less.I have successfully fulfilled all the perks from my previous campaign, and I do not foresee any unmanageable challenges nor delays.

story:
This Campaign has now entered InDemand status which means officially its ended but you can still contribute and you will receive your selected perks in exactly the same way.

The deck itself is nearly finished and designing the last few cards is my priority now. 

Once all the card designs are finished I'll be producing a test deck to ensure the printing and card stock are up to scratch. Then I'll finalise and print the mercurial codex and finally I'll be creating the packaging and the custom designs for those that donated for Custom Codex bundle. 

Although I want to leave this project open to further donations my priority is getting the deck out to those that have backed me so its still full steam ahead!

What's this?

I'm Chris, an artist an musician who lives in Norwich, UK. I've been drawing and creating nearly all my life and for almost as long as I can remember I've been fascinated by the Tarot. 

For many years I've wanted to create my own unique deck and now that I've completed the minor arcana I've started this campaign in order to produce printed copies of the deck for tarot enthusiasts everywhere to enjoy!

I wanted the images to be more than just a re-imagining or style change of the popular tarot standards. I wanted to introduce new perspectives to the classic interpretations and to reflect the synergy of a diverse modern perspective with the ancient wisdom the tarot embodies. 

The cards are small to allow this tarot to be used easily whenever and wherever! I love this small format as its so much easier to shuffle and handle and you don't kneed so much room to lay out a full spread, perfect for train journeys or at the pub! The original deck I'm creating consists of hand drawn images on small cards cut to the golden ratio (5 by 8.1 cm). This will be reproduced at exactly the same scale so you get a really personal feel from the deck.

The Mercurial tarot is quite different from the norm but I hope it will be something that both experienced readers and newcomers to tarot can enjoy.

How it all came to be..

I remember finding a deck my dad kept in in a wooden box in the living room. The images on the cards  seemed so strange, each tiny scene clearly meant something, like part of a dream, the odd characters seemed to know something more than I did about the world. It was odd to me that my Dad, an atheist schooled in science should own something so clearly superstitious, filled with fairy tale characters and strange symbols. 

For a long time they remained a puzzling thing in a box on a high shelf but eventually I learned how to use them and they began to give up their secrets. When I began to understand what the tarot really was it opened up an ever expanding well of inspiration for me and I knew that one day I would have to create my own deck.
Some 11 years later and here it is! Hopefully the first of many...
I realized after a few false starts that the imagery needed to come quickly and instinctively. I wanted the images to  be clean and clear and I liked the idea of a small deck that could fit in your pocket or in a pack for a long journey. 
Creating this deck meant a great deal to me and to begin with it really was just for me. While I was making it though people started to take an interest and I realized it could become something a lot of people could enjoy using. This deck incorporates both my life experiences and the philosophy these have left me with. It draws from various magical, spiritual and occult beliefs but it also reflects the modern world just as the original tarot reflected the culture of its time. I hope it will add another facet to the steadily growing pantheon of modern tarot decks.

What I Need & What You Get

I really hope my deck can become something which many people can enjoy but I don’t have the funds to simply produce the decks on my own. I hope this campaign will provide a platform to reach people and the pledging system means I can get just the finds I need to produce the deck for everyone that wants to own one and everyone’s happy! 


So where will your money go?

1. Printing the cards

2. Printing a codex to accompany the deck

3. Creating the bags and custom hard cases for the deluxe version (for some reason a golden rectangle is not a standard size for packaging!)

4. Shipping the deck to you.

5. …and my dinner!


I decided to to several tiers of production to keep it accessible.

The basic package will just include all the cards in a lovely cotton drawstring bag.

Those who want to know more about the unique images I've created can get the package which includes the codex I've produced specifically for use with this deck. 

And for those who want the full works in the deluxe package the cards will come wrapped in red or black silk with a signed codex and in a custom hard travel case.

I've chosen flexible funding so that even if I don't reach my goal everyone who has contributed to the project will receive the package they paid for. I want people to use and enjoy this unique tarot and this was the best way to achieve that!

What you're doing for me.. 

I have been producing and selling my own artwork for years but successful trade relies on me keeping my overheads low. This will be the first time I've used indiegogo to help a project go far beyond what I could achieve on my own. If this is a success believe me I'll be back with more projects.

Where we stand

The printing process is planned out as well as the materials for the custom cases and packaging. All I need is your money to make this happen and you will receive exactly what you pay for, what could be fairer!  


Other Ways You Can Help!

If you think this is interesting or you like the art but cant afford a pack why not help me out by sharing the campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter, tumblr, all that great stuff! Just use the share tools on this page, its all good karma!

 If you think this is interesting or you like the art but cant afford a pack why not help me out by sharing the campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter, tumblr, all that great stuff! Just use the share tools on this page, its all good karma!

story:
But to make the magic happen, the Krampus Needs Your Help!

Krampus Night is produced by Krampus Legend & Arts Workshop (KLAW), a diverse collective of friends, artists, and organizers with documented experience creating successful artwork and events.

KLAW needs to raise $1,000 from our community to make sure people know about the BEST Krampus event this side of the Alps! 

All Donations go toward our special Krampus Kare Program: 

  • Grooming
  • Horn & Klaw Sharpening
  • Facials
  • Coal Re-Supply
  • Switch Gathering
  • Steam Room
  • Fur-Cuts

Thank you for keeping the Krampus in Bloomington as one of our premier winter events!

story:
hi at all,

I use indiegogo for to continue the adventure. My adventure begin now ... it's a dream just a dream ...

I need you for to start to distrib my réalisations. Why I need you ? because for to sell I need to buy a licence (Marvel, DC ...) and create a mold for all my réalisations ... It's the price for to find around the world my réalisations.

Please help me ... I need you.

Thanks at all for your interest, I hope that my approach agreed you.

Jean

story:
first of all many thanks to everyone who contributed to my original campaign, whether by donating money or sharing my page. 

There are a lot of amazing people who are ready to help, while asking for nothing in return. They just believe in you and your right to achieve your dreams. So thank you from the core of my heart!

I live in a Gaza city in Palestine which is under siege, my art is my way to tell the world about how I am living and how does life look without peace.

I always believe that LOVE is stronger than BOMBS. I participated in many galleries in Gaza but I never had my own gallery, my dream is to make a special and big gallery in my city for the first time, this is going to make me feel happy that I least I am trying to do anything to draw happiness in my life even if it is not available.

All of the things I have done, and still want to do, involve art, and I believe that I am a good artist. I didn't and won't give up because a good leader never gives up, I am doing this for me, my family, and as a representative of my country with a goal towards a better future with freedom.

Why am I doing this funding?

This is to help me to achieve my childhood dream, and it is to start from Gaza then to the world. my plan is to make a lot of galleries all over the world starting from my small city then to a big world.

What will achieving my goal do?

• Achieving my goal of collecting almost $5000 will help me to make my own gallery in Gaza; it would change my future to the best, I can sell my art and then save money to travel to another place to make a new gallery there.

• Achieving my goal would make my parents, friends, and community proud of me as somebody who was able to be a successful person in this world.

• Finally, achieving my goal would be my only hope for an artist. and I sacrificed a lot to make this dream come true and am really excited about beginning a new life far away from all the wars and the political situation that we live in. 

How people can help?

I would really appreciate everyone’s help by supporting, donating, or sharing this web site with those who may be interested in helping.

THANK YOU SO MUCH

story:
We march together toward a bigger purpose in solidarity on July, 19, 2014.

Description 

MISSION:

We hope to inspire Canadians to take action and support us on July 19, 2014 for our annual march and rally and to grow a community committed to ending bullying, hate crimes and homophobia.


BACKGROUND:

“”Chevi tells me that as he was walking to Safeway, a vehicle pulled up beside him. Inside there were three men. “They stopped at the intersection beside me,” he says. “They started shouting anti-gay comments such as, ‘Hey faggot, you’re a fucking faggot, you faggot!’” Chevi handled this verbal attack with remarkable poise and well, fabulousness. He turned around to face them, said, “Thank you.” and continued on his way.

“It was embarrassing.” Chevi says about being verbally assaulted. “There were so many people around. There are so many students in the area and everyone could hear what they were saying to me!”He texted a friend about what had happened, not realizing that the van had begun backing up towards him. It stopped and the three men jumped out of the car and assaulted him. Area residents saw everything that happened and ran to his rescue.”" (2012, Autostraddle interview by Malaika)

Within weeks Chevi inspires the public to stand up for Social Equality and Anti- Bullying after homophobes attacked him in public on July 19, 2012. He is turning a negative and traumatic experience in his life into an opportunity to bring attention and exposure to one of the problems that is plaguing our society. On Aug 2nd 2012 Chevi led a successful March and Rally with speeches given from a number of Alberta’s Prominent Politicians such as Alberta Deputy Premier, Thomas Lukaszuk. His story gained much media attention and his message was heard loud and clear:

“I hope that my story helps someone know that it’s okay to be yourself, that it is okay to be openly gay, lesbian, bisexual, or transgender. You are valued in our society. And life is worth living. ” Chevi Rabbit

On April 9, 2014 Chevi Rabbit receives the Alberta Hate Crime Committee, “2014 Hate Crime Awareness Youth Award” by MLA Minister of Justice and Solicitor General the Honorable Jonathan Denis

What We Need & What You Get

Funding will be used in the following areas:

  • Preparation and supplies for #YEG 2014 Pride Parade
  • Registration payment for Pride Parade 
  • Print and Design: Flyers, Brochures and Handouts 
  • "Hate to Hope March & Rally" Banner
  • Refreshments for all the participants 
  • Website update and yearly hosting payment
  • "Thank you" Gifts for the speakers
  • We also need funds to set up booths throughout the summer. 
  • Informatiom booths

The Impact

With your contributions you will be proving to the rest of the world that Edmonton, Alberta is truly a place to live safely and that we are proactive in the fight against hate, homophobia and bullying. You are a citizen that believes in healthy and strong communities. 

All people or organizations contributed can have their information shared on our social media outlets or if you choose to remain anonymous - that is okay too. You help is needed and very much appreciated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can make a difference by sharing the information and inviting all your friends on your social media outlets. Be proactive and show up on July 19, 2014.
  • We will need volunteers for Pride Parade.
  • We will need volunteers and will post details our website, facebook & twitter
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it. xoxo

Committee:
Yasri Akhtar
Danielle Paradis 
Chevi Rabbit 


Past supporters:

  • Alberta Hate Crime Committee
  • John Humphrey Centre for Peace and Human Rights
  • I Dig Your Girlfriend 
  • Montana First Nation

story:
The FREE ART Project

The FREE ART Project is a grassroots arts program which includes a series of Showcases, Open Mics & Workshops that are free & open to the public.  Our program is run on a non-profit standard therefore we look to members of our collective communities for funding to help ensure the growth and continuity of these programs.

 

This summer The Artist Collective will continue The FREE ART Project with new series of workshops, open mics and showcases, as well as picking back up with the workshops  & open mics that we've been running through the Fall & Winter.              

 

Workshops -

  • "WordPlay" (Writing/Performance) 
  • Fashion, Journalism & Photography
  • Culinary/Nutrition/Fitness
  • Writing Through Photography (Creative Writing/Poetry)
  • Visual Art
  • Acting/Improv

 

   ... And Many More

Open Mics

  • Anatomy of an Idea
  • The Bean Runner Poetry Project
  • The Inner Monologue (Actors Open Mic + Showcase

 

Showcases

  • Collective Sundays - Free Monthly Artist Collective Concerts

 

Funds Will Be Used Towards:

  • Securing A Venue to Host Workshops
  • Materials For Workshops
  • Facilitators
  • A Website with Registration Links & Workshop Calendar
  • Applying for 501 C3 Non Profit Status
  • Securing Transportation for Workshops to Correctional Facilitaties, Schools and other Out-of-town Events

 

Our program is constantly growing, any funds accumulated that surpass our goal will be used towards building a wider variety of workshops and events.

For More Information on The Artist Collective & The FREE ART Project check us out on Facebook or Email Us directly.

www.Facebook.com/TheArtistCollective

IHeartFreeArt@Gmail.com

Our program is constantly growing, any funds accumulated that surpass our goal will be used towards building a wider variety of workshops and events.
For More Information on The Artist Collective & The FREE ART Project check us out on Facebook or Email Us directly.
www.Facebook.com/TheArtistCollective
IHeartFreeArt@Gmail.com

story:
What...

a way a lone a last a loved a long the is a performance-installation that grapples with the place of the human amid the endless cycles of nature. In a universe rife with disruption–where even stars burn out after billions of years–a transient, provisional order, even if conjured only in our imagination, may be the source of meaning and beauty in our lives.

When...

Performances will take place on April 17th and 18th at Standard ToyKraft in Brooklyn, New York.

Who...

We are a group of MFA students in Brooklyn College’s Performance and Interactive Media Arts program: Dancer and choreographer Lígia Teixeira (Portugal), musician and performer Will Orzo (NY) and saxophonist and composer Briggan Krauss (NY).

 

Project description

The thinking behind a way a lone a last a loved a long the begins with a commonplace observation: the ever-accelerating rate of change in our lives leads us to look for order amidst disorder. Having to cope with the vicissitudes of life, however, is not new; scientists and artists alike have always faced a similar challenge: to look for meaningful connections among the noise.

Inspired by a wide range of encounters with ambiguity and complexity — from deciphering Finnegans Wake to studying the persistent patterns of natural phenomena –– we challenged ourselves to create an immersive environment in constant flux, where we ultimately try to find a place for our human bodies.

To engineer such an ever-changing environment, we'll resort not only to technologies as new as digital video and motion-tracking devices, but also to raw materials as old as the skin of a drum and as ageless as sand.

 

Our goal is $2500.

Your money will go towards:

- renting the performance space
- renting equipment
- hiring collaborators and technicians
- paying for materials and construction
- publicity

 

Other ways you can help

- Get the word out and share our campaign with your friends and colleagues.
- Visit and like our facebook page here.

 

For more information on this project visit our website.

 

Thank you for your support and we hope to see at the show!

story:
One of our goals is to begin a MAC650 Store where local artists can display and sell their artwork to gain more exposure and gain a profit from creating. Your donations will go towards the start up costs of having a retail space in the gallery, a professional hanging system in the gallery, window signage, and cosmetic repairs to have a more presentable retail and gallery space. 

Visit www.MAC650.com for more information and a schedule of events.

Our mission is to provide affordable live-work space for artists while they contribute to the revitalization of arts in the Middletown, Connecticut. 

Founded in 2002, the MAC650 Gallery, Middletown Art Collective, is run by the residence of the North End Artist Cooperative (NEAC). The North End Artist Cooperative is a residential building with an 18'x 60' gallery space on the first floor. The cooperative was set up by Alderhouse Residential Communities, Inc. of Connecticut to provide affordable living for working artists. NEAC offers it's residents’ affordable housing while giving them an opportunity to share what they create with their local community. The building is owned and operated by it's residents who make group decisions on events held in the gallery space; lovingly called, MAC650, (Middletown Artist Cooperative and 650 is the street address). We are painters, illustrators, photographers, musicians, jewelers, teachers, writers, poets, and dancers working together to bring quality art to the people of Middletown. 

What We Need & What You Get

With the funds that we raise, we will be able to create new, bolder lettering for our storefront window.

The money will also help us start up the new MAC 650 Store within the gallery space, build moveable walls, install a professional hanging system and buy more chairs.  In addition, we will be able to improve on the events that we host.  For the second Thursday figure drawing sessions that Marc Pettersen hosts, he will be able to build art horses (drawing benches). 

Beyond the $2500 goal, we would like to install a sound system throughout the gallery for better sound during our events.  Our floors will also eventually need to be refinished and the lighting needs updating.

For your help, we want to offer fun rewards!

Pose-A-Pals "Gator" Stickers | $10


MAC650 T-Shirt | $20

Marc Pettersen will design a full color Pose-A-Pals sticker set for you! | $30



Spend one-hour with Amber Dietz in a tintype portrait session. You will receive at least two tintype portraits | $200


Jeanette Andriulli will paint a personal portrait of you or your pet | $250

Olive Tiger

A private concert at your house by Olive Tiger | $500

Would you like to be killed in an upcoming horror webisode series, complete with blood and gore by Valentino Pictures for $1000?

Best of all, everyone that contributes will be invited to a private party to thank you for your help!


The Impact

Main Street, Middletown has become such a beautiful and vibrant place over the past decade and with your support, we can continue to help it become an even better place to live and visit.  We are a community art space and gallery, and we try to do as much for local artists and businesses as possible. 

We've had many successful shows and host a variety of great events and are continuing to do more for the local art community.

The Coop Song (Recorded by our newest member, Olive Tiger and our most longstanding member Dena Bochain)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, please help share our effort!  And keep an eye on our website for a list of upcoming events.  Our MAC 650 Store will be up and running very soon and we plan on having artists demonstrating their work while the gallery is open.  Stop in! Say hello!  We welcome everyone.

story:
.

Our Story                                   Note: [Make a point to view above 'GALLERY']

'GLOBAL ArtXchanges was formed officially over 4 years ago, here in Canada.

I am Art director/co-ordinator, Vesa Peltonen, founder of this compassionate organization, dedicated to better ART for NEEDY World youth. I've helped aboriginal students gain confidence through art. I worked as an advisor for the Ontario Art Council and have . I've had a rewarding 30 yr. career in the arts, time to give back with purpose.

This campaign is much about caring, compassion & determination. 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges is meant to 'enliven the lives' of the youth who are in small art groups/art schools world-wide that do not have the resources to get proper art supplies. Note: we don't send money. We only send the art materials/tools to the contact person, director/instructor requests. ~We make sure they receive it.  IT WORKS!

Note of Importance: 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' already helped in Africa, Mexico, Canada, and Nepal & sent them for art supplies successfully. The young students send us artwork, which will be used in a 'World Youth Art Peace Exhibition' within 2 yrs. t.b.a.. It was an incredible feeling to have students receive proper art materials in March in Kathmandu, Nepal. They are now sustaining this art program, & we do the follow up. The artwork that we get from each place we help, will be apart of an exhibition showing 'The Youth Art,' we have collected, being one later culminating Event. We've already put in money & will receive funds from other sources, such as grants and special art council funding, as for our video.

The Funds go to 3 areas.

(1) Sending Art Supplies to Needy Youth Art Groups World-wide~ ongoing.

(2) To create a 'World Youth Art Peace' Exhibition-from art given by the places we have helped later.

(3) We would like to do short film documentary, which will likely have money from other sources.

The Impact  

The impact enlivens world youth, gives them hope, a sence of accomplishment, but affects in a positive way also their family, friends, & neighbourhood. Their Community will get involved, creating volunteering and jobs. We have already seen that happen, in Ghana for example. The community begins to share in the responsibility to sustain this effort. Since the young artists have proper art supplies to work with, this puts smiles on the faces of everyone. Having family and teachers begin to share in the responsibility of motivating their youth thus enriches the spirit in people and involving many in this focus of the future of their children's education.

"No one can take a young person’s imagination away." as is said.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to reach a minimum fundraising goal of $9,000. (U.S.D)

Look NOW in the INCENTIVES for the various contribution levels & each one will give back something for your generosity.

RETURN to FACEBOOK ORGANIZATION SITE:

http://www.facebook.com/groups/8688770479/

http://www.vpeltonen.com/artworks/global-artxchanges-progress-album/

 

Thank you,

 

Vesa Peltonen :Founder/Administrator -Thunder Bay & Toronto, Canada

 

*Fawn Tran: Associate Advisor- Los Angeles, U.S.A

*Jo Afton: Associate networker, Florida, U.S.A.

*Marina V: ‘Ambassador’, World reknowned Celebrity, singer/composer, L.A. based

*Andrea Ramolo: Canada Celebrity Endorser/well known Canadian musician, Toronto

 e-mail:  vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

·        
' E'Endorser/Ambassador 'for 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges ~ Marina V
"I t   "I think it's amazing what 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' is doing: giving impoverished
children an opportunity to receive proper art supplies,
thus helping those children express themselves through creating artwork.
  I hope more people get involved with this worthy organization".
       - Marina V, world reknowned singer/songwriter www.MarinaV.com   (see pic in Gallery)

story:
Aim

Greetings, Nashoki here! I'm aiming to purchase a refurbished Cintiq Companion 1, a Windows tablet. For years now I've been using nothing but potato computers, computers that don't have sufficient horsepower to do large scale stuffs like doodling huge resolution canvases without running into any problems. I always ran into RAM problems and many other technical errors that makes me pull my hair out. I would like YOUR help in completing my endeavor to get a Cintiq Companion.

Backstory

I'm a hobbyist artist, been drawing as early as I could pick up a pencil when I was little. As you can see, I'm interested in anime and manga, hence my art style. I grew up surrounded and became heavily influenced by it. You can view my art in the following links.

deviantArt, finished illustrations

Tumblr, sketches and etc

The Impact

A Cintiq will increase my workflow, making it more smoother as opposed to using a traditional graphics tablet. I will be able to work on much higher resolution canvases without any problems. I normally work on an A4 resolution canvas on 300dpi with dozens of layers. I use a lot of layers so that I can organize lineart in a way which I can make changes to without disrupting the other parts of it.  
I will be able to also take my canvas anywhere with me, be able to work in a coffee shop, enjoying the atmosphere while enjoying a good cup o' tea.

How the Campaign Works

Perks(refer to the column on the right) starting at 10$ and above works as a commission, except with more goodies to sweeten the deal. Please provide character reference for each commission. I have 3 styles, normal sketch, painterly and a clean style. The effort in using those styles gets progressively larger. Please vote here for the character poll for your TQ illustration. 

  • Normal sketch - Mostly a rough sketchy style.
  • Painterly - Soft style without any too overly bold outlines.
  • Clean - Typical clean outline style.

Here is a complete list of the keychains I've made as of this campaign has launched. More to come! Higher resolution right here.

  • Clear acrylic keychain, approximately 6cm x 6cm.
  • Has a metal key ring
  • Different designs on both front & back

Take All My Monies

I accept payment by Paypal only! Each and every penny of your contribution is much appreciated.

Insufficient Cash?

No worries! You can just pass this campaign to your friends, give it some signal boosting. That would be much appreciated!

story:
Update 2018

We’re excited to announce that AfriMod has established our base in Africa. We’re situated at 1 Ganges Close, in the Maitama District, Abuja, Nigeria. Our office in Toronto will continue to respond to all inquiries and issues related to marketing and sales, including wholesale.

We are currently in the process of consolidating our product sourcing, production, warehousing and shipping in our Africa location.

We continue to reach out to artists and designers in the creative communities in Africa. Follow us to discover what’s new and exciting: https://afrimod.com

instagram | facebook | pinterest

Update

Hi all!

We have only days left in our campaign, and we’d like to thank everyone who has given support and helped to spread the word. Although the overall response has been poor, we will continue to develop and grow the AfriMod concept of providing a platform for artisans to reach the common global market.

You can, of course, always find us at afrimod.com where we continue to offer products made by various artisans. AfriMod continues to grow– adding new artisans and new products. We hope you will continue to spread the word and shop afrimod.com for your eclectic modern global interior décor and boho chic fashion & accessories.

Once again, thanks to everybody!

We're creating a space in West Africa for artists, designers and artisans to establish direct access to the global market and connect with creative communities worldwide.

Help us build this highly needed infrastructure to expand artisan access, improve income opportunities and encourage collaboration between artisans globally.
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This project, the AfriMod Xchange, is designed as an on-the-ground, walk-in counterpart to the online marketplace, afrimod.com.  It is a community space that seeks to bridge the knowledge divide and help local artists, designers and artisans gain access to the global online market.
 

 

What We've Done So Far
There are high costs associated with this project. We have provided the initial funding for all aspects of the design, construction and implementation of the eCommerce platform afrimod.com (launched March 1, 2015). In addition, we have funded several trips for two team members to Africa in 2012, 2013 and 2014.

These trips gave us ample opportunities to connect with artists, designers, artisans and individuals. They also enabled us to identify Jos, Nigeria as the most appropriate location for AfriMod to take root in Africa. However, the actual completion of the AfriMod Xchange cannot proceed without this current stage of preparation. The more money we raise, the better the facilities we build and the greater the impact we can have.
 

This Campaign
The current campaign target of $50,000 will help AfriMod formalize and expand operations on-the-ground in Africa— aggregating artisans and assisting them to participate in online sales. And we’re featuring some really cool perks for all... in time for the holidays!

From Millennials to Baby-boomers, utility to collector’s items, traditional or contemporary – we have something for everyone. Your purchases and contributions will go towards completing this ambitious project. Every dollar we receive will enable you to become a part of the building of a future where people connect with one another, build better human understanding, and creativity has no boundary.

We need your help to complete the AfriMod Xchange as a gathering place that serves as a confluence for creativity, innovation and design. A place for social interactions, welcoming artists, designers and artisans to congregate, to innovate new products, new ideas and concepts, attend workshops or special events - an informal club for its regular members. We want to raise as much money as possible to change lives.
 

 


 

 

 

That Africa is a continent of deep, diverse cultural and artistic heritage is so often repeated in social discourse that one wonders why it is so difficult to shop a wide variety of African products globally. Meanwhile, in cities, towns and villages across Africa, artists, designers and artisans are creating exceptional contemporary and traditional works in home furnishings, decorative crafts, fine art, fashion & accessories, beauty products, etc.

Sadly though, most of these artisans are cut off from the global market simply because they are not computer and Internet savvy. Most have to rely on middlemen to get their products sold outside their communities. And as a result, a vast majority of the wealth from their sales (upwards of 60%) end up outside of their communities. Furthermore, weak infrastructure support, logistics and difficulty accessing the Internet create additional obstacles that make it virtually impossible for these artists, designers and artisans to improve their income.

 

 


 

 

Over the past three years, our team members have made several trips to West Africa and worked directly with local artists, designers and artisans. In the process, we have developed a system that,
 

  • Allows these makers to set their own prices and deal directly with global shoppers online,
  • Ensures fair-trade between makers and buyers; and creates opportunities for makers to improve their incomes,
  • Enables direct maker involvement in the work of selling their items to global shoppers through a single dedicated eCommerce platform (afrimod.com),
  • Provides hands-on management, training and logistics support to makers at the local level,
  • Encourages collaboration among makers in Africa and with their global counterparts.

 

Due to the high costs, size and complexity of this project, we have designed it to roll out in three distinct, manageable components...

 


 

 

 

In the first phase, we designed, built and launched (March 01, 2015), the online marketplace AfriMod.com.

AfriMod.com is a free listing service dedicated exclusively to African and Africa-inspired art, design and decor.  Makers sell their works directly without middlemen and have the option of four separate account types:

  • Standard account, for sellers of physical products,
  • Visual Artists’ account, for visual artists and graphic designers,
  • Associate account, for individuals in Africa capable of training, organizing and assisting others in their communities,
  • Incubator account, specifically designed to help first-time technology users participate in eCommerce.

 

We recognize that computer and Internet literacy is marginal, but fast-growing across most of Africa, and that many talented makers are offline and unable to access the global market. Therefore to succeed, the AfriMod model calls for an initial, physical, on-the-ground presence to enable us to train and assist makers to do the work of selling directly by themselves.

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

During the second phase, starting early 2016, we return to W. Africa (Jos, Nigeria) to start work on developing a community space that will serve as the nucleus for the AfriMod Xchange. Our presence on-the-ground will enable us to formalize and expand the process of aggregating artists, designers and artisans and helping them to sell independently to global shoppers. In the process, we contribute to building lasting human connections, thriving communities and better incomes.

Team members at the AfriMod Xchange will work closely with local and regional makers to identify areas of need such as,

  • understanding international standards (materials, sizing, potential applications, color trends, packaging, etc)
  • determining which of their products have the best sales potential
  • creating their online shops and personal profiles
  • designing their identities and branding assets
  • training and assistance with product photography
  • writing product descriptions, etc.

in certain cases

 

  • providing small capacity-building grants
  • warehousing and shipping services

With logistics support, we help artists, designers and artisans navigate the “last mile” to successfully bring their products online. As a result of our assistance and support, makers we work with are able to increase their incomes quite substantially.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Phase three (pending)
We’ve already started to work with makers in several countries in Africa. Now, we’re in the process of raising funds that would enable us to build a permanent location that will include an office, space for training and workshops plus several maker-spaces that can house residents and visiting international artists, designers, makers and guests. It is estimated that on completion, the Phase Three aspect of this project would require an additional $150,000.

Our primary objective is to have a continuous cycle of creative collaboration among makers - local, regional and international. In addition, the presence of vibrant traditional artisanal communities within the geographic surroundings present multiple opportunities for discovery, inspiration and testaments to the linkages between art and cultural heritage.

We are humbled by the size of Africa, an extremely large continent with complex cultural and geopolitical diversity.

To expand our reach across the continent, our long-term plans call for the creating of partner maker ecosystems in several geographic regions such as: the Maghreb, Sahel, West Coast, East Coast, Southern and Central Africa.

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

Jos was chosen primarily for its location within a region that is rich in history with access to multiple maker communities. It is an old city in the middle-belt region of Nigeria defined by rocky landscapes, rolling hills and mild temperate climate.


Due to its location on a plateau, 1,238m above sea level, its seasonal temperatures range between 18-22°C (64-72°F) with the coldest period between December and February.

Jos is situated within a geographic area of ancient civilizations and cultures such as, Nok, Tiv, Jukun, Hausa/Fulani, Birom, Angas, Nupe, Idoma, etc, as well as crafting communities, museums and game reserves.

 


 

 

 

Regrettably, Jos and its geographic surroundings have been subjected to multiple terrorist bombings (Boko Haram) and violent sectarian clashes since 2001. Hundreds have lost their lives and the local economy has suffered substantially as a result. Jos is not completely safe and presents major challenges but the city center, close to the Museum of Traditional Nigerian Architecture, is relatively secure and a good location for the AfriMod Xchange to take root.

 

 


 

Our story is all about people, dreamers who believe that anything is possible; human stories of passion and hope. A story about people connecting with one another in ways that help build better human understanding. It is also a story about providing opportunities to artists, designers, artisans and micro-businesses to reach a global market that would otherwise be inaccessible.

There’s really nothing else like AfriMod … association with Africa’s rural beginnings, a very authentic story telling method that focuses on individuals, and a brand persona that reflects the iconic grit and sheer tenacity of brand Africa itself. On its own however, AfriMod is just a platform to get products in front of global shoppers wherever they may be; but with its community of artists, designers, artisans, associates, micro-businesses and shoppers, AfriMod is a living breathing entity. This vibrant community gives AfriMod credibility and makes it real; and this in itself is something authentic – something that gives AfriMod a soul.

 

 

 

 


 

Thank you for helping us build the AfriMod Xchange. Our perks are ready to go and ship out of Toronto on selection. These are mostly handmade, one-of-a-kind pieces, and quantities are limited. About the CoffeeTable:

A statement piece with intricate motif based on Yoruba folklore depicting preparations for a Bountiful Feast. Consists of a detachable tabletop carved from a singe 36″ diameter piece of solid wood, and a separate and hollowed base concealing extra storage.

Both tabletop and base are intricately carved with high relief sculptural figures meticulously finished on the outside as well as inside of the storage base.

Hand-carved by sculptor, Akin Alamu in Ibadan, Nigeria, 1990.

Dimensions (approximate)
78 cm diameter x 46 cm high – weight 17 kg
2′7″ diameter x 18 in high – weight 37.5 lbs

If you have a great idea to improve it, please share with us. Pledge and help AfriMod make this campaign a success . Help us bring the AfriMod Xchange to life!

We are looking for other means of support. Sponsors, people who want to get involved … simply email us at campaign@afrimod.com. You can also help artists, designers and artisans improve their incomes by helping them sell online … see afrimod.com/associates.

 

 

We thank you for your support and look forward to sharing more of the art & design of Africa with you.
story_txt:
Update 2018

We’re excited to announce that AfriMod has established our base in Africa. We’re situated at 1 Ganges Close, in the Maitama District, Abuja, Nigeria. Our office in Toronto will continue to respond to all inquiries and issues related to marketing and sales, including wholesale.
We are currently in the process of consolidating our product sourcing, production, warehousing and shipping in our Africa location.
We continue to reach out to artists and designers in the creative communities in Africa. Follow us to discover what’s new and exciting: https://afrimod.com
instagram | facebook | pinterest

Update
Hi all!
We have only days left in our campaign, and we’d like to thank everyone who has given support and helped to spread the word. Although the overall response has been poor, we will continue to develop and grow the AfriMod concept of providing a platform for artisans to reach the common global market.
You can, of course, always find us at afrimod.com where we continue to offer products made by various artisans. AfriMod continues to grow– adding new artisans and new products. We hope you will continue to spread the word and shop afrimod.com for your eclectic modern global interior décor and boho chic fashion & accessories.
Once again, thanks to everybody!
We're creating a space in West Africa for artists, designers and artisans to establish direct access to the global market and connect with creative communities worldwide.Help us build this highly needed infrastructure to expand artisan access, improve income opportunities and encourage collaboration between artisans globally.        This project, the AfriMod Xchange, is designed as an on-the-ground, walk-in counterpart to the online marketplace, afrimod.com.  It is a community space that seeks to bridge the knowledge divide and help local artists, designers and artisans gain access to the global online market.  What We've Done So FarThere are high costs associated with this project. We have provided the initial funding for all aspects of the design, construction and implementation of the eCommerce platform afrimod.com (launched March 1, 2015). In addition, we have funded several trips for two team members to Africa in 2012, 2013 and 2014.These trips gave us ample opportunities to connect with artists, designers, artisans and individuals. They also enabled us to identify Jos, Nigeria as the most appropriate location for AfriMod to take root in Africa. However, the actual completion of the AfriMod Xchange cannot proceed without this current stage of preparation. The more money we raise, the better the facilities we build and the greater the impact we can have. This CampaignThe current campaign target of $50,000 will help AfriMod formalize and expand operations on-the-ground in Africa— aggregating artisans and assisting them to participate in online sales. And we’re featuring some really cool perks for all... in time for the holidays!From Millennials to Baby-boomers, utility to collector’s items, traditional or contemporary – we have something for everyone. Your purchases and contributions will go towards completing this ambitious project. Every dollar we receive will enable you to become a part of the building of a future where people connect with one another, build better human understanding, and creativity has no boundary.We need your help to complete the AfriMod Xchange as a gathering place that serves as a confluence for creativity, innovation and design. A place for social interactions, welcoming artists, designers and artisans to congregate, to innovate new products, new ideas and concepts, attend workshops or special events - an informal club for its regular members. We want to raise as much money as possible to change lives.     That Africa is a continent of deep, diverse cultural and artistic heritage is so often repeated in social discourse that one wonders why it is so difficult to shop a wide variety of African products globally. Meanwhile, in cities, towns and villages across Africa, artists, designers and artisans are creating exceptional contemporary and traditional works in home furnishings, decorative crafts, fine art, fashion & accessories, beauty products, etc.Sadly though, most of these artisans are cut off from the global market simply because they are not computer and Internet savvy. Most have to rely on middlemen to get their products sold outside their communities. And as a result, a vast majority of the wealth from their sales (upwards of 60%) end up outside of their communities. Furthermore, weak infrastructure support, logistics and difficulty accessing the Internet create additional obstacles that make it virtually impossible for these artists, designers and artisans to improve their income.    Over the past three years, our team members have made several trips to West Africa and worked directly with local artists, designers and artisans. In the process, we have developed a system that, 
Allows these makers to set their own prices and deal directly with global shoppers online,
Ensures fair-trade between makers and buyers; and creates opportunities for makers to improve their incomes,
Enables direct maker involvement in the work of selling their items to global shoppers through a single dedicated eCommerce platform (afrimod.com),
Provides hands-on management, training and logistics support to makers at the local level,
Encourages collaboration among makers in Africa and with their global counterparts.
 Due to the high costs, size and complexity of this project, we have designed it to roll out in three distinct, manageable components...    In the first phase, we designed, built and launched (March 01, 2015), the online marketplace AfriMod.com.AfriMod.com is a free listing service dedicated exclusively to African and Africa-inspired art, design and decor.  Makers sell their works directly without middlemen and have the option of four separate account types:
Standard account, for sellers of physical products,
Visual Artists’ account, for visual artists and graphic designers,
Associate account, for individuals in Africa capable of training, organizing and assisting others in their communities,
Incubator account, specifically designed to help first-time technology users participate in eCommerce.
 We recognize that computer and Internet literacy is marginal, but fast-growing across most of Africa, and that many talented makers are offline and unable to access the global market. Therefore to succeed, the AfriMod model calls for an initial, physical, on-the-ground presence to enable us to train and assist makers to do the work of selling directly by themselves.          During the second phase, starting early 2016, we return to W. Africa (Jos, Nigeria) to start work on developing a community space that will serve as the nucleus for the AfriMod Xchange. Our presence on-the-ground will enable us to formalize and expand the process of aggregating artists, designers and artisans and helping them to sell independently to global shoppers. In the process, we contribute to building lasting human connections, thriving communities and better incomes.Team members at the AfriMod Xchange will work closely with local and regional makers to identify areas of need such as,
understanding international standards (materials, sizing, potential applications, color trends, packaging, etc)
determining which of their products have the best sales potential
creating their online shops and personal profiles
designing their identities and branding assets
training and assistance with product photography
writing product descriptions, etc.
in certain cases 
providing small capacity-building grants
warehousing and shipping services
With logistics support, we help artists, designers and artisans navigate the “last mile” to successfully bring their products online. As a result of our assistance and support, makers we work with are able to increase their incomes quite substantially.           Phase three (pending)We’ve already started to work with makers in several countries in Africa. Now, we’re in the process of raising funds that would enable us to build a permanent location that will include an office, space for training and workshops plus several maker-spaces that can house residents and visiting international artists, designers, makers and guests. It is estimated that on completion, the Phase Three aspect of this project would require an additional $150,000.Our primary objective is to have a continuous cycle of creative collaboration among makers - local, regional and international. In addition, the presence of vibrant traditional artisanal communities within the geographic surroundings present multiple opportunities for discovery, inspiration and testaments to the linkages between art and cultural heritage.We are humbled by the size of Africa, an extremely large continent with complex cultural and geopolitical diversity.To expand our reach across the continent, our long-term plans call for the creating of partner maker ecosystems in several geographic regions such as: the Maghreb, Sahel, West Coast, East Coast, Southern and Central Africa.         Jos was chosen primarily for its location within a region that is rich in history with access to multiple maker communities. It is an old city in the middle-belt region of Nigeria defined by rocky landscapes, rolling hills and mild temperate climate.Due to its location on a plateau, 1,238m above sea level, its seasonal temperatures range between 18-22°C (64-72°F) with the coldest period between December and February.Jos is situated within a geographic area of ancient civilizations and cultures such as, Nok, Tiv, Jukun, Hausa/Fulani, Birom, Angas, Nupe, Idoma, etc, as well as crafting communities, museums and game reserves.    Regrettably, Jos and its geographic surroundings have been subjected to multiple terrorist bombings (Boko Haram) and violent sectarian clashes since 2001. Hundreds have lost their lives and the local economy has suffered substantially as a result. Jos is not completely safe and presents major challenges but the city center, close to the Museum of Traditional Nigerian Architecture, is relatively secure and a good location for the AfriMod Xchange to take root.   Our story is all about people, dreamers who believe that anything is possible; human stories of passion and hope. A story about people connecting with one another in ways that help build better human understanding. It is also a story about providing opportunities to artists, designers, artisans and micro-businesses to reach a global market that would otherwise be inaccessible.There’s really nothing else like AfriMod … association with Africa’s rural beginnings, a very authentic story telling method that focuses on individuals, and a brand persona that reflects the iconic grit and sheer tenacity of brand Africa itself. On its own however, AfriMod is just a platform to get products in front of global shoppers wherever they may be; but with its community of artists, designers, artisans, associates, micro-businesses and shoppers, AfriMod is a living breathing entity. This vibrant community gives AfriMod credibility and makes it real; and this in itself is something authentic – something that gives AfriMod a soul.     Thank you for helping us build the AfriMod Xchange. story: I would like to help bring Voter awareness to all women. I'm looking for funding for stickers and post cards of the VOTE art I have created with hand torn masking tape. The stickers will be free to anyone who would like one, or to whatever orginazition would like some. I am not selling or making any money off of the stickers or post cards. I am seeking 850.00 to cover the cost of getting the stickers and post cards printed and to cover the cost of the shipping. Thank you very much for your support.

story:
ESPAÑOL más abajo

FRANÇAIS au dessus

ITALIANO qui soto

-------------------------------

ENGLISH:

Who is CERRUCHA?

My name is Claudia Espinosa a.k.a. CERRUCHA. I am a Mexican visual artist based in Montréal. My work is about communicating socially relevant themes such as gender issues, multiculturalism, and the construction of identity. I aim to be provocative with my work, engaging the viewer in a way that leads her/him into a reflection about their self-perception as well as that of their surroundings. I strive to use art as a means for change within my society.

I´m on the second phase of my photographic project titled In-Visible. Where I expose how misogyny is perpetuated through language in different cultures. I have previously completed phase one of the project, which was exhibited as a street art intervention in Mexico City in 2010. The project was done on newspaper, printing 8,000 images that were wheat pasted over 8.6km in one of Mexico City´s main avenues. I believe that art has the power to rise awareness, and In-Visible is my tool to achieve this.

Your donations will make possible the second phase of In-Visible. I am on the final stage of the project, and now I only need the post-production process to be completed.

What is the purpose of CERRUCHA's project IN-VISIBLE?

In-Visible examines machismo behaviour within different cultures. I aim to raise awareness about the way language is used as a way of perpetuating misogyny, being rooted in the core of our most common thoughts and sayings.I n order to reshape our society, we need to question what we´ve been taught and how it affects us both men and women. In-Visible does this by playing with the concept of tattooing, creating a visual metaphor in which the individuals portrayed are psychologically tattooed by the colloquialisms they have written on their skin. In a series of 10 large format portraits, I isolate such phrases giving the viewer time to reflect on the true impact they have through their repetition on a daily basis.

I have been accepted by a jury to exhibit at Espacio Mexico Gallery. The vernissage´s tentative dates are: 6th and 7th of December, 2012. I´m at the end of In-Visible´s post-production stage. Currently working on the portraits of men and women from Québec, Ethiopia, Estonia and Brazil among others. In order to reach a broader audience and keep In-Visible´s essence, I´m contacting newspapers in the attempt to include one of my images in their journal as an artwork meant for mass distribution.

The project will be exhibited at Espacio Mexico Gallery in Montréal for two months. The opening will be the 6th of December, 2012. The opening day I will also give place for women organizations to present themselves, creating stronger ties between community groups and the arts.

Take a complete look of my portfolio at www.cerrucha.com

And here is a link to the documentation of the first part of IN-VISIBLE. Check it out!http://www.cerrucha.com/french#!__french/in-visible

FOR THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJET, I NEED $1,500 CAD

Your donations will go towards the following:

-Printing of the 10 images (44inches by 50 inches each)

-Printing tests

-Lab technician fee at Le Cabinet

-Mounting the images for the gallery

-Artwork transportation materials

 

What kind of perks will you get by supporting In-Visible?

Whatever the perk you choose, you will be getting original artworks from CERRUCHA!

 

Special thanks 

My gratitude and a thank you on my Facebook page!



Special thanks and mention 

Your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.



 I'm printing 5 different photographs of mine in postcards that I will send to you!



Thank you postcard 

As a heartfelt thanks, I will send you a dedicated thank you postcard with one of my photographs. And your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.

 

 5 Postcards 

You will receive a set of 5 different postcards that you can give away to your friends plus dedicated thank you postcard with one of my photographs.And your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.

 

15 Postcards 

You will receive a set of 15 postcards (3 of each one of the different photographs printed on them) that you can give away to your friends plus a dedicated thank you postcard with one of my photographs. And your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.

 

4 images from the first phase of In-Visible 

You will receive a set of all four images from In-Visible's Phase I plus a dedicated thank you postcard with one of my photographs. And your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.

 

For the SPONSORS OF ONE OF THE 10 IMAGES: 

Your name will be printed on the technical description of the image that you will be sponsoring. I only have 10 of this perks, and these images will not be printed in this large format again. So you will be forever thanked as a sponsor of that sole work of art. Plus, you'll get a set of 25 postcards with my photographs on them and a dedicated thank you note. And your name will be printed on the Special Thanks board that will be placed the day of the exhibition.



For the ULTIMATE SUPPORTERS OF IN-VISIBLE PHASE II: 

Your name will be printed on the description of the project that will stay throughout the two months of the exhibition, and in any other descriptions of subsequent exhibitions this project might have. You will receive a set of 25 postcards, a set of all four images from In-Visible's Phase I plus a dedicated thank you postcard with one of my photographs.



So, you're convinced? NOW WHAT?

Please choose one of the perks on the right and follow the steps! Credit Card or Paypal, whichever works for you! Share it with your friends, family, social networks and more!

 

Word of mouth is another great way to help! Please share this link with your friends and family. By doing this you're not only helping me to fundraise, but to raise awareness through art.


Thank you so much!

----------------------------------------------------------------

ESPAÑOL

----------------------------------------------------------------

¿QUIÉN ES CERRUCHA?

CERRUCHA es una artista multidisciplinaria originaria de México D.F. Vive en Montréal, Canadá desde el año 2007 y su trabajo se basa tanto en fotografía como en instalación y video. Su ínterés se centra en la exploración del comportamiento humano, la construcción de la identidad y los preconceptos que existen dentro de los diversos grupos sociales. Su interés por establecer una conexión con el espectador a través del arte, crear una mayor consciencia social y hacer el arte más accesible al público en general la ha llevado a utilizar métodos alternos de representación como lo son sus intervenciones de arte públicas.

Checa mi portafolio completo en www.cerrucha.com

¿Y DE QUÉ TRATA EL PROYECTO “IN-VISIBLE”?

In-visible es una serie de fotografías que hace una crítica al machismo en México y cómo usamos el lenguaje para enseñárselo a las nuevas generaciones, creando una sociedad desigual. Los tatuajes que tienen las personas retratadas aquí, representan al machismo que se encuentra sutilmente escondido bajo las frases de uso cotidiano como lo son “Eres un mandilón”, “Todos los hombres son iguales”, “Ese juego no es para niñas”, etc., frases que van moldeando nuestra manera de pensar y que la repetición de ellas dan como resultado el que moldean el inconsciente colectivo a manera de perpetuar el machismo, que afecta tanto a hombres como mujeres y es el causante de la violencia de género en nuestro país.

El objetivo de ésta exposición es invitar a la gente a hacer una reflexión y auto-cuestionarse sobre el tema y cómo están participando en enseñarle a sus hijos e hijas a ser machistas a través del lenguaje.

¿UNA SEGUNDA FASE DE IN-VISIBLE?
El 6 de Diciembre del 2012 tendé una exposición en el Espacio México, donde se exhibirán las nuevas imágenes de In-Visible, segunda Parte. Con el mismo concepto de explorar la perpetuación del machismo a través del lenguaje, retraté a 10 personas de diferentes partes del mundo, tatuándolo/as con frases en los idiomas de su país natal. Aprovechando la multiculturalidad de Montréal, en donde se tiene contacto con personas de todos los países del mundo de una manera cotidiana.



¿PARA QUÉ SE USARAN LOS FONDOS RECAUDADOS?

Para hacer posible esta exposición, necesito de su ayuda para poder imprimir las fotografías, montarlas y terminar ésta última etapa del proyecto. 

A su derecha pueden ver los regalos que tengo para ustedes. Al apoyar mi proyecto, dependiendo de la cantidad de la aportación tengo dispuestos diferentes regalos. Los regalos son obra mia, fotografías originales y otras obras de arte. 

Les agradezco mucho su contribución para poder hacer del arte un instrumento para crear conciencia en nuestra sociedad. Pasen la voz con sus amigo/as por favor.

¡GRACIAS! 



 ----------------------------------------------------------------

FRANÇAIS

----------------------------------------------------------------

C´EST QUI CERRUCHA?

CERRUCHA est une artiste multidisciplinaire mexicaine, qui habite à Montréal, Canada depuis 2007. Son travail se base à la fois sur l'installation, la photographie et la vidéo. Son travail se concentre principalement sur l'exploration du comportement humain, la construction de l'identité et les préjugés qui existent au sein des divers groupes sociaux. Son souci d'établir une connexion avec le spectateur à travers l'art, en créant une plus grande conscience sociale et en rendant l'art plus accessible au grand public, l'a amenée à utiliser des moyens alternatifs de représentation comme des interventions d'art public.

Allez sur mon site d´internet au www.cerrucha.com

C´EST QUOI LE PROJET IN-VISIBLE?

Dans In/Visible le machisme est inscrit dans le corps. Cerrucha utilise la pratique traditionnelle des tatouages pour lire l’histoire du machisme dans sa propre culture. D’étranges images mettant en scène la vulnérabilité des hommes, des femmes et des enfants avec des tatouages d’expressions communes stéréotypées qui dénigrent fortement les femmes, ou qui décrivent des pratiques qui sont socialement catégorisées comme féminines. Invisible donne à voir les paradoxes du langage dans la complexité de la chair. -Jake Moore

 

Je fais cette levée de fonds pour finir la 2eme phase de mon projet In-Visible, qui sera exposé à la Galerie Espace Mexique en décembre 2012. Il prend le même concept que la première phase, mais il devient multiculturel. J'ai profité du multi-culturalisme de Montréal pour inscrire des phrases sur des gens de plusieurs parties du monde (Turquie, Lebanon, Étiopie, etc) pour ainsi démontrer que cette situation est une problématique globale.

Pour finir cette projet et l'exposer au l'Espacio Mexico ici à Montréal, j'ai besoin d'une somme de 1500$. Cette somme servira à imprimer les images et les préparer à l'exposition.
SVP faites une contribution et aidez-moi à créer une conscience plus grande à travers l´art.

À votre droit vous pouvez voir les avantages que j'ai pour vous à en échange de votre contribution. Choisissez une et en dépendent de votre contribution, je vous ferrez parvenir une des mes oeuvres d'art.

Veuillez passer le mot à vos amis.

 

UN GROS MERCI!


-------------------------------------------

ITALIANO
PER TUTTI GLI AMICICI ITALIANI
Questo e' un progetto fotografico per mostrare l'esistenza del machismo nella nostra societa' e nel mondo attraverso il linguaggio di ogni giorno. Questa mostra fa vedere come le piccole parole di ogni giorno ormai a noi banali hanno un effetto negativo nella psiche della gente sia donne che uomini e specialmente nei bambini che cresceranno con l'idea che gli uomini sono meglio delle donne. Le frase tipo: "questo non e' un gioco per bambine" "mio marito mi lasca lavorare" le donne al volante sono un pericolo constante" o addirittura "sei peggio di una donna" hanno un forte influsso negativo nel immagine di essere donna e aumentano di piu' l'idea della donna badante e uomo provveditore. Tutto ciò influisce negativamente la crescita dei bambini. Questa mostra e per combattere il machismo facendo vedere a tutti che le piccole frasi del genere anche se non gli si da' tanta importanza fanno un male constante. Prima ci si abitua alla parola in se, che poi diventa un pensiero indelebile, proprio come dei tatuaggi. Tatuaggi che portiamo addosso e avvolte neanche ci ricordiamo di averli, Infatti l'artista CERRUCHA (Claudia Espinosa), trasmette questo messaggio tramite l'arte della fotografia tatuando nel corpo dei modelli queste frasi, che proprio come dei tatuaggi ci si cresce insieme e ci si vive la quotidianità come se nulla fosse, come se questi pensieri non esistessero, ma che sono costantemente impresse nella pelle come nella mente, indelebili; proprio come i tatuaggi. Questa mostra e' la seconda fase di questo intero progetto, la prima e' già stata realizzata nel città del Messico, e ora qui a Montreal Canada; Ma abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere dei fondi per realizzare questa mostra, e i soldi raccolti serviranno per fare imprimere le immagini, ed e' proprio li che abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto. date ciò che potete, grazie. 
Potete vedere il link del progetto qui sotto. http://www.indiegogo.com/cerruchainvisible2

ENGLISH:
Who is CERRUCHA?
My name is Claudia Espinosa a.k.a. CERRUCHA. I am a Mexican visual artist based in Montréal. My work is about communicating socially relevant themes such as gender issues, multiculturalism, and the construction of identity. I aim to be provocative with my work, engaging the viewer in a way that leads her/him into a reflection about their self-perception as well as that of their surroundings. I strive to use art as a means for change within my society.
I´m on the second phase of my photographic project titled In-Visible. Where I expose how misogyny is perpetuated through language in different cultures. I have previously completed phase one of the project, which was exhibited as a street art intervention in Mexico City in 2010. The project was done on newspaper, printing 8,000 images that were wheat pasted over 8.6km in one of Mexico City´s main avenues. I believe that art has the power to rise awareness, and In-Visible is my tool to achieve this.
Your donations will make possible the second phase of In-Visible. I am on the final stage of the project, and now I only need the post-production process to be completed.
What is the purpose of CERRUCHA's project IN-VISIBLE?
In-Visible examines machismo behaviour within different cultures. I aim to raise awareness about the way language is used as a way of perpetuating misogyny, being rooted in the core of our most common thoughts and sayings.I n order to reshape our society, we need to question what we´ve been taught and how it affects us both men and women. In-Visible does this by playing with the concept of tattooing, creating a visual metaphor in which the individuals portrayed are psychologically tattooed by the colloquialisms they have written on their skin. In a series of 10 large format portraits, I isolate such phrases giving the viewer time to reflect on the true impact they have through their repetition on a daily basis.
I have been accepted by a jury to exhibit at Espacio Mexico Gallery. The vernissage´s tentative dates are: 6th and 7th of December, 2012. I´m at the end of In-Visible´s post-production stage. Currently working on the portraits of men and women from Québec, Ethiopia, Estonia and Brazil among others. In order to reach a broader audience and keep In-Visible´s essence, I´m contacting newspapers in the attempt to include one of my images in their journal as an artwork meant for mass distribution.
The project will be exhibited at Espacio Mexico Gallery in Montréal for two months. The opening will be the 6th of December, 2012. The opening day I will also give place for women organizations to present themselves, creating stronger ties between community groups and the arts.
Take a complete look of my portfolio at www.cerrucha.com
