story:
THE LAUNCH..THE IMPACT

I will be launching my production company called RMHMovement, and I have upcoming projects that are currently in the works; in which I am looking for potential resources and capital from individuals that would be willing to help fund and/or sponsor the visions I have created. I would need your help to reach our first goal of $6,500 by August 1st, for our first project. This production will be the official launch of RMHMovement. Our first project is the first music video/visual for artist Terron Brooks’ #LoveMusic EP: https://itun.es/us/ovl9ab. Terron is a Singer, Songwriter, and Actor. He is best known for his role and portrayal of R&B/pop singer Eddie Kendricks in the 1998 NBC miniseries The Temptations. He is also a successful Broadway actor in The Lion King and Hairspray, and featured on numerous Film and T.V. soundtrack albums. 

Our mission is to create a “Visual” that will enhance the experience of what we are doing to change the world/music. ""Love is the focus, with the strategy to encourage another human being to make the decision to change their perspective of who they are in the world, overcoming past obstacles; to make an ultimate change in the course of their life.

I would appreciate any amount you are able to give. 100% of the funds go towards RMHMovement’s projects. ""Your assistance will not just be utilized to produce a single project. The projects include versatile live stage shows, films and short films, music video/visuals for artists. The funding is needed for the production team, post production, crew, wardrobe, set/stage designer, talent, rehearsal space, location permits, marketing/media, various company fees, etc. 

Your contribution will benefit artists all over the world, and the people they touch through their artistry, by contributing to a movement and vision that Empowers artists and people. As a producer, I aim to inspire, educate, and provide opportunities for artists and people to tell their stories in the entertainment industry worldwide. I want to give individuals a voice with the art I create, and awaken the voice they may have never knew they had. Moreover, providing opportunities for a diverse group and a community of people that will allow them to find their artistic voice; will help shape and translate an array of messages through the versatility of the projects created. It is time to inspire and change lives in this world for the better. I also want to release work that uplift the artists involved in the process. People should shine and thrive in their art. That’s the kind of platform I want to create. A brand and company that people can trust. It is built on integrity and faith, delivers on what it says it is going to do, it gives individuals a voice, and it shares that voice boldly.

THE BACKSTORY

My name is Reegan Haynes and I am originally from Washington D.C./Maryland, and I have over 20 years of experience in the entertainment industry; working with iconic figures who have helped shaped the industry into what you see today.  I am an alumna of Howard University which is one of the most prestigious Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCU) there is today, and I received my Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Theatre Arts Administration. I consider myself a renaissance artist. I have spent time studying and mastering specific areas of the arts; in an effort to use the culmination of my skills to create monumental creative platforms that reawaken how Art positively impacts people. Thus, reaching a bigger goal of using Art to align people with their purpose. Therefore, I utilize my skills and cultivate my talents through my ability to write, dance, choreograph, direct, and produce. Moreover, I am a Producer, Choreographer, Creative Director, Artistic Director (Theatre), Educator, and Writer who has performed on stage, in front of the camera, and has the knowledge of what it takes to work behind the scenes with a strong team behind the stage and camera. 

 

In addition to the roles and responsibilities I have had the opportunity to flourish in, I am now the owner of my production company, RMHMovement, which provides production services for artists and companies for stage, television, and film. To add, my company specializes in the areas of choreography, artistic direction, creative direction, branding/marketing, film, and music video production. My job as an Artist is to maintain the continuity of developing quality work, and keep the integrity of the arts alive; while creating opportunities for artists to accomplish and reach their goals at an optimal level. RMHMovement is not only a brand I created, but it is a representation of who I am in relation to what I do. It is why I do what I do, with the God given talents and tools I have been blessed with. I know that I have been chosen as an artistic vessel, who is on a mission to pursue the rightful call of duties of helping other creatives and professionals achieve their goals.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am asking for your help, and would appreciate any amount you are able to give. 100% of the funds go towards RMHMovement’s projects. Your contribution in sharing this campaign and getting the word out is greatly appreciated as well. 

 

www.RMHMovement.com

Vimeo: RMHMovement

Instagram: @rmhmovement

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/RMHMovement

Twitter: @RMHMOOVES
story_txt: THE LAUNCH..THE IMPACTI will be launching my production company called RMHMovement, and I have upcoming projects that are currently in the works; in which I am looking for potential resources and capital from individuals that would be willing to help fund and/or sponsor the visions I have created. I would need your help to reach our first goal of $6,500 by August 1st, for our first project. This production will be the official launch of RMHMovement. Our first project is the first music video/visual for artist Terron Brooks’ #LoveMusic EP: https://itun.es/us/ovl9ab. Terron is a Singer, Songwriter, and Actor. He is best known for his role and portrayal of R&B/pop singer Eddie Kendricks in the 1998 NBC miniseries The Temptations. He is also a successful Broadway actor in The Lion King and Hairspray, and featured on numerous Film and T.V. soundtrack albums. Our mission is to create a “Visual” that will enhance the experience of what we are doing to change the world/music. ""Love is the focus, with the strategy to encourage another human being to make the decision to change their perspective of who they are in the world, overcoming past obstacles; to make an ultimate change in the course of their life.I would appreciate any amount you are able to give. 100% of the funds go towards RMHMovement’s projects. ""Your assistance will not just be utilized to produce a single project. The projects include versatile live stage shows, films and short films, music video/visuals for artists. The funding is needed for the production team, post production, crew, wardrobe, set/stage designer, talent, rehearsal space, location permits, marketing/media, various company fees, etc. Your contribution will benefit artists all over the world, and the people they touch through their artistry, by contributing to a movement and vision that Empowers artists and people. As a producer, I aim to inspire, educate, and provide opportunities for artists and people to tell their stories in the entertainment industry worldwide. I want to give individuals a voice with the art I create, and awaken the voice they may have never knew they had. Moreover, providing opportunities for a diverse group and a community of people that will allow them to find their artistic voice; will help shape and translate an array of messages through the versatility of the projects created. It is time to inspire and change lives in this world for the better. I also want to release work that uplift the artists involved in the process. People should shine and thrive in their art. That’s the kind of platform I want to create. A brand and company that people can trust. It is built on integrity and faith, delivers on what it says it is going to do, it gives individuals a voice, and it shares that voice boldly.THE BACKSTORYMy name is Reegan Haynes and I am originally from Washington D.C./Maryland, and I have over 20 years of experience in the entertainment industry; working with iconic figures who have helped shaped the industry into what you see today.  I am an alumna of Howard University which is one of the most prestigious Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCU) there is today, and I received my Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Theatre Arts Administration. I consider myself a renaissance artist. I have spent time studying and mastering specific areas of the arts; in an effort to use the culmination of my skills to create monumental creative platforms that reawaken how Art positively impacts people. Thus, reaching a bigger goal of using Art to align people with their purpose. Therefore, I utilize my skills and cultivate my talents through my ability to write, dance, choreograph, direct, and produce. Moreover, I am a Producer, Choreographer, Creative Director, Artistic Director (Theatre), Educator, and Writer who has performed on stage, in front of the camera, and has the knowledge of what it takes to work behind the scenes with a strong team behind the stage and camera.  In addition to the roles and responsibilities I have had the opportunity to flourish in, I am now the owner of my production company, RMHMovement, which provides production services for artists and companies for stage, television, and film. To add, my company specializes in the areas of choreography, artistic direction, creative direction, branding/marketing, film, and music video production. My job as an Artist is to maintain the continuity of developing quality work, and keep the integrity of the arts alive; while creating opportunities for artists to accomplish and reach their goals at an optimal level. RMHMovement is not only a brand I created, but it is a representation of who I am in relation to what I do. It is why I do what I do, with the God given talents and tools I have been blessed with. I know that I have been chosen as an artistic vessel, who is on a mission to pursue the rightful call of duties of helping other creatives and professionals achieve their goals. Other Ways You Can HelpI am asking for your help, and would appreciate any amount you are able to give. 100% of the funds go towards RMHMovement’s projects. Your contribution in sharing this campaign and getting the word out is greatly appreciated as well.  www.RMHMovement.comVimeo: RMHMovementInstagram: @rmhmovementFacebook:  https://www.facebook.com/RMHMovementTwitter: @RMHMOOVES

story:
In 2014, I visited MASS MoCA’s monumental exhibition of conceptual artist Sol LeWitt’s Wall Drawings. I walked towards his thousands of hand-drawn pencil lines and saw them instantly as dances. I decided then to perform one.

Choreographing LeWitt is a 25-hour performance—yes, 25 hours—that uses Sol LeWitt’s Wall Drawing #56 as a choreographic score.

I will perform the work over 5 days, this July 23-27, at Fridman Gallery in New York.

I am asking for your help to realize this ambitious, challenging, and willfully impractical project. I am working with a team of distinguished artists, designers, and producers, each contributing to a different element of the production from wall construction to video documentation.

Our team includes sound designer DAVE RUDER, designer ROSZA DANIEL LANG/LEVITSKY, videographers MATTHEW BERNARD and ESY CASEY, speaker builders IAN MUNRO and BRIAN McCORKLE, sound tech GUS CALLAHAN, and producer DIORAMA, plus additional artists who have been involved in the development of this work.

Contributions will go towards compensating these artists for their work and skill, as well as final production costs. 

 

 

We have received funding from New Music USA/ New Music for Dance, in-kind support from the Marina Abramovic Institute, and development residencies at the Knockdown Center, Brooklyn Arts Exchange, and the Center for Performance Research. However, we need to raise an additional $4,000  to cover artist fees, final production, documentation, and post-production costs.

 

And this work is just the beginning!

Choreographing LeWitt is the first work in my series Re-stagings. Re-stagings reads the works of visual artists—LeWitt, Richard Serra, Robert Morris, Carl Androe, Walter de Maria—as scores for performance, unearthing the bodies and choreographies implicit in these objects, drawings and texts. Any additional funds we raise will become seed money for our development of these future works.

 

Many ways to help!

1) Come to the performances. As line 3,000 of this work approaches, your presence is literally animating! 

2) Spread the word. We want to share this work!

3) Tell us what you thought. We want this project to spark conversation and debate!

RE-STAGINGS NO. 1: CHOREOGRAPHING LEWITT

July 23-27, 2017  |  12-6pm

Fridman Gallery  |  287 Spring Street, NYC

 

THANK YOU! THANK YOU for your support!

story:
Who we are and what we do

We are MaDe Collective, an artist duo formed by Marie-Eve G. Castonguay and Devon Thom. We met through the artist residency program at Harbourfront Centre, in Toronto, where became not only studio mates, but also great friends with grand ideas!

More than a year ago, we decided to invite Melanie Egan (Director or Craft and Design, Harbourfront Centre) and Paul McClure (internationally acclaimed artist and Jewellery Arts professor at George Brown College) to curate an exhibition that we would then propose for the official programming of Parcours Bijoux. Happening soon in Paris, France, Parcous Bijoux is a two-months long event entirely dedicated to contemporary jewellery from all over the world.

As our exhibition project was selected to be included in the official programming of Parcours Bijoux, we embarked on this glorious mission to promote Canadian contemporary jewellery internationally!

 

Parcours Bijoux?

A major international event, Parcours Bijoux 2017 will present over sixty projects, exhibitions and talks, bringing together artists, historians, collectors and jewellery lovers from numerous countries. Galleries, museums, cultural institutions and public spaces will be invested to display the multifaceted creativity that places jewellery simultaneously in a social, anthropological and aesthetic context.

Our exhibition will take place at Galerie Résidences, whose mission is specifically to promote contemporary jewellery. We were lucky to partner with this wonderful gallery, because the space itself will definitely be one the go-to places during the festival!

 

Impact

The main goal of this exhibition is to promote Canadian art jewellery on an international level. We want the global art jewellery community to recognize Canada as an up and coming hub for contemporary jewellery design. The artists included in the exhibition - Micah Adams, Alex Kinsley, Amir Sheikhvand, Jan Smith, Kye-Yeon Son, Lawrence Woodford, Alice Yujing Yan, Patrycja Zwierzynska and ourselves - will all greatly benefit from the visibility of this exhibition and event, and we hope that it will be a chance for them to create new contacts and perhaps get new opportunities.

And in the grand scheme of things, we want people visiting the festival to realize how much great work is being made in Canada and to pay more attention to what is being created here!

 

What we need, how you can help, and how we thank you!

The money raised through this capaign will help us with covering the fees that are engendered by such a project: festival participation fee, gallery rental fee, insurance, transportation, marketing, installation, etc. And we of course need to go to Paris, to work full-time at a gallery for ten days..!

To thank you for your kind help, we have tons of great things to offer! Tote bags, jewellery, jewellery courses and workshops, and our love and gratitude!

Screen printed tote bag

 

Sterling silver Pill Pin - Marie-Eve G. Castonguay

 

Sterling silver Pod Earrigns - Alex Kinsley

 

Pillars of my Youth brooch - Alex Kinsley

Coming and Going brooch - Marie-Eve G. Castonguay

 

Risks and challenges

We have been working on this project for over a year and half, and although it sometimes seems like an unsurmountable mountain, we have been making it work somehow! The show is approaching fast, and we need a final little push to be able to make this happen.

For a long time, we have been feeling like opportunities in art jewellery were lacking for Canadian artists, and we took it upon ourselves to try to change that. It is a huge challenge for us, but we know that it is worth it.

 

Other ways to help

We know that money doesn't grow on trees. If it did, we probably would not be asking for help! If you feel like helping out but can't afford it, plase share our champaign page with your network!

story:
We are currently organising an exhibition to be held in Shoreditch, London, on the 9th - 14th of July. This is a collaborative project between 19 photography graduates from the Manchester School of Art. 

The exhibition, called 'Surfaced', will be a platform on which we can present our work to the public and to those in the creative industries. In the past couple of years, we have each participated in successful photography exhibitions and have no doubt that this will be just as successful, if not more so. 
 
As this exhibition is independent of the university, we are limited by funding and materials. We have already raised around £4000 to pay the gallery rental, but we still have about £800 to raise to pay for our exhibition catalogue, a gallery technician, and the exhibition set up. 
 
Any contribution is greatly appreciated. Alternatively, you can buy prints on our online shop to show your support. If you're unable to donate, please share our exhibition to help us get the word out. 
 
 
www.surfacedexhibition.co.uk
tweet: @surfaced2013
like: Surfaced Exhibition
 
9 - 14th July, The Gallery in Redchurch Street, E2 7DP.
 
Surfaces are scratched with investigation, broken with momentum, and moved with determination. They are worked on, reconstructed, and polished. They shift, they evolve, and they protect the integrity of the whole. 
 
In 2013, the Manchester School of Arts' photography students have SURFACED

story:
WE'VE COME SO FAR!!!

We've transformed this dilapidated old warehouse in the hills of Umbria, Italy:

Into the thriving, international Academy of Art, Creativity and Consciousness:

We have created a Center for the Arts - and something more... The Academy of Art, Creativity and Consciousness is using the Arts to transform culture and consciousness. We are building a hive where artists and creatives from around the world can come to learn and share, explore and collaborate. 

Together we are pollinating the future with new energies, ideas, and ways of being. We have a unique approach; we use all the modalities of the Arts as vehicles for Awakening to Life - recovering the passion, potency and authenticity of the soul.  

The doors opened on September 1st, 2012, and we're already hosting world-renown artists, teachers, musicians, authors and speakers. We worked hard to finish the construction of the interior and exterior of the building...

 

BUT NOW WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!

Winter is coming, and in order to keep the creative juices and activities flowing, we need to finish the building!

Most importantly:

BRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!!!!

    • Purchase and install a heating system so it is possible to continue hosting Academy courses, workshops and events during the fridgid and snowy winter months.

    • Purchase and install wood flooring for dancers and dance programs, theater productions, and sound control (the space has amazing acoustic potential but desperatly needs the buffering of the finished floor).

     • Weatherproofing, insulating and sealing cracks, gaps, holes, etc for the coming winter.

    • Furnishing the Academy with tables, chairs and art supplies for art courses, concerts, theatrical productions, community events, and tons of other fun things!!! 

 

Who We Are: 

Founding director Dana Lynne Andersen MA is a luminary in the field of art and consciousness, pioneering the use of art as a catalyst for awakening consciousness.

For over 25 years she has offered unique "Transformative Arts Method" that uses all the modalities of the Arts as vehicles for awakening higher consciousness, and she has taught and exhibited on three continents. As the founder of “Awakening Arts”, an international network of artists committed to the creation of uplifting art, Andersen has founded several "Transformative Arts Studios" in the United States (Colorado and California). At the Academy of Art, Creativity and Consciousness, initiated in Italy four years ago, she spearheaded a certification program in the Transformative Arts Method. Dana received her bachelor’s degree cum laude in Philosophy, and her Master’s Degree in the Study of Consciousness from John F. Kennedy University.

 

The Academy is situated next to an international yoga tetreat center that draws thousands of guests from around the world, near the 'City of Peace" (Assisi, Italy) that draws millions of pilgrims.  We are bursting at the seams with people, energy, and programs that are ready to go - from weekend workshops with globally renowned artists and visionaries, to exhibitians, film screenings, an after-school arts program for our local school, community gatherings, concerts, kirtans, & much more.

 

The Academy is a living artistic hive for an international community of Creatives whose mission is to inspire and uplift human consciousness.

Our center is a place of connection for the emerging field of 'Art & Consciousness' a gathering place for artists and creatives of all modalities: painters, potters, sculptors, musicians, dancers, poets & playwrights - artists of film & multi-media, artists of sound, light & vibration, social artists and creative entrepreneurs ~  all sharing a common vision of using the arts to transform culture and consciousness.  

 

• CLASSROOMS    • GALLERY    • STUDIOS

CLASSROOMS: Our classroom will serve as a welcoming and nurturing environment for people of all levels to express creativity.  Everyone can discover the ‘Power of Creation.’

• At the Academy, students with no experience or "talent" work alongside practicing artists, together discovering the joy of the inexhaustible fountain within - the Fountain of Creativity, which unleashes a vitality that reinvigorates our lives.

GALLERY: The gallery portion of our Center will serve as a nexus for an international movement of vanguard artists.

• We support ‘Troubadours of Transformation’ who are using the modalities of the Arts to awaken the higher potentials of humanity.

STUDIOS: We will offer space for creative exploration and production to resident artists and visiting artist programs.

• In the heightened state of creative flow, insight and revelation stream through...we become vehicles for transformative power.

 

Join our International Nexus of Art, Creativity and Consciousness.

WITH YOUR HELP WE WILL THRIVE!!!

 

 

 

 

Artwork by Academy founder Dana Lynne Andersen:

Mystic River by Dana Lynne Andersen

 

 

The Divine Vision by Dana Lynne Andersen

story:
Our Story

Metachroma Theatre addresses the under-representation of visible minority actors in Canadian Theatre, challenging current perceptions by telling stories with a diverse cast in order to normalize the presence of these artists on stage.

Metachroma Theatre provides opportunities to visible minority actors in productions that once upon a time would have been denied to them, or where race and culture would normally be used for artistic interpretation only, intending to affect or heighten the story. This ultimately perpetuates the belief that a person of a distinct race or culture on stage is to be seen differently in plays where race and culture should not be the focal point; themes are the focal point of any story.

What We Need & What You Get

Producing theatre is an expensive, albeit rewarding investment.  From designers to actors, technicians to publicists, Metachroma Theatre promotes the highest quality of work its resources can provide.  Production costs are covered primarily through box-office revenue and through generous support from those that believe in our unique mission and in the evolution of arts throughout Canada.

The Impact

Your donation will help ensure that Metachroma Theatre begins and remains an active and important member to the cultural arts scene in Montreal, while also contributing to the Canadian Theatre landscape as a whole.  It will directly serve as an important resource for Metachroma's groundbreaking inaugural production of Shakespeare's "Richard III", and will provide artistic and employment opportunities for artists from across the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let people know about our inaugural production of "Richard III".  Stay plugged in to updates about the company and the production, and, of course, spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

- Hello! My name is Andrew. I have been a concert promoter in Salem for the past 13 years under the name 70x7 Productions. 

- For The Youth is a soon to be non-profit company striving to keep music and art in our local schools through the selling of merchandise (t-shirts, sweatshirts, stickers, CD's etc.) and the hosting of events and fundraisers. Each design and art piece will be unique in that they will be of limited run. Once they're sold, that's it!

As a music advocate for the past 13 years my passion is music and art. I have seen the ups and downs throughout our community and the struggles and triumphs of what it takes to have a solid music and art scene. I want to be able to give back and build up that community. I want the future generations to have something positive to look forward to. 

HOW WILL WE USE THE FUNDS: As a soon to be non-profit the money we make will be funneled back into the music and art programs in our local schools. We will do this by connecting with our local schools and teachers to find out the needs they need met and purchasing the necessary items they need to further the education of the students. Once purchased, we as a company will take these items to the schools personally. 

- As a backer, your contributions will help stimulate and fund a need that is slowly being depleted in our community. Future generations will reap the benefits in (a) huge way knowing that they have the options (and funding) to fulfill their dreams.

What We Need & What You Get

- We are looking to raise $10,000 within a 45 day time frame. The breakdown of funds goes as follows:

1) $6,000 will go towards the first batch of t-shirts to be made. This includes the purchase of the t-shirts, paying the printers, getting the screens. Also included in this will be shipping costs. We will also be printing quality poster prints of each design for use to sell. 

2) $2,000 wil go towards our advertising, ad time, promo needs such as fliers, website design. 

3)  $1,000 will go towards legalities such as: Start up cost for non-profit licensing, copyright for designs and names.

4) Remaining $1,000 will go towards our first contribution to a school in need. We would use this funding to launch awareness and provide a school with the supplies they desperately need. 

Lastly, if we do not fully reach our goal we will use the funds we have to make our first batch of shirts and the rest will be donated to a local school in need. 


The Impact

- The impact and value that comes with helping us reach our goal is ten fold. Knowing that you will help change and enhance a youths life through art and music; to which they can take that into the rest of their lives. Second, having a unique piece of art either on a piece of clothing, on your car (bumper sticker), or hanging on your wall. Third, knowing that what you are doing will help others strive to reach their dreams and goals. This project will help impact so many lives in so many ways and will continue to do so with your support. 

Lastly, by contributing it will help launch FTY (For The Youth) and their passion into making even bigger dreams come true. Including: A fully funded art and music center, band and art camps, fully funded music scholarships and much much more. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, we know not everyone can contribute but contributing isn't all about money. You can help in other, very important ways too! 

- Liking and sharing us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/ftyclothing)

- Sharing our indiegogo page with others. 

- Going to our events

- Volunteering to hand out fliers, package shirts and other merchandise. 

- Talk about us in your community, schools, churches, coffee shops. 

So, Thank you all in advance! Let's make the future brighter one t-shirt at a time. 


*STRETCH FUNDING #1*- If we reach $12,000 we will release 3 new colors for you to choose from (green, pink, purple etc.)

*STRETCH FUNDING #2*- If we reach $15,000 we will release 5 new colors. 

*STRETCH FUNDING #3*- If we reach $20,000 we will host a free block party event!

story:
"GIVE AN ARTIST THEIR WINGS!" 

~Clint Eccher


We have the venue, desire and now, NEED THE SUPPLIES!

                                        

 If you wish to learn more about me, here's my "About Me" page: All About Your Art Advocate

             My name is Karen Mary, and I taught art to middle/high school students in the public schools for over 22 years. I continue to be a certified teacher in both the States of Texas and Colorado. I realized how important art is to self-expression and now am an advocate for the arts and artists in Northern Colorado, mainly the beautiful city of Fort Collins, Colorado.

                  A few things I've provided for our town to keep artistic expression alive:

1) FREE HANGING FOR ARTISTS!

I found partnering businesses like Mary's Mountain Cookies, Advanced Animal Care of Colorado, and Choice City Drug who would allow artists to hang their work for free, and then keep 90% of their sales. These businesses even have advanced hanging systems for the artists I send to them! I also host low-cost shows for the artists to participate in which prove to be "key." In the past, I have gone "out of pocket" to provide these shows for our area artists: Scrumpy's Hard Cider Bar, Patero's Creek Brewery, Rio Grande Mexican Restaurant, Nordy's Bar B Q, Livermore Community Hall.

2) A 3 DAY TOUR for ART in Our City

 I recently published an ARTISTIC guide for a 3-day art tour for visiting our city which is hooked to my Art Advocate website.

3) Hosted Low COST SHOWS FOR ARTISTS

Visit my blog page on: www.artadvocateofnortherncolorado.com

Over 12 shows within two years!

I am hosting several large, low cost shows this summer which will support our mountain fire departments by donating booth fees and art sales. The artists who create with the supplies YOU PROVIDE will all be invited to be in the shows! It's a WIN WIN! AND YOU are making it possible!

 4) OLD TOWN ART (SUPPLIES ARE FREE!)

Now, I've developed the OLD TOWN ART program so that artists can create for free. 

This is where your help is needed!

                    This reason for the name, OLD TOWN ART is that In Fort Collins, Co, the district that thrives with artists is called, "Old Town" and many can walk or take bikes to our donated venues, Starry Night and Bas Bleu. The owner of Starry Night Espresso Cafe, Jen, is an art advocate herself, and has allowed many classes to take place in her small espresso cafe! We will also be gathering at the local theatre company, Bas Bleu Theater which is a NPO (non-profit organization), and a public entity founded by Wendy Ishii, and be able to meet in their lobby to create this summer! The theater will be offering us 8 dates and they are 2.5 hours each, so it's $17.00 an hour for a grand total of $340.00. Mugs Coffee Lounge this Weds the 16th 2-2:30 as well!

The OLD TOWN ART program will allow participating artists a comfortable venue, needed supplies and the support they crave to create. Ages 18-115 WELCOME! Then, they can go and sell the painting they've enjoyed making! All this is possible with your donation, as we all know how expensive art supplies are, and each class will now have everything it needs! I have come across the need for this as I'm privately messaged on a weekly basis about how artists are running out of supplies and not able to create. Colorado was hit hard last year and the year before by terrible natural disasters such as fire and flooding. The artists here could really use your assistance!

I have been supporting the arts in this area for over 7 years and am now asking the public for a little help. My art website is: ART ADVOCATE WEBSITE The dates for this SUMMER PROGRAM are all set up and listed on the WORKSHOP PAGE.

Perhaps you have friends who love art?

Perhaps you had a child who enjoyed art in school?

Maybe you collect art or create yourself?

You may even be a museum curator, or own a gallery!

Then this may touch your heart and be a campaign you can feel really great about!

ART Supply Funding

Your funds enable each class that we attend every other week (May -September from 6p.m. to 8:30 p.m. in Starry Night Espresso Cafe & 2-4:30 at Bas Bleu Theater Company) to have the needed supplies for each artist. Most classes HAVE ALREADY FILLED!!!

 A sign up sheet is required so that I know how many brushes, paints, canvasses and necessary supplies to furnish. The classes are 2.5 hours long which allows enough time to create, and if something doesn't get completed, the artist is welcome to come back or make an appointment with me a lot sooner than the next class to get the painting finished.

Acrylics, brushes, palette knives, canvasses, plastic palettes, dry towels, spray bottles, pencils, charcoal, pastels, oils and watercolors will be the supplies of choice. Any artist who signs up will have access to all of these supplies each time the gathering of Old Town Artists meet. We are on the schedule at Starry Night Espresso Cafe beginning May 12th and will run through Sept. 22nd., alternating Mondays throughout the summer. We are also on the schedule for Bas Bleu as well and meet from 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. on Weds., Thursdays and Fridays during the summer months.

If the goal for this project isn't met, the money given STILL goes to each class, but I will have to go "out of pocket" for the rest. That would diminish how many opportunities I can offer. I am simply asking for help, as the advertising for the low cost shows I've done in the past eats away the small booth fees leaving NOTHING left over in the pot for ventures such as these! I can't do it all myself! Your help is crucial.

The art created can be entered into the low cost shows that I put on in the summer months for the artists in Northern Colorado. The artists keep all proceeds!

Below are some beautiful, miniature pictures by local artist, Chelsea Delanie. 

Again, your gifts for donating will be sent in the form of artistic expression, similar to these beautiful miniature, canvas creations of Chelsea's by a local, Fort Collins, Colorado artist using the supplies you have made possible!

THANK YOU!

Each measures anywhere from 3"X3" to 5"X7" to 8"X10"

From top to bottom:

"Bee Mine" (rose and bee) 3"x3"

"Amber's Matryoshka Doll" 8"x10"

"Fringuello D'Autunno"- (finch) 5"x7"

"Dancing with the Current"- (octopus) 8"x10"

The Community Impact

Your contribution allows all of the interested artists more freedom to create and have the supplies at hand. Without this very important funding, I will have to take funds "out of pocket," can't provide the quantity of materials needed,  and don't always have funds available to me to use for the artist's supplies. I already have the first 4 classes filled up! While the artists create, they are also hoping to be in the on-going summer art shows that are in this area. Selling their art provides the means for them to continue their crafts. This circular pattern enriches our local artist's lives and our community as a whole. We will be placed at the front of Starry Night's glass window where people who are walking down College Avenue can stop and watch the artists in action! Children, adults and area CSU students will be able to watch the artists create every other Monday evening during the summer months!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have social media at your fingertips, and are not able to assist financially, please share this worthy campaign with your followers through twitter, links to art websites, and Face Book. Spread the art, so to speak and help us meet or beat our goal! ART IS LIFE and self expression is the very soul of a person put out into the world for all of us to ponder and enjoy its beauty! If you have art supplies you are not using and would love them put to good use, you are welcome to mail them directly to Karen Mary. Simply e-mail her for an address!

kc@carlsonfirm.com

Please read Steven A Reppert's plea on updates. Steven is a contemporary artist in Fort Collins, Colorado. 

"CHEYENNE" 
TSS - 1/2014
Acrylic On Canvas
36 1/2"H x 72 1/2"L

Thank you!

Everytime I go for a large project concerning art:
